He is an expert in his field, and his customers like dealing with him because his work is very good, he is clean and his customer service is excellent. To earn a second income, Tony plants tobacco and he pays severA. workers to harvest the crops. 
Toni is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, A. Majmoua, in order to improve his business by adding more products. He will also use the loan to pay his workers in his second business. Toni's garage is in a very good place and most passers-by visit him, which is a very good point. Toni hopes to improve and expand both businesses in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in his repair shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Janette

texts.en: Janette is a 30 year-old single woman.  Janette owns a shop in which she sells rice, beans, sugar, Irish potatoes, and green bananas. Janette started this business when she was 23 years old, and it has helped her to develop herself. Janette is requesting a loan to buy more green bananas,potatoes etc for her business to expand, and with the profits she wants to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more Irish potatoes, green bananas and other food stuffs .

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a single mother of four.  She is able to raise her children with the income she gets from selling old newspapers and magazines.  She has engaged in the business for four years.  She is a very hardworking lady who hopes to become a major supplier of newspapers in the future.  Her life has changed since she joined Faulu Kenya because of her improved business.  She has requested for 60, 000 Kes to buy more newspapers.

loans.use: to buy more newspapers

loans.name: Umar

texts.en: This is 37 year-old Umar. He is married, and has one child, aged 6. In 2008, Umar established his timber business. He began his business because he was inspired by a brother in the village to start the business.  He says, "I tried it and it works.  Now I am benefitting alot from this timber business."  Working 7 days a week and 9 hours a day, he earns about Le 500,000 every month. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to purchase more wood. In the future, Umar plans to acquire a brand new power saw so that he can also produce wood.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more timber for his business

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is the mother of four children between one and nine years old. She lives with her young family in Kisii Town in South Rift, Kenya. For the past five years, Eunice has practicing mixed farming. She sells bananas and maize at the local market and runs a cereal retail shop to generate additional income. She believes that poor markets and animal disease are the most pressing business challenges for all farmers. 

Eunice is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She is optimistic that her loan will improve her family’s nutrition and health as well as provide for her children’s education. Eunice urges Juhudi Kilimo to introduce a product that will fund education although she is happy with what has been done so far.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Joash

texts.en: Joash O. N. is 54 years old, married, and has four adult children, one of whom attends the university.  He runs a butcher shop and his wife is a teacher.  Joash employs one person in his business.  He joined Faulu Kenya so that he would save his money and access loans easily.  He hopes to open another outlet of his business in the future.   He is requesting a loan for 40,000 KES to buy a deep freezer and renovate his business premises.

loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer and renovate his business premises

loans.name: Isaias

texts.es: Isaias O. P. es un hombre de 62 años que vive en la zona sur de la ciudad de Barranquilla, allì en su vivienda tiene un negocio de ferreteria lla mado “ferromiscelanea”, que iniciò hace 8 años en compañía de una de sus hijas y posteriormente la comprò y se constituyò en la fuente de ingresos principal del hogar conformado por su esposa y sus 4 hijos,  hoy en las edades de  de 30 a 39 años. En Ferremiscelanea trabaja su esposa y un sobrino que son su gran apoyo en esta gestiòn y vende materiales de construcciòn y elementos de ferreterìa. Isaias està vinculado al programa de microfinanzas de la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo desde hace 12 años en los cuales ha recibido 9 financiamientos y hoy està aplicando a su primer credikiva, con el cual comprarà   estanterias y realizarà adecuaciones a vitrinas exhibidoras. Con sus creditos anteriores y el servicio de formaciòn empresarial ha logrado proyectar mejor sus inversiones y adicionar un capital con el que trabaja con el cual genera nuevas utilidades cada vez que lo invierte.  Ahora su gran sueño y tambien desafio es comprar un lote y adecuar una bodega de almacenamiento, para lograr separarlo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Isaias O. P. is a 62 year-old man who lives in the southern area of the city of Barranquilla.  He has a hardware store in his home which is called 'Ferromiscelanea'.  Isaias started his business 8 years ago together with one of his daughters.  He then bought it from her and it became the main source of income for his family which includes his wife and 4 children who are currently between the ages of 30 and 39.

Isaias' wife and one of his nephews work in 'Ferromiscelanea'.  They are a great support and sell construction materials and other hardware items.  Isaias has been working with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for 12 years and has received 9 loans  He is currently applying for his first Kiva loan which he will use to buy shelving units.  He will also adapt some display cabinets.  Through his previous loans and FMSD's business training service, Isaias has managed to better plan his investments and add capital to his business which he works with and from which he makes new profits every time that he invests it.  Now his biggest dream, and also his biggest challenge, is to buy a plot of land and set up a storage warehouse so that he can separate it from his home.

loans.use: to buy shelving units and adapt some display cabinets

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 41-year-old married man and the father of two young children. He is from Lebanon. He has been working as a blacksmith for the past 15 years. After having the needed experience in the same occupation, he decided to open his own shop in 2009. He is the main income provider of the family. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a small car for his business. He says that the car will facilitate his product delivery operations and make it easier.  He is optimistic about his business prospects and he is certain that with the help of the loan, his business income will augment.

loans.use: to purchase a small car.

loans.name: Benilda

texts.es: Benilda Isabel F. se dedica al comercio D. perfumes, cosméticos, útiles escolares  y prendas D. vestir especialmente, porque en su negocio venD. D. todo un poco, D. acuerdo con lo que solicitan sus clientes. Su experiencia data desD. hace 14 años cuando iniciò y sus  primeros pasos fueron pocos productos repartidos entre amigas muy cercanas, hasta que en el año 2009 iniciò formalmente aprovechando el aumento D. su mercado, por el importante nùmero D. referìdos  que hoy forman parte D. su clientela. Su éxito radica en la oferta D. calidad que hace D. sus productos, el otorgamiento D. plazos adecuados a sus clientes, a lo cual agrega su amable atenciòn la cual sostien a sus compradores  como firmes voceros D. su negocio.  Otra D. sus fortalezas en su  negocio es que  està ubicado en un esquina vehicular muy transitada por el pùblico, y las buenas relaciones que sostien con sus 4 proveedores, a quienes les compra los productos que ofrece mediante guias especializadas, aunque  tambien venD. otras mercancias que las revistas no tienen y que ella sabe que a sus clientes les gusta comprar. Su meta mas adelante es continuar aprovechando su ubicaciòn para vender bolis(bebidas congeladas a base D. frutas naturales) helados y refrescos. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo y con el comprarà al por mayor perfumes, labiales, desodorantes, cuadernos, lápices, sacapuntas y variedades; inversiòn que tendrà alta probabilidad D. èxito por que esta fundamentada en pedidos con plazos adecuados para sus permanentes clientes.
texts.en:
Benilda Isabel F. has a business selling perfumes, cosmetics, school supplies and clothes.  In her business she sells a bit of everything, according to what her customers ask her for.  She has 14 years experience and her first steps in this business were selling a few products to her very close friends.  In 2009 she started selling formally, taking advantage of the increase in her market, owing to the large number of referrals that now form part of her customer base.

Benilda's success is due to the quality of the products that she sells and the payment terms that she offers her customers.  Added to this is the kind service that she provides which enables her to keep her customers and also turns them into keen spokespeople for her business.  Another of her strengths is that her business is located on a very busy corner.  She also maintains good relations with her 4 suppliers from whom she buys her products through specialized catalogs.  However, she also sells merchandise that the catalogs don't have which she knows her customers like to buy.

Benilda's goal for the future is to continue taking advantage of her location in order to start selling 'bolis' (frozen drinks maD. from natural fruits), ice creams and soft drinks.  This Kiva loan is her first from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use it to buy perfumes, lipsticks, deodorants, exercise books, pencils, pencil sharpeners and other products wholesale.  This investment is very likely to be successful because it is based on orders, with appropriate repayment terms, from her permanent customers.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lipsticks, deodorants, exercise books, pencils, pencil sharpeners and other products wholesale

loans.name: Yenis

texts.es:
En su casa del barrio la Manga de Barranquilla,  Yenis O. tiene un pequeño almacén  de productos variados, entre cosméticos, papelería ropa, calzado y accesorios,  llamado: “Productos Yennys”.  Su idea emprendedora data de hace cuatro años, cuando observando el gran despliegue comercial del día de las madres en el mes de Mayo, la cantidad de tiempo que la gente gasta en la compra de detalles para obsequiar a las mujeres y el dinero que significa este ejercicio a las familias, decidió iniciar un negocio. aprovechando las oportunidades ofrecidas por cada  temporada comercial; Yenis comenzó con un capital proveniente de prestamistas informales a un alto costo, que hoy ha podido pagar, pero dejando de generar mejores utilidades netas y oportunidades de inversión en su negocio. 
Después de un trabajo disciplinado y persistente, Yenis cuenta con un capital de trabajo muy pequeño, que quiere ampliar mediante el financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y por eso está aplicando a un credikiva, para invertirlo en útiles escolares porque es la mercancía que más se mueve en esta temporada y le representa una buena rotación de productos y una pronta utilidad. Con su negocio está muy satisfecha porque ha logrado generar ingresos para resolver  necesidades básicas de su familia conformada por ella y sus  3 hijos que hoy se encuentran en las edades de 17 a 23 años. Su sueño y gran desafío es lograr aumentar sus ingresos para responder a los gastos, que genera el mejoramiento de las condiciones de vida de sus hijos, como las adecuaciones de su vivienda, educaciòn de calidad entre otros  y tambie lograr el crecimiento de su negocio, que se ve afectado por que solo trabaja con el capital personal que ella ha conseguido con sus propios esfuerzos.
texts.en:
Yenis O. has a small store in her home which is located in Manga neighborhood, in Barranquilla.  There she sells a variety of products, including cosmetics, stationery products, clothes, footwear and accessories.  Her business is called "Productos Yennys". 

Yenis had the idea of setting up her business four years ago when she observed the great commercial display that took place around Mothers' Day, in the month of May.  She saw the amount of time and the money that people spent buying little gifts to give to women.  As a result, she decided to start her own business, taking advantage of the opportunities offered by each commercial season.

Yenis started out with some capital that she acquired from informal lenders at a high cost.  She managed to pay this money back but she lost out on making better net profits and missed opportunities to invest in her business.  Through disciplined and persistent work, however, Yenis now has a very small amount of working capital that she would like to increase through this loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She is applying for a Kiva loan so that she can invest in buying school supplies because they are the merchandise that sells at this time of year and they will represent a good product turnover and a quick profit.

Yenis is very satisfied with her business because it has enabled her to make income to cover the basic needs of her family.  Her family consists of herself and her three children who are currently aged between 17 and 23.  Yenis' dream and greatest challenge is to increase her income so that she can respond to the expenses that come from improving her children's living conditions, adapting her home and providing her children with a good-quality education.  She also hopes to grow her business which has been affected by the fact that, up until now, she has worked solely with the personal capital that she has managed to make from her own efforts.

loans.use: to buy school supplies to sell

loans.name: Trad

texts.en:
Trad is a 30-year-old married father with three kids. He lives with his family in Bekaa. Trad works designing and selling souvenirs and, since 2007, he also sells chocolate, nuts, and coffee. Trad’s souvenirs are loved by his clients, most of whom are pregnant women, engaged or newly married couples, as well as people who enjoy nuts and coffee anytime. 

Trad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time. He will use his loan to purchase chocolates and buy necessary tools to make souvenirs, as well as purchase new souvenir models. He would also like to buy an espresso coffee machine to improve his customer service. In the future, Trad hopes to open another store.

loans.use: to purchase chocolates, tools, and souvenir models

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared N. is a 33 year old gentleman who is married to Joyce Aoko. Together they have two children, ages six and 13. For the past two years, Jared has sold second-hand shoes in the Gikomba market. He makes a monthly profit of 20,000 KES. 

Jared is a new client with KADET LTD. He has applied for his first loan to buy more stock for his shoe business. Jared anticipates using the profit from his loan to continue saving for his children’s education. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and become a shoe wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is 33 years old and married.  He runs a retail shop so as to earn his living.  Its four years since he started the business.  He also does farming for extra income.  He has witnessed a lot of change in his business since he joined Faulu Kenya.  He was able to move his business to the town centrer and then saw a growth in income.  He hopes to expand his business so as to become financially stable in the future.  He has requested 40, 000 kes to buy a motorbike for transporting business goods.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul K., age 36, deals in the repair and sales of electronic goods in the Kangemi area. This has been his business for the last seven years and he earns a monthly income of Kshs 150,000.
 
Paul is a new client at KADET Ltd and has requested his first loan of Kshs 80,000, which is the highest loan amount available to a new client. He will use it to buy a computer for business communication purposes and to add to his stock of electronic items. He hopes to use the anticipated profits to reinvest in his business.

He hopes to expand his business and open a financial institution in future. 

Paul married to two wives, Maryann and Charity, and is the father of two children, ages four and 11.

loans.use: to buy a computer for business communication purposes and to add to his stock of electronic items

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en: Francoise is 39 years old and has 5 children between 1 and 17 years old.  All but one of Francoise’s children are in school.  Francoise’s husband is a civil servant, and Francoise owns a shop in which she sells, rice, sugar, Vaseline, soap, eggs,various cookies and some food stuffs such as Irish potatoes. Francoise has owned this business for one year.  She requests this loan to buy sugar,Vaseline,soap etc for her shop. With the profits, Francoise intends to pay for her school fees, and to purchase a few domestic animals to raise.

loans.use: to buy vaseline,sugar,soap and food stuffs.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is 38 years old and married, with four children.  He operates Joma Motors where he mainly does vehicle repairs and maintenance.  He started the business thirteen years ago.  He was previously employed in a garage and went into business after getting enough experience.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has improved his business and raised his living standards.  With 30, 000 kes, he will buy gauges and pipes.

loans.use: to buy gauges and pipes

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy A., age 41, sells second-hand shoes from his stall at a big market in Nairobi called Gikomba. He has been in this business for the last 14 years and earns a monthly profit of Kshs 20,000. His wife, Ebby Kagena, supports him in the business. They have two children, ages 10 and 14.

Kennedy is a new client who has just joined KADET Ltd recently, and he has applied for his first loan, which he plans to use to add more shoes to his existing stock. He anticipates making a profit from this investment and plans to use it to expand his business as well as to open another market stall that his wife will manage.

Kennedy hopes to open more stalls in future and ensure that his family is well taken care of.

loans.use: to buy shoes to offer for sale at market

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margaret is married and has five children, four of whom attend school while the fifth has already graduated. They live in a house that they rent and which has electricity but not piped-in water. Her single largest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For more than 10 years, she has made a living running a retail shop where she sells household products to her neighbors. Her biggest challenge is the highly seasonal nature of her business. During winter, when it is very rainy, demand for her products falls off -- which is why she hopes to open a larger wholesale shop in the future. 

She has applied for a loan for Kshs 40,000 to buy bundles of wheat and maize flour, rice, sugar and cooking oil to sell to her customers. She decided to join Yehu microfinance to help secure funding for her business.

loans.use: To buy wheat and maize flour, rice, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 29-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife. He worked as an electrician specialized in electrical projects for seven years; then he decided to work as a freelance electrician in 2004. With his business income, he is able to handle heavy living expenses. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new electric tools instead of the used ones to offer his clients better quality service. He is confident that his work will continue to be successful in the future. He is looking forward to working on bigger projects in his community. This will be his second Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase new electric tools.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana forma parte del banco comunal “Mapuamulen” perteneciente a la ciudad de Concepción. Ella se dedica a la extracción de mariscos del mar, rubro que desempeña desde hace 12 años, en compañía de sus hijos, quienes se encargan de bucear, para adquirir los productos del mar. Su horario es flexible, ya que ella  sólo se encarga de vender lo extraído y reponer la implementación utilizada; específicamente trajes de buzo, mangueras, redes, para la extracción del producto. 
Adriana en éste momento se encuentra sin bote, ya que a causa del terremoto del pasado 27 de febrero de 2010, lo perdió completamente, por ahora sus hijos se encargan de arrendar el transporte (bote con motor compresor), ya que es muy costoso adquirir otro. 
Con el préstamo comprará mangueras y dos pares de aletas.
Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y así pueda invertir en él, de manera independiente. Su anhelo a nivel personal es ampliar su casa y cocina, además de decorarla. Por lo que sus motivaciones de continuar en el negocio son específicamente para concretar sus sueños. 
Adriana está muy agradecida de los créditos obtenidos por Fondo esperanza, ya que con estos préstamos ella ha progresado en su negocio y ha podido superar diferentes obstáculos. Debido a esto ha invertido en su negocio para generar mayores ingresos. Respecto a las capacitaciones ella ha aprendido a distribuir mejor sus ingresos.
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Bíobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
Adriana belongs to the Mapuamulen Communal Bank, located in the city of Concepcion.  She has been extracting seafood from the ocean for some 12 years now.  Her children assist her; they are in charge of diving for the products of the sea.  Her schedule is flexible, since she only sells what is extracted, and replenishes equipment; specifically, diving suits, hoses, and nets to extract the product.

At present, Adriana lacks a boat, due to the earthquake of February 27th, 2010, which completely destroyed hers.  Now, her children lease a boat with a motor-compressor, since it is very expensive to buy one.  With this loan, she will purchase diving hoses and 2 pairs of flippers.

Adriana's dream is for her business to grow and to be able to invest in it in an independent manner.  Her personal wish is to expand her house and kitchen, and to decorate them.  So, her motives for wishing to continue in the business are specifically to realize her dreams.

Adriana is very grateful for the loans she has obtained through Fondo Esperanza, since with these, her business has progressed and she has been able to overcome different obstacles.  It has made it possible for her to invest in her business and generate greater income.  As a result of the training classes, she has learned to better distribute her income.

Concepcion is located at the mouth of the Biobio River, one of the country's largest.  The region is in the south of Chile.  It has been important in Chile's history as the location of many battles and sieges, especially during the Arauco War, due to its location on the frontier of Mapuche territory.  At present, the city is undergoing important economic and demographic development, becoming one of Chile's most relevant urban, administrative, financial and commercial centers, after Santiago and Valparaiso.

loans.use: TO BUY DIVING HOSES AND TWO PAIRS OF FLIPPERS FOR FISHING

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en: Antoinette is 43 years old, married and has seven children who range in age from 6 to 25 years old. All of her children are in school. For the last five years,  Antoinette and her husband have worked together running a pharmacy. This business has done well and allowed Antoinette and her husband to sustain themselves and pay for life's necessities. Antoinette is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional income she and her husband earn to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more medications to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon K., age 22, is the sole proprietor of a spare parts shop in Grogan, Kagemi. He has been in this business for one year, and earns an income of KES.10,000 per month. He is unmarried and supports his parents.  

He has never borrowed from a microfinance institute before, and learned about KADET Ltd from a member of a group registered with the organization. He is applying for his first loan from KADET Ltd, which he plans to use to buy more spare parts, such as tires and tubes, to offer for sale.          

Simon intends to use the anticipated profit by increasing his savings and to start dealing in new spare parts from Dubai. In the future, he hopes to open an auto shop and connect with dealers in the area.

loans.use: to expand his stock for his spare parts shop with such items as tires and tubes

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a member of Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, in the Mvumilifu group. For nine years, he has been operating a retail shop and cafeteria. He serves a good number of customers each day. He also does farming for extra income. He has been able to educate his five children with the income from his business. Paul has managed to grow his business since he joined Faulu Kenya. He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy soda, bread and mobile phone airtime cards.

loans.use: to buy soda, bread and mobile phone cards

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood to offer for sale

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Maria Mercedes M. B. tiene 27 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN se encuentra ubicado en la Comunidad Guanto Cruz, parroquia Guanujo, pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 22 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en cultivo de mora, maíz, cría de animales de corral y vacas lecheras para la elaboración de quesos. 

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora y maíz y a la cría de animales de corral comprar sus productos en Guaranda y los vende en la feria de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y animales de cría y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es arreglar la casa.

Le gusta salir a  pasear por el pueblo y festejar las fiestas del sector.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes M. B. is 27 years old and married with one child.  She lives with her husband and son in the canton of Guaranda in the Bolívar province.

The members of the Communal Bank “Mushuc Nan” (“New Road” in Quechua) live in the Guanto Cruz community in the Guanujo parish in the canton of Guaranda.  This chapter of 22 members is dedicated to farming: they cultivate mulberries, corn, livestock and poultry, and raise dairy cows to make cheese.  

Maria works planting mulberries and corn and raising farm animals.  She buys her supplies in Guaranda and then sells her goods at the Guaranda fair.

She is requesting this loan to purchase supplies, livestock and animal feed.  A loan would help her to meet her financial needs.  She faces challenges such as pests and disease as well as changes in the weather.  Her dream is to fix up her home.  Maria enjoys taking strolls around the village and celebrating the holidays locally.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, livestock and animal feed.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is a member of Urafiki Development Group in Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya. He supplies water to earn a living. He employs one person to help him in his tasks. He was previously farming to make a living. Through Faulu Kenya, Amos has learned how to manage his business well. He hopes to grow his business so as to increase his monthly income. He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy water containers, a donkey and a cart.

loans.use: to buy water containers, a donkey and a cart

loans.name: Clemantine

texts.en: Clemantine is 36 years old, married to a driver and has four children aged between two and eight. They are all in school apart from the youngest. Clemantine owns a general store in which she sells several products such as rice, Irish potatoes, soap, sugar etc. She has been in this business for one year and it enables her to feed her family. Clemantine is requesting a loan to buy more items for her store.

loans.use: to buy more food items for her store

loans.name: Maria Andalisa

texts.es:
Maria Andalisa  A. T. tiene 31 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN se encuentra ubicado en la Comunidad Guanto Cruz, parroquia Guanujo, pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 22 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en cultivo de mora, maíz, cría de animales de corral y vacas lecheras para la elaboración de quesos. 

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora y maíz y a la cría de animales de corral comprar sus productos en Guaranda y los vende en la feria de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y animales de cría y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar mas terrenos para potreros y comprar ganado lechero.

Le gusta salir con la familia visitar a la familia festejar las fiestas del carnaval
texts.en:
Maria Andalisa A. T. is 31 years old, married and lives with her husband and children in the Guaranda Canton in the province of Bolívar.  She has five children.

The V.R.C. GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN women's group is from the Guanto Cruz community in Guanujo parish which belongs to the Guaranda Canton.  The group has 22 members who are all active in agricultural work, such as growing mulberries, corn, livestock and dairy cattle for cheese production.

Maria grows mulberries and raises livestock.  She buys her products in Guaranda and sells them at the Guaranda fair.

She is requesting a loan to buy farm equipment, livestock and feed.  This support will help her economically to meet her needs.  She is up against challenges such as plagues, illness and weather change.  Her dream is to buy more land for pasture and more dairy cattle.

She enjoys paying visits to other family members and celebrating the carnival festivities.

loans.use: To buy farm equipment, livestock and feed

loans.name: Maria Aurora

texts.es:
Maria Aurora M. P. tiene 33 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN se encuentra ubicado en la Comunidad Guanto Cruz, parroquia Guanujo, pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 22 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en cultivo de mora, maíz, cría de animales de corral y vacas lecheras para la elaboración de quesos. 

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora y maíz y a la cría de animales de corral comprar sus productos en Guaranda y los vende en la feria de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y animales de cría y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar terreno.

Le gusta salir pasear, tejer, y festejar las fiestas en la Comunidad.
texts.en:
Maria Aurora M. P. is 33 years old and lives with her husband and children in the Guraranda Canton in the province of Bolívar.  She has five children. 

The V.R.C. GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN women's group is from the Guanto Cruz community in Guanujo parish which belongs to the Guaranda Canton. The group has 22 members who are all active in agricultural work, such as growing mulberries, corn, livestock and dairy cattle for cheese production.

Maria grows mulberries and corn and raises livestock. She buys her products in Guaranda and sells them at the Guaranda fair.

She is requesting a loan to buy farm equipment, livestock and feed. This support will help her economically to meet her needs. She is up against challenges such as plagues, illness and weather change. Her dream is to buy land.

She enjoys walking, knitting and participating in the community festivities.

loans.use: To buy farm equipment, livestock and feed

loans.name: Maria Angelita

texts.es:
Maria Angelita R. R. tiene 34 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN se encuentra ubicado en la Comunidad Guanto Cruz, parroquia Guanujo, pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 22 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en cultivo de mora, maíz, cría de animales de corral y vacas lecheras para la elaboración de quesos. 

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora y maíz y a la cría de animales de corral comprar sus productos en Guaranda y los vende en la feria de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y animales de cría y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar mas ganado y dar el estudio a los hijos.

Le gusta salir pasear, tejer, y festejar las fiestas en la Comunidad y Navidad.
texts.en:
Maria Angelita R. R. is 34 years old, married and lives with her husband and children in the Guaranda Canton in the province of Bolívar.  She has five children.

The V.R.C. GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN women's group is from the Guanto Cruz community in Guanujo parish which belongs to the Guaranda Canton. The group has 22 members who are all active in agricultural work, such as growing mulberries, corn, livestock and dairy cattle for cheese production.

Maria grows mulberries and corn and raises livestock. She buys her products in Guaranda and sells them at the Guaranda fair.

She is requesting a loan to buy farm equipment, livestock and feed. This support will help her economically to meet her needs. She is up against challenges such as plagues, illness and weather change. Her dream is to buy more livestock and pay for an education for her children.

She enjoys walking, knitting and participating in the community festivities and Christmas celebrations.

loans.use: To buy farm equipment, livestock and feed

loans.name: Mercedes Yolanda

texts.es:
Mercedes Yolanda  A. M. tiene 23 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN se encuentra ubicado en la Comunidad Guanto Cruz, parroquia Guanujo, pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 22 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en cultivo de mora, maíz, cría de animales de corral y vacas lecheras para la elaboración de quesos. 

Mercedes se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora y maíz y a la cría de animales de corral comprar sus productos en Guaranda y los vende en la feria de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y animales de cría y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno y construir casa propia.

Le gusta salir con la familia y bailar en las fiestas.
texts.en:
Mercedes Yolanda A. M. is 23 years old, married and lives with her husband and children in the Guaranda Canton in the province of Bolívar.  She has two children.

The V.R.C. GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN women's group is from the Guanto Cruz community in Guanujo parish which belongs to the Guaranda Canton. The group has 22 members who are all active in agricultural work, such as growing mulberries, corn, livestock and dairy cattle for cheese production.

Mercedes grows mulberries and corn and raises livestock. She buys her products in Guaranda and sells them at the Guaranda fair.

She is requesting a loan to buy farm equipment, livestock and feed. This support will help her economically to meet her needs. She is up against challenges such as plagues, illness and weather change. Her dream is to buy land and build her own house.

She enjoys going out with her family and dancing at festivities.

loans.use: To buy farm equipment, livestock and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items such as bundles of wheat flour, rice, beans, and sugar to stock in her shop

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: La señora Bertha M. Q. de dedica al negocio de venta de comida estos almuerzos son repartidos a los trabajadores de la obras de construcción empezó el negocio hace 10 años es separada tiene cuatro hijos dos ya son mayores e independientes y dos están en edad escolar su sueño es construir su casa de material noble y poner un restaurante tiene buenas referencias , el dinero será invertido en comprar mesas y silla para su negocio y brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes se propone crédito .
texts.en:
Mrs. Bertha M. Q. operates a food stall and sells to construction workers in the area.  She began the business ten years ago.  She is separated and has four children, two of which are adults and live independently and the other two are in school.

Her dream is to build a house out of quality materials and set up a well-established restaurant.  She plans to use the loan to buy tables and chairs for her business so she can give her customers better service.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Ana Dolores

texts.es:
Ana Dolores M. R. tiene 24 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. loans.name: Nyerere Group

texts.en:
Richard M., who is in his late twenties, is married with three children.  He has a business of selling fish (lobster).  He is been in this business for 10 years. His business is open from 8.00 am to 9.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Richard's 5th Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. He has paid back his loans successfully. He hopes to obtain a loan to finish paying back the outstanding debt on the machine for his boat.

Richard will share his loan with his loan group, "Nyerere" which has a total of  11 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Richard is behind, 3rd from right back row.

loans.use: to finish paying back the outstanding debt on the machine for the boat.

She faces challenges in her work such as insect infestations, diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to enjoy a more comfortable life and have enough money to live on.

Feliciana enjoys the Christmas holidays because she spends them with her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies, animals to raise, and feed for her animals

She enjoys the festivals that are held in her community.

loans.name: Lindi Group

texts.en:
Mwanaid A., who is married with three children, has been a food vendor for 9 years. She works from 6.00 pm  to 11.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Mwanaid's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the food stock and pay school fees. She has paid back her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to increase food stock, and pay for school fees and household expenses.

Mwanaid will share this loan with her loan group, Lindi, which has a total of 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Mwanaid is 1st on the right with a red scarf on her head.

loans.use: to increase business, and pay for school fees and household expenses.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George lives in Kiambu where he does dairy farming. Besides this business, he operates a butcher shop. George is married and blessed with two children. He hopes to fully establish his business in the future.

He has been an active member of Faulu Kenya under Mwihoko group. Through the group, he has managed to get loans from Faulu Kenya.  He has used his previous loans to improve his farming.  He has requested another loan of 70,000 Kes to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children. She also cares for additional family members. Harriet has a business of selling beans. She has been in this business for four years, and she works seven days out of every week. Harriet has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO.

The main business challenge for Harriet is seasonality. Her goal is to grow her business and live comfortably. Harriet lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expense is rent.

loans.use: to buy more bags of beans

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is married with four children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is employed and he provides the family with basic needs from his earnings. For the last two years, she has operated a water distribution business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. 

Bahati faces a major challenge of seasonality and electricity black outs. During the dry hot season, the available water for distribution is inadequate to meet the customers' demand. She hopes to expand her business and satisfy her customers' needs.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase water pipes and water purifiers. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase water pipes and water purifiers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of Mumo group in Faulu Kenya. She runs a retail shop, and it's been ten years since she started the business. She also does farming to supplement her income.

Being a member of Faulu Kenya, she has benefited from her previous loans. She has managed to improve her business and she is now happy because she makes more profit. She hopes to expand her business into wholesale in the future. She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kes to buy crates of soda, biscuits, juice and sugar.

loans.use: to buy crates of soda, biscuits, juice and sugar.

loans.name: Dorine

texts.en:
For the past six years, Dorine has sold clothing from her home to her neighbors and to passers-by. Her husband is a tailor. They combine their incomes to support the family. They have five children, one of whom still attends school. 
   
Dorine joined Yehu Microfinance because it offers loans requiring few legal conditions to people who might not qualify for traditional bank loans. With her loan, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes (khangas) to offer for resale. Dorine dreams of establishing a big retail shop for selling khangas in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes (khangas) to offer for resale

loans.name: Gustavo Javier

texts.es: El joven Gustavo Javier P. R. es soltero no tiene hijos y tiene un negocio de cabinas de Internet y juegos de play station, inicio esta actividad con sus ahorros logrados por su trabajo como docente el cual ejerce despues de culminar sus estudios en un instituto de su ciudad,se vio obligado a poner este negocio debido al bajo sueldo que percibe,esta ganando experiencia por ello quiere mejorar el servicio a sus clientes adquiriendo accesorios que mejoren la experiencias de sus clientes su sueño a futuro es hacer crecer mas su negocio tiene buenas referencias vecinalesy se ve muy ordenado y empeñoso,es por ello que se propone el presente credito lo cual mejorara su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gustavo Javier P. R. is a young man with no children who runs an Internet cafe where he also offers Play Station games.  He started this business with some savings that he made from his job as a teacher, a job which he pursued after finishing his studies. He saw it as a necessity to start the business because of the low salary he was earning. He is gaining experience and wants to improve the services he offers to his clients buy purchasing accessories that improve their experiences. 

His goal for the future is to further grow his business.  He has good references, is very orderly and hardworking, this is why he is being offered the credit.

loans.use: to purchase accessories for his computers

She faces challenges in her work such as insect infestations, diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to work so that she has enough money to provide her children with a good education.

Maria enjoys having a rest.

loans.use: to buy supplies, animals to raise and feed for her animals

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 35 years old and married with three children. He has been farming for eleven years. He does dairy farming and also grows tea.

He joined Faulu Kenya so that he would access financial resources. Since then, he has improved his business, hence his living standards. He has requested a loan of 30,000 Kes to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Escolastica

texts.es: La Sra. Escolástica vive en la comunidad D. el Torno distante a 29 km D. la ciudad capital, es D. ocupación comerciante D. productos D. la medicina natural, el destino del crédito es para comprar una computadora para los estudios D. sus hijos, La Sra. Escolástica tiene  tres hijos D. los cuales uno esta a su cargo, su esposo se dedica a la venta D. madera, hace unos dos años que se dedica a esta ocupación; se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo financiero que se le ha dado, es nacida en el departamento D. Potosí a su corta edad se vino a trabajar a esta ciudad donD. formo su familia y ahora esta feliz con su trabajo y ver a su familia con mejores condiciones D. vida.
texts.en: Ms. Escolástica lives in the community of Torno, a 29 kilometer distance from the capital city.  She works as a natural medicine trader. The loan is for the purchase of a computer for her children's education. Ms. Escolástica has three children, of whom one is still dependent. Her husband has been dedicated to selling wood for the past two years. She feels grateful to the institution for the financial support that has been given. She was born in the Potosi region and came to work in this city at a young age where she started a family. She is now happy with her work and seeing her family in a better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a computer

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita was born in 1972 in Cotonou, Benin's largest city. She now lives in the Sémé-Podji district with her husband Eugène and their six children. All of their children are schooled.

For the past 10 years Anita has sold beauty products from her stall in the Abattoir district. This is her sixth loan with ALIDE following successful past repayments and will allow her to purchase stock in bulk from Tokpa, Benin's largest market. Her aim is to strengthen her business in the short term.

loans.use: to purchase stock of beauty products

loans.name: Hera Devi

texts.en:
Mrs. Hera Devi M. is a resident of Khokhana, lalitpur. Khokhana is one of the developing villages of lalitpur and most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.

Mrs. M. has four members including herself in her family. She has two sons aged 30 and 28. 

Mrs. M. is engaged in a goat rasing business. She sells goats in the local market. Now she is requesting a loan of RS 10,000.00 loan to buy baby goats for her business.

loans.use: to buys baby goats for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new tools needed for his business.

loans.name: Katty

texts.es: La Sra. Katty vive en la zona del 4to anillo, ella vive en la casa de sus padres junto con su esposo y sus hijos, ella tiene como negocio una tienda en la que vende sodas, bebidas, algunos abarrotes, y tiene su punto de llamadas, además de vender algunos cosméticos, con lo que vende diario ella ayuda a los gastos de su casa, ya que ella y su esposo tienen como sueño poder comprar su propia casa y así darle mejores oportunidades a sus hijos.  Su esposo trabaja en una empresa como barnizador de muebles, así que ella aprovecha y le vende a la empresa dos veces a la semana 40 litros de leche para los trabajadores. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora ya que en las mañanas empieza muy temprano a atender y esta por lo general hasta las 23:00 horas con al tienda abierta. Ella necesita el crédito para poder surtir su venta con más abarrotes que es lo que le han pedido los vecinos, luego piensa también comprar juguetes y regalos.
texts.en:
Katty lives in the '4th ring' district of the city of Santa Cruz (note: this city is split into a series of concentric circles - or rings - that radiate out from the city center.  Each 'ring' is 1-2km across and they rise in number the further they are from the center).

Katty lives in her parents' home together with her husband and children.  She owns a business where she sells soda, drinks and some groceries.  She also offers a phone service and sells some cosmetics.  Katty uses the money that she makes from her daily sales to help with her household expenses since she and her husband dream of being able to buy their own home and provide better opportunities for their children.  Her husband works for a company varnishing furniture.  Katty takes advantage of this and sells 40 liters of milk to the company twice a week for the workers.  She is a very hard-working person since she starts serving in her business very early each morning and generally keeps her store open until 11.00pm.

Katty needs this loan to stock her business with more groceries which is what her neighbors have requested.  She then plans to buy toys and gifts as well.

loans.use: to buy groceries to expand her business

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice lives in the Sémé-Podji district of Cotonou, Benin's largest city. She lives with her husband Léonard and their four children. All of their children are schooled.

For the past 8 years Anita has sold condiment products from her stall in her district. This is her fourth loan with ALIDE following successful past repayments and will allow her to purchase stock in bulk from Tokpa, Benin's largest market. Her aim is to strengthen her business in the short term.

loans.use: to purchase stock of condiments

loans.name: Rajeshwori

texts.en:
This is 35 year-old Rajeshwori M.. She is married and has 2 children aged 11 and 7. In 2000, she established her vegetable farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family.

She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy seeds and vegetables. In the future, Rajeshwori plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
 BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team"

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Maria Lucinda

texts.es:
Maria Lucinda R. M. tiene 21 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN se encuentra ubicado en la Comunidad Guanto Cruz, parroquia Guanujo, pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 22 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en cultivo de mora, maíz, cría de animales de corral y vacas lecheras para la elaboración de quesos. 

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora y maíz y a la cría de animales de corral comprar sus productos en Guaranda y los vende en la feria de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y animales de cría y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar terreno.

Le gusta visitar a los amigos de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Maria Lucinda R. M. is 21 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and 2 children in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.  

The 'GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUCÑAN' community bank is located in Guanto Cruz community, in Guanujo parish, in Guaranda canton.  The 22 members of this group work in agriculture, growing blackberries and corn.  They also raise farmyard animals and dairy cows for making cheese.

Maria is a farmer who grows blackberries and corn.  She also raises farmyard animals.  She buys her supplies in Guaranda and sells her produce in Guaranda market.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy supplies, animals to raise, and feed for her animals.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her work such as insect infestations, diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to buy a plot of land.

Maria enjoys visiting her friends in the community.

loans.use: to buy supplies, animals to raise and feed for her animals

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

For the past ten years, she has operated a milk sales business, selling from door to door in her neighboring community. She faces a major challenge with storage facilities for her business. Joan dreams of purchasing two motorcycles to supply milk faster in the future. 

With the requested 30,000 KES loan, she wants to pay for electricity in her house so that she can store milk in the refrigerator. She decided to work with Kiva's partner, Yehu, because it has no legal requirements.

loans.use: To pay for electricity in her house to store milk in the refrigerator

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies, animals to raise and feed for her animals

loans.name: Norah

texts.es: La Sra. Norah  vive en la zona del 4to anillo  zona Sur, ella vive en la casa D. sus padres y se dedica a la venta D. comida en las noches, actualmente ella esta separada D. su esposo por lo que ella sola mantiene a los dos hijos que tienen y que están en educación primaria, ella todos los días en las mañanas se prepara temprano para hacer sus comprar y luego preparar sus cosas para tenerlo listo al final D. la tarD. para comenzar a vender la comida, entre los platos que ella prepara están el Locro, pacumuto D. pollo y pacumuto D. carne D. res, como le va bien con este negocio ella desea implementar la venta D. Kjaras un plato que se ha hecho tradicional para vender los días viernes, para lo que necesita comprar la parrilla e invertir más dinero en la carne D. chancho para este plato en esta compra invertirá el crédito. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora por lo que está solicitando el crédito para ampliar el negocio, desea poder brindarles mejores oportunidades a su familia costear así la educación D. sus hijos y todos los gastos D. su casa.
texts.en:
Norah lives in the '4th ring' district, in the south of the city of Santa Cruz (note: this city is split into 12 concentric circles - or rings - that radiate out from the city center.  Each 'ring' is 1-2km across and they rise in number the further they are from the center).

Norah lives in her parents' home and her business is selling meals in the evening.  She is currently separated from her husband and she supports their two children alone.  Her children are in elementary school.

Every morning, Norah gets ready early to do her shopping and then prepares her things so that everything is ready at the end of the afternoon when she starts selling her meals.  She prepares dishes such as 'locro' (a traditional, thick stew), 'pacumuto D. pollo' (chicken skewers), and 'pacumuto D. carne D. res' (beef skewers).  As her business is doing well, she would also like to start selling 'kjaras', a dish that it has become traditional to sell on Fridays.  For this, she will need to buy a grill and invest more money in buying pork for this dish.  This is what she plans to spend her loan on.

Norah is a very hard-working person.  She is requesting this loan to expand her business.  She would like to be able to proviD. her family with better opportunities in life, pay for her children's education and cover all her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy a grill and food products

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Maria Dolores M. R. tiene 40 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN se encuentra ubicado en la Comunidad Guanto Cruz, parroquia Guanujo, pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 22 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en cultivo de mora, maíz, cría de animales de corral y vacas lecheras para la elaboración de quesos. 

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora y maíz y a la cría de animales de corral comprar sus productos en Guaranda y los vende en la feria de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y animales de cría y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar ganado.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Maria Dolores M. R. is 40 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children in the Guaranda canton of the Bolivar province.  She has 5 children.

The members of the V.R.C Women's Group Mushuc Nan are in the Guanto Cruz community, Guanujo parish and belong to the Guaranda canton.  This group of 22 members works in farming, growing mulberries and corn, raising livestock and dairy cattle and making cheeses.

Maria works in farming, raising mulberries and corn, and raising livestock.  She buys her supplies in Guaranda and sells her products in the market of Guaranda.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of supplies, livestock and animal feed.  The loan will help her to financially meet her responsibilities and overcome the challenges such as plagues, illnesses and climate changes.  Her dream is to buy livestock.

She likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy supplies and small animals and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es: Amelia, de 28 años, es una madre abnegada. Pues su esposo viajó al país de Estados Unidos a buscar trabajo. Ahora ella tiene que cuidar de su hijo Franklin, de 8 años, en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Palcamayo. Hace 7 años que comenzó a abrir una pequeña tienda de comestibles, poco a poco fue llenándola con dulces, bebidas, frutas y demás. Ahora, es la más abastecida de su localidad y todas las mañanas se encuentra llena de personas deseosas de querer comprar productos comestibles para el alimento diario. Asimismo hace 3 años que compró un terreno agrícola donde siembra; arveja, espinaca y demás hortalizas, los cuales mantiene con ayuda de peones que contrata temporalmente. Su principal deseo es mejorar su tienda de comestibles para poder salir adelante en compañía de su hijo, y de esa manera poder juntar dinero para viajar a EE.UU, en compañía de su esposo, para formar una buena familia. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde agradece la confianza depositada en ella; pues comenzará a mejorar su negocio. Amelia, invierte semanalmente en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de comestibles, por ello con el crédito comprará varios sacos de arroz, azúcar y demás bebidas.
texts.en: Amelia, 28 years old, is a self-sacrificing mother.  Her husband has gone to the United States in search of work.  Now she has to take care of her son, Franklin, 8 years of age, alone in her own home located in the Palcamayo area.  She opened a small food store 7 years ago and has been slowly supplying it with sweets, refreshments, fruit and such.  It is now the best supplied store in the area and every morning it is full of people wanting to buy food items for the day.  Also, three years ago she bought a plot of farm land and she grows peas, spinach and other vegetables, she takes care of these with the help of laborers that she hires for the season.  Her main goal is to improve the food store to be able to get ahead together with her son, and this way be able to save money to travel to the USA to be with her husband and be together as a family.  This is her first loan with MFP and she is grateful for the trust placed in her. as she can start improving her business.  Amelia buys weekly the  basic products for her food store, therefore she will use this loan to purchase bags of rice, sugar and various drinks.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, sugar and sodas.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: El cliente Daniel K. S. de 67 años de edad vive junto a su esposa. Tiene casa propia la cual se encuentra ubicada en el caserio Santa Dominguita. El cliente se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su negocio y además realiza labor de campo en sus horas libres. Su esposa tambien se dedica a vender en el negocio. El cliente nos comenta que su sueño es incrementar su negocio y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida. El está muy agradecido por el apoyo brindado a travéz de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Daniel K. S., 67, lives with his wife.  He owns his house which is located in Santa Dominguita.  He has a grocery store that he’s managed to have thanks to his efforts and using his savings.  His wife also sells at the store.  He also works as a field hand in his free time.

According to the client, his dream is to increase his business in order to have a better quality of life.  He is very grateful for whatever help we can provide through this financing.

loans.use: to increase the purchase of foodstuffs for his store

loans.name: Gopi

texts.en:
Gopi K. lives in Sanepa, Lalitpur. She lives with her husband Mr. Karna Dhoj and seven children. She has four daughter and three sons. Some of her daughters are studying and some are working in a private office. All of her sons are studying in secondary school.

Both Mr. and Mrs. K. are engaged in their own fruit shop. They sell different varieties of fruit in their shop. They opened their fruit shop 5 years ago in Sanepa-chock. Now, Gopi is requesting a loan of Rs. 25,000.00 to buy fruit for their shop.

loans.use: to buys fruit for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags, general clothing, cosmetics, powders, creams, and treatments

loans.name: Alina

texts.es: Alina, de 32 años. Vive en concubinato con Diego. Ambos tiene 2 menores hijos: Sarai y Cristofer; a los que alimentan y educan en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Miraflores. Todas las mañanas como hace 8 años. Alina se dirige con su esposo al caserío de Ayapata, lugar donde se ubican los terrenos agrícolas que posee. Sus principales cultivos constan de papa, maíz y demás hortalizas. Según cuenta, en temporadas de cosecha contratan con su esposo peones que les ayudan a extraer más rápido el fruto de la tierra, “eso me gusta”, afirma. Pero existen temporadas en los cuales las plagas azotan sus sembrío por lo que pierden el dinero invertido. Asimismo cuenta que siembra en terrenos extensos por lo que no tiene el capital necesario para la inversión de la cosecha. Por ello está planeando viajar a la capital del país a comercializar los alimentos por toneladas. Así ahorrará dinero para poder seguir sembrando. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera se siente agradecida por el apoyo que recibe de parte de los integrantes de su asociación. Alina, tiene sembrado arveja en sus terrenos agrícolas. Por el cuidado constantemente que tiene que brindar a sus cultivos, comprará con el crédito varios sacos de abono orgánico, como también fertilizantes naturales.
texts.en:
Alina is 32 years old.  She lives with her life partner, Diego.  They have two minor children, Sarai and Cristofer.  They are feeding and raising the children in their own house in the rural community of Miraflores.  

For eight years Alina and Diego have been going every morning to the village of Ayapata.  That is where their farming land is.   Their main crops are potatoes, corn, and other vegetables.  She says that at harvest time they hire workers to help them collect the fruit of their land more quickly.  “I like this,” she says.

However, there are seasons when their plants are in the grips of the pests, and they lose they money they invested.  She says that she plants on extensive fields, but does not have the money needed to invest in the harvest.  That is why she is planning to travel to the capital of the country to market the food by the ton.  That way she will save money in order to continue planting. 

She belongs to the Señor de Muruhuay Communal Bank.  This is her second loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the support she has received from the association members.

Alina has planted peas on her land.  Because of the constant care that she needs to give her crops, she will use the loan to buy various sacks of organic fertilizer.  She will also buy natural fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz Maria A. R. tiene 21 años, Es soltera con el  hijo en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN se encuentra ubicado en la Comunidad Guanto Cruz, parroquia Guanujo, pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 22 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en cultivo de mora, maíz, cría de animales de corral y vacas lecheras para la elaboración de quesos. 

Luz Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora y maíz y a la cría de animales de corral comprar sus productos en Guaranda y los vende en la feria de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y animales de cría y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es casarse y vivir en otra ciudad.

Le gusta salir a pasear y las fiestas del carnaval.
texts.en:
Luz Maria A. R. is 21 years old.  She is single and has one child.  They live in the Guaranda canton in the Bolívar province.

The members of the Mujeres Mushuc Ñan Communal Bank are located in the Guanto Cruz community, Guanujo parish, Guaranda canton.  This communal bank has 22 women who are farmers.  They grow blackberries and corn and raise poultry.  They raise dairy cows to make cheese.

Luz Maria plants blackberries and corn and raises poultry.  She buys her products in Guaranda and sells them at the fair in Guaranda.

She is requesting the loan to buy supplies, animals to raise, and feed for the animals.  The support of the loan will help her financially to get her necessities.  She faces challenges like pests, diseases, and weather changes.

Her dream is to get married and to live in another city.

She likes to take walks, and she likes the festivities at Carnaval.

loans.use: to get supplies, animals to raise, and feed for the animals

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es: La Sra. Vicenta Vive en la localidad de el Torno distante a 29 km de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, se dedica a la venta de comida, en el mercado central de la comunidad, es nacida en el departamento de santa cruz localidad de Yapacani, su esposo con el que tiene tres hijos, se dedica al transporte de persona con su vehículo en la ciudad de Santa Cruz "taxi"; el destino del crédito es para aumentar los insumos de su negocio ya que necesita abarrotes para la elaboración de sus platillos, es una persona muy trabajadora y su deseo es poder abrir una pensión ya así brindar comodidad a sus clientes; se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo económico que se le brindado.
texts.en:
Vicenta lives in El Torno which is 29 kilometers from the city of Santa Cruz. She sells food in the community’s Central Market.  She was born in Santa Cruz department in the town of Tapacani.  Her husband is a taxi driver in the city of Santa Cruz and they have three children.

The loan will be used to buy ingredients for her business because she needs groceries to prepare her dishes.  She is a hard working person whose wish is to open an inn to provide her customers with comfort.  She is grateful to the institution for the economic support it has provided her.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: Vicente L. M. es un hombre muy trabajador que para sostener a la familia se queda largas horas en la maquiladora para tener un ingreso extra. En este momento una persona le ofrece un terreno a un precio muy bajo, el cual no quiere desaprovechar esta oportunidad; pues este será su patrimonio para ofrecer a su familia. Vicente ya es una persona grande de edad el cual no desea ser carga para sus hijos, por lo que pide el apoyo para adquirir el terreno.
texts.en:
Vicente L. M. is a very hard working man who spends long hours at an assembly plant in order to support his family and have extra income.  

He is currently being offered a lot by a person at a very low price and he doesn’t want to miss out on this opportunity since it will be his family’s estate.  

Vicente is an older adult who does not want to be a burden to his children so is asking for help to acquire the lot.

loans.use: to buy a lot.

loans.name: Zoila Mercedes

texts.es:
Zoila Mercedes A. M. tiene 19 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y  con los  hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN se encuentra ubicado en la Comunidad Guanto Cruz, parroquia Guanujo, pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 22 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en cultivo de mora, maíz, cría de animales de corral y vacas lecheras para la elaboración de quesos. 

Zoila se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora y maíz y a la cría de animales de corral comprar sus productos en Guaranda y los vende en la feria de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y animales de cría y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar terreno y ganado.

Le gusta cocinar y lavar la ropa.
texts.en:
Zoila Mercedes A. M. is 19 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and two children in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.

The 'GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN' community bank is located in Guanto Cruz community, in Guanujo parish, in Guaranda canton.  The 22 members of this group work in agriculture, growing blackberries and corn.  They also raise farmyard animals and dairy cows for making cheese.

Zoila is a farmer who grows blackberries and corn.  She also raises farmyard animals.  She buys her supplies in Guaranda and sells her produce in Guaranda market.

Zoila is requesting this loan to buy supplies, animals to raise, and feed for her animals.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her work such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to buy a plot of land and some livestock.

Zoila enjoys cooking and washing clothes.

loans.use: to buy supplies, animals to raise, and feed for her animals

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is a 35 year old business lady. She runs a salon with one employee. She left employment five years ago and went into business. She also sells bags so as to supplement her family’s income.

She joined Faulu Kenya so that she could get finances to boost her business. Therefore, she joined Fountain group in Faulu Kenya, whose members guarantee each other loans. Through the group, she has requested a loan of 30,000 Kes. She will use the loan to buy a hair drier and bags.

loans.use: to buy a hair drier and bags.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a ladies shoes business and purchase bundles of shoes for resale

loans.name: Olive

texts.fr:
Olive est âgée de 38ans, célibataire avec un niveau 3em, mère de 3enfants dont l’âge varie entre 5 à 17ans.

Depuis 6ans, elle a ouvert son restaurant dans le grand marché  de son quartier, et elle y exerce cette activité avec zèle. Ses recettes journalières sont de 30.000F et 50.000F quand cela marche bien.
Elle privilégie les achats des repas journaliers à la demande de ses clients en tenant compte de leurs budgets.

Avec le prêt, elle veut acheter des vivres pour renforcer le stock  de son restaurant : 1carton de poisson salé, 1 panier de poisson fumé, 1sac de riz, 1bidon de 25litres d’huile, 1bidon de 10 litres d’huile de palme, 1 filets d’oignons, 1carton de tomates en boites, , 30kilos haricots, 10 fagots de bois, 1sacde charbons.

Moderniser son restaurant est son soucis majeur pour augmenter ses revenus , cela lui permettra de soutenir ses enfants dans leurs scolarité.
texts.en:
Olive is 38 years old, unmarried, and has [a 3rd grade education]. She is the mother of three children, aged 5 to 17. Six years ago, she opened her own restaurant at the main market in her district where she operates her business with zeal. Her daily receipts amount to 30,000 francs. When things are going well, they amount to 50,000 francs.

With this loan, Olive wants to buy some provisions for bolstering her restaurant's inventory: a box of salted fish, a basket of smoked fish, a sack of rice, a 25-liter container of oil, a 10-liter container of palm oil, a bag of onions, a box of canned tomatoes, 30 kg of beans, 10 bundles of wood, and a sack of charcoal.

Modernizing her restaurant is her main concern in order to increase her revenues. This will enable her to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy restaurant provisions, such as salted fish, baskets of smoked fish, containers of oil, bags of onions, and boxes of tomatoes.

loans.name: Rielma Benita

texts.es: La Sra. Rielma se dedica a la venta de verduras en uno de los mercados mas concurridos por las amas de casa por la venta variada de productos de primera necesidad, su puesto este bastante surtido.  La cliente es soltera y solo tiene una hija con la cual vive, ella vive en casa familiar donde se encuentra viviendo por 15 años.  Es una mujer que quiere superarse para poderle así dar a su hija una mejor condición de vida.  La cliente se encuentra trabajando con emprender desde el año 2004 donde comenzó con banca comunal desde entonces ha mostrado buen comportamiento de pago, es una persona responsable y trabajadora, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Rielma's business is selling vegetables in a market that is very popular with housewives.  She sells a variety of essential products and her stall is quite well stocked.  Rielma is single and only has one daughter with whom she lives .  Rielma lives in her family home where she has lived for 15 years.  She is a woman who would like to improve her situation so that she can provide her daughter with better living conditions.  Rielma has been working with Emprender since 2004 when she joined her community bank.  Since then, she has always shown good repayment behavior.  She is a responsible and hard-working person who is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: to pay for the extension of an "anticretico" rental contract

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her business with used clothes

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
Maria Rosa M. B. tiene 28 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y  con los  hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN se encuentra ubicado en la Comunidad Guanto Cruz, parroquia Guanujo, pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 22 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en cultivo de mora, maíz, cría de animales de corral y vacas lecheras para la elaboración de quesos. 

María se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora y maíz y a la cría de animales de corral comprar sus productos en Guaranda y los vende en la feria de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y animales de cría y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener huertos de mora de excelente calida.

Le gusta caminar con la familia por la comunidad.
texts.en:
Maria Rosa M. B. is 28 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and three children in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.

The 'GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN' community bank is located in Guanto Cruz community, in Guanujo parish, in Guaranda canton.  The 22 members of this group work in agriculture, growing blackberries and corn.  They also raise farmyard animals and dairy cows for making cheese.

Maria is a farmer who grows blackberries and corn.  She also raises farmyard animals.  She buys her supplies in Guaranda and sells her produce in Guaranda market.
