Maria is requesting this loan to buy supplies, animals to raise, and feed for her animals.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her work such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to have top-quality blackberry orchards.

Maria likes walking with her family around her community.

loans.use: to buy supplies, animals to raise and feed for her animals

loans.name: Forward Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Forward” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are petty-businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Gbassay F.. Gbassay was born in the northern city of Makeni 33 years ago. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a motor-bike taxi driver and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. 

Gbassay has been selling cosmetics, shoes, clothes, and rice for 5 years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, shoes, clothes and rice in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Zoila Victoria

texts.es:
Zoila Victoria S. M. tiene 21 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y  con los  hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN se encuentra ubicado en la Comunidad Guanto Cruz, parroquia Guanujo, pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 22 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en cultivo de mora, maíz, cría de animales de corral y vacas lecheras para la elaboración de quesos. 

Zoila se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora y maíz y a la cría de animales de corral comprar sus productos en Guaranda y los vende en la feria de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y animales de cría y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es construir la casa para vivir con la familia.

Le gusta caminar con la familia por la comunidad.
texts.en:
Zoila Victoria S. M. is 21 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and two children in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.

The 'GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN' community bank is located in Guanto Cruz community, in Guanujo parish, in Guaranda canton.  The 22 members of this group work in agriculture, growing blackberries and corn.  They also raise farmyard animals and dairy cows for making cheese.

Zoila is a farmer who grows blackberries and corn.  She also raises farmyard animals.  She buys her supplies in Guaranda and sells her produce in Guaranda market.

Zoila is requesting this loan to buy supplies, animals to raise, and feed for her animals.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her work such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to build a house to live in with her family.

Zoila enjoys walking with her family around her community.

loans.use: to buy supplies, animals to raise and feed for her animals

loans.name: Jocob

texts.en:
Jocob is 34 years old, married and blessed with two children who are in school. For four years he has been operating a retail shop where he sells vehicle spare parts.

Being a member of Faulu Kenya, he has benefited by getting business loans, and this has helped him to grow his business. He hopes to have a fully established business in the future. He has requested a loan of 30,000 Kes to buy shock absorbers, suspension arms and a steering wheel.

loans.use: to buy shock absorbers, suspension arms and a steering wheel.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es: Maricela R. Ortiz cuenta con un negocio de abarrotes desde hace 1 año, llamado Miscelánea “La Estrellita” donde ofrece abarrotes, refrescos, botas y mas. Este negocio lo instalo pensando en el bienestar de la familia y atender los quehaceres del hogar. Maricela de esta manera apoya a su esposa con los gastos por lo que necesita el apoyo para comprar mas mercancía y así obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Maricela R. Ortiz has had a grocery store, called “Miscelánea La Estrellita,” for the past year where she stocks groceries, beverages, snacks and others.  She started the business thinking of her family’s wellbeing and being able to take care of household chores.  Maricela helps her husband meet expenses this way and this is why she needs help to buy more merchandise and thus earn higher income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Maria Flor

texts.es:
Maria Flor S. S. tiene 47 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y  con los  hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN se encuentra ubicado en la Comunidad Guanto Cruz, parroquia Guanujo, pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 22 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en cultivo de mora, maíz, cría de animales de corral y vacas lecheras para la elaboración de quesos. 

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora y maíz y a la cría de animales de corral comprar sus productos en Guaranda y los vende en la feria de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y animales de cría y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es construir la casa.

Le gusta cocinar.
texts.en:
Maria Flor S. S., 47, is married living with her husband and children in Guaranda Canton, Bolívar Province.  She has two children.

The GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN communal bank is located in the community of Guanto Cruz, located in Guaranda Canton.  It has 22 members who farm blackberries, raise barnyard animals and dairy cows for cheese making.

Maria is a blackberry and corn farmer and also raises barnyard animals.  She buys her supplies in Guaranda and sells at the Guaranda Farmers Market.

She is requesting funds to buy supplies and animals to raise and feed for them.  Help from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  The challenges she faces are infestations, illnesses and weather variations.  Her dream is to build her house.

She likes to cook.

loans.use: to buy supplies, animals to raise and feed for them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase empty VCDs for recording and reselling at a profit

loans.name: Maria Estefanía

texts.es:
Maria Estefanía A. C. tiene 31 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y  con los  hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN se encuentra ubicado en la Comunidad Guanto Cruz, parroquia Guanujo, pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 22 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en cultivo de mora, maíz, cría de animales de corral y vacas lecheras para la elaboración de quesos. 

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora y maíz y a la cría de animales de corral comprar sus productos en Guaranda y los vende en la feria de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y animales de cría y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener terrenos y comprar vacas reproductoras.

Le gusta cocinar y arreglar la casa.
texts.en:
Maria Estefanía A. C., 31, is married living with her husband and children in Guaranda Canton, Bolívar Province.  She has five children.

The GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN communal bank is located in the community of Guanto Cruz, located in Guaranda Canton.  It has 22 members who farm blackberries, raise barnyard animals and dairy cows for cheese making.

Maria is a blackberry and corn farmer and also raises barnyard animals.  She buys her supplies in Guaranda and sells at the Guaranda Farmers Market.

She is requesting funds to buy supplies and animals to raise and feed for them.  Help from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  The challenges she faces are infestations, illnesses and weather variations.  Her dream is to own fields and to buy breeding cows.

She likes to cook and to do housework.

loans.use: to buy supplies, animals to raise and feed for them.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 33 year old business lady. She sells second-hand clothes to earn a living. It's four years since she started the business. She was previously selling timber.

Rose joined Umoja Ni Nguvu group in Faulu Kenya. She has been uplifted by the group members because the members guarantee each other loans, hence she can easily access loan. She used her previous loan from Faulu Kenya to boost her business. With the 40,000 Kes loan, she will buy shirts and trousers.

loans.use: to buy shirts and trousers

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: La Sra. Yolanda  se dedica a la venta de productos variados en uno de las calles mas concurridas dela ciudad, su puesto este bastante surtido.  La cliente es casada,  ella vive en casa familiar donde se encuentra viviendo por 15 años.  Es una mujer que quiere superarse para poderle así brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.  Con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería por docena para poder surtir su puesto, La cliente se encuentra trabajando con emprender desde el año 2004 desde entonces ha mostrado buen comportamiento de pago, es una persona responsable y trabajadora, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Yolanda sells assorted products in one of the city’s busiest streets; her stand is quite well stocked.  She is married and lives in the family home where she’s lived for 15 years.  She is a woman who wants to improve herself to provide her family with better living conditions.

She will use the money from the loan to buy merchandise by the dozen to stock her stand.  

She has been collaborating with Emprender since 2004 and has had good repayment behavior since then.  She is a responsible, hard working person.  She is grateful to the institution for the support it’s given her.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products like gifts and office decorations.

loans.name: Maingi

texts.en:
Maingi is a married man with two children. He runs a butchery and a cafeteria to earn a living. He has been operating the business for four years and has employed three people.

He has been able to grow his business with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya. He hopes to expand his business so that he can attract more customers. He has been guaranteed a loan of 60,000 Kes by his group members in Faulu Kenya. He will use the loan to buy meat, maize flour, cooking fat and baking flour.

loans.use: to buy meat, maize flour, cooking fat and baking flour.

loans.name: Salud

texts.es: Salud P. A. y su esposo que como pareja se apoya mucho desde hace 3 años optaron por dedicarse a mercado sobre ruedas ya que de esta manera les va mejor que en una maquiladora. La señora Salud vende ropa usada en diferentes tallas, colores y su esposo tiene el negocio de tacos y tortas denominado “Los Tres Potrillos”, para que sus ventas se incrementen desean que se le apoye para comprar mayor mercancía y así sus dos negocios sean prosperados ya que de esta manera es como cubren sus gastos.
texts.en: As a couple, Salud P. A. and her husband are very supportive of each other.  Three years ago they decided to start selling goods at flea markets since this was preferable to working in a 'maquiladora' (cross-border assembly plant).  Salud sells used clothes in different sizes and colors and her husband has a taco and sandwich business called 'Los Tres Potrillos'.  In order to increase their sales, they would like to buy more merchandise so that their two businesses can prosper since this his how they cover their expenses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alma Rosa

texts.es: Alma Rosa S. E. tiene una tienda llamada “Abarrotes Mena” que se encuentra activa desde hace 3 años ofreciendo a su clientela  calidad y variedad en producto de marca reconocida. La señora en este momento desea un préstamo para comprar más mercancía y tener surtido su negocio.
texts.en: Alma Rosa S. E. has a grocery store called 'Abarrotes Mena'.  She has owned her business for 3 years and offers her customers a variety of top-quality goods from well-known brands.  Right now, she would like a loan so that she can buy more merchandise and stock her business.

loans.use: to buy products for her business

loans.name: Polline

texts.en:
Polline is a 49 year old lady. She is a mother of three grown children who are above the age of 25. She has been able to raise her children on her own since she separated from his husband.

For a living, she runs a chemist. She was previously employed as a nurse. She has managed to improve her business with the loans from Faulu Kenya. She hopes to open a clinic in the future. She has requested a loan for 20,000 Kes to buy more medicines.

loans.use: to buy more medicines.

loans.name: Diamante Verde Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama Diamante Verde, está integrado por 7 personas:
*Caritina Rayón F. va a comprar con su préstamo artículos de papelería cuadernos, lápices, colores, pegamento, gomas, tijeras, reglas, etc. 
*Alicia H. A. va a comprar abono por carro para fertilizar su nopal y pueda producir más y así vender.
*Carolina A. Rayón va a comprar insecticida, abono para darle mantenimiento al nopal
*Candelaria T. Martínez va a comprar penca de nopal para comenzar a sembrar nopal y compra de abono por bulto
*Faustino H. T. va a comprar abono orgánico para fertilizar su producto y abonarlo para producir más nopal
*Román A. R. va a comprar abono orgánico por carro para fertilizar su producto de nopal
*Verónica Bautista González va a comprar mercancía azúcar por bulto, huevo por kilo, aceite por litro, sal, papel higiénico, arroz para surtir su tienda. 
El señor Román A. R. tiene 41 años de edad y tiene 2 hijos Brandon de 14 años de edad y Saira de 18 años de edad los dos no estudian terminaron la secundaria y ya no quisieron estudiar, el señor Román tiene su parcela de nopal y se dedica a vender nopal, el solicitó su préstamo para comprar abono orgánico para fertilizar su producto y tenga mucha producción de nopal. Él inicio su negocio hace 15 años porque vieron que si da ganancias y se vende mucho, de su negocio pudo comprar herramienta y su camioneta, la parcela que tiene fue herencia de su papá además él le enseño a trabajar en el campo todo lo relacionado con el nopal.
Las ganancias las utiliza para ir ampliando su negocio, sembrar mas nopales y si se puede comprar otro terreno, los desafíos que enfrenta el negocio son las heladas.
Los integrantes del grupo quieren decir a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por confiar en nosotros”.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Diamante Verde' (Green Diamond) and has 7 members:
*Caritina Rayón F., who will use her loan to buy stationery products such as exercise books, pencils, colored pencils, glue, erasers, scissors, rulers, etc.
*Alicia H. A., who will use her loan to buy manure by the cartload to fertilize her prickly pear cactus crop so that she can produce more and sell it.
*Carolina A. Rayón, who will buy insecticides and manure for her prickly pear crop.
*Candelaria T. Martínez, who will buy prickly pear stalks so that she can start growing prickly pear cacti.  She will also buy manure.
*Faustino H. T., who will buy organic manure to fertilize her crops so that she produces more prickly pear.
*Román A. R., who will buy organic manure by the cartload to fertilize her prickly pear crop.
*Verónica Bautista González, who will buy sugar in bulk, eggs by the kilo, oil by the liter, salt, toilet paper and rice to stock her store. 

Román A. R. is 41 years old and has 2 children: 14 year-old Brandon and 18 year-old Saira.  Neither of them are studying.  They finished their secondary education and didn't want to study any more.  Román has a plot of land where he grows prickly pear cacti.  His business is selling prickly pear.  He requested his loan to buy organic manure to fertilize his crop so can increase his prickly pear production.  Román started his business 15 years ago because he saw that the crop was profitable and sold well.  Through his business, he has been able to buy tools and a truck.  His plot of land was inherited from his dad who taught him everything he needed to know about growing prickly pear cacti.  Román uses his profits to expand his business, grow more prickly pear cacti and, if possible, he will buy another plot of land.  The challenge that he faces in his business is frost.

The members of this group would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad "thank you for trusting us".

loans.use: to buy organic manure by the cartload to fertilize their prickly pear cacti

loans.name: Esequiel

texts.es: Esequiel, de 20 años; es un joven soltero y trabador. Pues cuida de su papá Juan, su mamá Doris y sus 5 hermanos, en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Bellavista Huaracayo. Como hijo mayor, desde que obtuvo la mayoría de edad, comenzó a trabajar por su propia cuenta. Sus padres necesitaban su apoyo en la agricultura, que es su principal actividad económica, desde entonces le brindaron un terreno donde comenzó a sembrar arveja. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son las temporadas de cosecha, pues ve recompensado el arduo trabajo que desarrolla. Además comenta que siembra en baja escala por ello en temporadas de cosecha de café en la selva, viaja para trabajar como peón en las diferentes haciendas cafetaleras. “Tengo que trabajar en otros lugares para poder ahorrar dinero”, menciona. Su mayor deseo es convertirse en gran agricultor y sembrar en extensas hectáreas de terreno. Por ello trabaja sin descanso, esperando pacientemente el momento en el que pueda invertir con su propio capital.  Él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan. Esequiel, tiene sembrado papa de la variedad “super”, el cual muy pronto cosechará. Por ello con el crédito tiene pensado comprar varios sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Esequiel is 20 years old.  He is single and a hard working young man.  Esequiel looks after his dad Juan, his mom Doris and his five siblings in their own home which is located in the small village of Bellavista Huaracayo.  As the eldest son, Esequiel started working for himself as soon as he came of age.  His parents needed his support in their farming which is their main business activity.  His parents rovided him with a plot of land where he started growing peas.

What Esequiel most enjoys about his work is harvest time as that is when he sees all his hard work rewarded.  He also tells us that he grows crops on a small scale.  This means that during coffee harvest season in the jungle, he travels in order to work as a laborer on other people's coffee plantations.  "I have to work in other places in order to save money", he says.  Esequiel's greatest wish is to become an important farmer and sow his crops over many hectares of land.  In order to achieve this goal, Esequiel works without rest, waiting patiently for the moment when he can invest with his own capital.

Esequiel is a member of the "Señor de Muruhuay" community bank and this is his first loan with MFP.  He is grateful to MFP for the opportunity that they have given him.  Esequiel currently has a crop of 'super' variety potatoes growing which he will harvest very soon.  He will use this loan to buy several sacks of organic manure.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo L. M. es un hombre muy trabajador que desde hace 4 años adquirió su vivienda de interés social, en este momento el desea remodelar la cocina ya que con el tiempo se ha deteriorado el cual necesita unas mejoras para que se vea en mejores condiciones. Para esto necesita comprar material de construcción y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en: Pablo L. M. is a very hard-working man who acquired a publicly-subsidized house four years ago.  Right now, he would like to remodel his kitchen since it has deteriorated over time.  He needs to make some improvements in order to restore it to a good condition.  For this, he needs to buy building supplies and hire laborers to carry out the work.

loans.use: to remodel his kitchen

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es: El señor Marcelino se dedica a la agricultura es casado con la Sra. Albertina ella Ama de casa pero le ayuda a su esposo en la agricultura, el Sr. Marcelino  es nacido en Cochabamba. El 30 de Octubre de 1980 hace 12 años que vive y trabaja en Espejo a 10 km del Torno donde tiene su parcela y su pequeña casa de ladrillo en la cual trabaja sembrando Maíz, papa y arroz pero también tiene una fabrica de ladrillo, hace recientemente unos 6 a 7 meses que esta en proceso de ensamblarlo con maquinas a corriente, es una persona muy trabajadora, el dinero del crédito será destinado para la compra de semillas para la siembra de papa y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado .
texts.en: Marcelino works in agriculture. He is married to Albertina. She is a housewife and helps her husband with the farming. Marcelino was born in Cochabamba on October 30 of 1980. For 12 years, he has lived and worked in Espejo, 10 km from Torno. He has a land parcel with a little brick house, where he works planting corn, potatoes and rice. For about 6 or 7 months he has had a brick factory with power tools to make them. He is a very hardworking person. The money for the loan is destined for buying seeds to plant potatoes, or soil preparation. He is grateful to the institution for the support it has offered.

loans.use: to plant potatoes and prepare the soil.

loans.name: La Huizachera Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama La Huizachera se encuentra en el Estado de Morelos, está integrado por 5 mujeres ellas son: María Guadalupe (pastelería) Josefina (tienda de abarrotes, Lucia (antojitos mexicanos) María de los Ángeles (antojitos), Cecilia (venta de ropa). 
La señora Lucia M. Sánchez tiene 34 años de edad, estudio hasta el tercer año de secundaria, ella es casada, su esposo es Jornalero, trabaja en el corte de cebolla, ellos tienen 4 hijos Isai de 11 años de edad está estudiando el 5º. Año de primaria, Isaac tiene 9 años de edad está estudiando el 4º. Año de primaria, Noé tiene 6 años de edad  está estudiando el primer año de primaria y Emanuel de 4 años de edad. 
La señora Lucia solicito su crédito para su negocio de comida va a comprar verduras, servilletas, papel estraza, vasos, etc. Sus clientes son sus vecinos que tienen sus negocios, los turistas que pasan a comer, ella ofrece a sus clientes picaditas, dobladas, tacos de arroz y los sábados y domingos les ofrece pozole, tostadas, tacos dorados, quesadillas, ella inicio su negocio hace 1 año, y aprendió a cocinar porque trabajaba en un negocio de comida y decidió independizarse puso su propio negocio con sus ahorros que tenia de su trabajo, su negocio se encuentra localizado en la colonia Rafael Merino esta a 10 minutos de su casa, llega caminando, su negocio es importante de ahí se apoya para los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos, a la señora Lucia le gusta mucho cocinar y ella quisiera aprender más para tener varios guisados en su cocina, ella se siente orgullosa de salir adelante con su familia y se siente útil ayudando a su familia gracias a su esfuerzo pudo ahorrar, fue muy útil para invertirlo en su negocio de comida, los desafíos que enfrenta su negocio son cuando no hay trabajo en tiempos de lluvias bajan las ventas, ella está planeando ampliar su negocio quiere vender cocteles de frutas y lo piensa lograr con el préstamo que va a recibir, ella está muy feliz y emocionada porque va a lograr lo que tenía planeado ampliara su negocio, las mejoras que desea hacer a su vivienda son repellar su casa y tener su cocina independiente ahorita la tiene junto con la recamara, sus planes y esperanzas para sus hijos son que tengan mejores condiciones de vida y en su educación escolar sigan adelante. 
Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “Gracias por tener confianza en nosotros, con estos préstamos podemos realizar nuestros sueños, poner nuestros negocios más grandes y más bonitos”.
texts.en:
This group of five committed women is called La Huizachera, and they live in the state of Morelos. Their names and occupations are María Guadalupe (cake store), Josefina (grocery store), Lucia (Mexican snacks), María de los Ángeles (snacks), and Cecilia (clothing sales). 

Señora Lucia M. Sánchez is 34 years old and reached third year of high school. She is married; her husband is a casual labourer and works in Corte de Cebolla. They have four children: Isai (11) in fifth grade, Isaac (9) in fourth grade, Noé (6) in first grade, and Emanuel (4).

Sra. Lucia is seeking a loan to buy vegetables, napkins, wrapping paper, glasses etc for her food business. Her customers are her neighbours who have their own businesses and tourists looking for somewhere to eat. She serves picaditas, dobladas, rice tacos, and on the weekends pozole, tostadas, tacos dorados, and quesadillas. Lucia started her business a year ago and learned to cook. She had experience in the food industry and decided to open her own business using her savings. It is located in the Rafael Merino neighbourhood, about 10 minutes from her house, so she is able to walk there. It is important as it pays for her children’s educational expenses.

Lucia really enjoys cooking and wishes to learn how to cook more dishes. She is proud that she and her family are getting ahead in life, and proud too that she can save money because of her hard work. One of the challenges she faces is the lack of customers during the rainy season. She is planning to expand her business and wishes to sell fruit salads. She is hoping to do this with the loan money. Lucia is very happy and excited because she is going to be able to do what she planned. She is also planning to make some improvements to her home and have a separate room for her kitchen--it is now part of the bedroom. As for her children, her hope is that they can have a better standard of living and continue with their education.

The members of the group wish to thank Kiva and Fundación Realidad for trusting in them: “With these loans we are able to fulfill our dreams and make our businesses bigger and better.”

loans.use: to buy vegetables, napkins, wrapping paper, glasses etc

loans.name: Maria Marlene

texts.es: La Señora Maria Marlene, tiene 36 años y es madre de 2 hijos, ambos a su cargo. Maria es una mujer eficiente y capaz, se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general y serigrafía, nos cuenta que le está yendo muy bien en su negocio. Su puntualidad, orden y optimismo le ayudó a crecer como mujer independiente y está muy orgullosa con lo logrado. Con este crédito para comprar camisas, pantalones, faldas, trajes de baños, bolsos, calzado entre otros. Se siente una mujer realizada por lo que agradece esta oportunidad. Este medio de vida le da la tranquilidad a ella y a su familia ante cualquier situación que le pueda ocurrir.
texts.en:
36-year old Sra. Maria Marlene has two dependent children. She is an efficient and capable woman who sells general merchandise and silk-screen prints. Her business is doing very well. Her punctuality, discipline, and optimism have helped her become an independent woman, and she is proud of what she has accomplished.

With the loan Maria will buy shirts, pants, skirts, swimsuits, bags, and footwear etc. She feels fulfilled and is grateful for the opportunities she has had. Her job gives her and her family peace of mind that they can overcome any problem that occurs.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, skirts, swimsuits, bags, and footwear etc

loans.name: Together As One Iii Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Together As One III” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each of them. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

John N. is the leader of this group. The 38 year old is married to a housewife and they have 6 children. John has been a businessman for 17 years now; he sells bicycle spare-parts such as chains, tires, inner-tubes, hubs, etc. With his share of this loan, he will buy the above mentioned items in large quantity to add to his current ones.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, such as chains, tires, inner-tubes, hubs, etc., in large quantity

loans.name: Amador

texts.es: Amador, de 36 años vive en concubinato hace 14 años con Rosina. Ambos tienen 3 hijos, a los cuales quieren y protegen en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Huasahuasi. La siembra de papa, arveja, flor de gladiolo y habas, es su principal actividad económica. El cual siembra en terrenos que alquila anualmente, ya tiene 18 años de experiencia, en todo este tiempo aprendió todas las técnicas de cultivo por ello obtiene buenas ganancias en cada cosecha que comercializa en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad. Su principal dificultad es la falta de apoyo, pues tiene que contratar peones para que le ayuden a mantener y cuidar sus cultivos, por ello está pensando invertir en el negocio de compra y venta de hortalizas y arveja. Donde podré obtener ganancias diarias, pues venderá al menudeo. Él pertenece al banco comunal “progreso carita”, y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecido por todo el apoyo que recibió en todo este tiempo. Amador, invertirá en compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico, para esparcirlos entre sus cultivos de arveja, asimismo comprará verduras por kilos para comenzar su negocio de venta por unidad.
texts.en:
36-year old Amador has lived common-law with his partner Rosina for fourteen years. They have three children whom they take care of in their own home located in Huasahuasi. Amador grows potatoes, peas, gladioli flowers, and beans on land that he rents on an annual basis. He has 18 years experience so has learned all there is to know about farming. Each harvest brings in a good profit when he sells the produce in the wholesale market in town. 

The main difficulty that Amador faces is the lack of help. He has to hire labourers to help him look after his fields. For this reason he is thinking of investing in a business to buy and sell garden produce and peas. He would be able to earn more money by selling at retail prices.

Amador belongs to the Progreso Carita Community Bank. This is his seventh loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he is grateful for all the support he has received over the years. He plans to use this loan to buy several sacks of manure to spread on his fields of peas. He will also buy vegetables and start his new vegetable-selling business.

loans.use: to buy manure and vegetables for his new business

loans.name: Santa Rosa Buena Vista Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Rosa Buena Vista tiene como representante a Ofelia López A. de 49 años quien vive en unión libre con el señor Enrique O. Soriano. Tiene 3 hijos de los cuales todos ya están casados. Ofelia solicito el crédito para comprar más productos para su tienda ya que desea que este préstamo le ayude aumentar su negocio y obtener un poco mas de ganancia para así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida y tenga para comer todos los días.
Laura Rosario López Román de 27 años de edad, vive en unión libre con el señor Panfilo Mozo Gutiérrez quien trabaja en el campo, tiene 3 hijos de las respectivas edades: 8, 5 y dos años de los cuales 1 estudia el segundo año de primaria. Laura se dedica a la venta de Perfumes y Ropa, sus ventas las realiza de casa en casa con sus familiares, vecinos y amigos. Tiene 2 años realizando esta actividad económica debido a la necesidad que tenia, ya que su hija entraría a la primaria y necesitaría más dinero y con lo que esposo gana no le alcanza y es por ello que decidió vender estos productos. Con el crédito que obtuvo compro más mercancías como son: blusas, faldas y pantalones así como algunos frascos de perfumes; para así obtener más ganancias y ayudar con los gastos de la familia.
La meta de Laura es que sus hijos estudien y tengan una profesión para que así tengan mejores oportunidades el día de mañana y no sufran las necesidades que viven ahora.
Las personas que integran este grupo son las siguientes:
Brenda M. V.: De 23 años de edad se dedica a la compra de ropa para la venta.
Juana V. Pérez: De 35 años de edad se dedica a la compra de insumos para la venta de antojitos.
Socorro Ramírez L.: De 51 años de edad se dedica a la compra de insumos para la venta de antojitos.
Martina C. F.: De 33 años de edad se dedica a la compra de perfumes para la venta.
Ofelia López A.: De 49 años de edad se dedica a la compra de abarrotes, verduras y ropa para la venta.
Anastacia C. Bacho: De 69 años de edad se dedica a la compra de pescado y marisco para la venta.
Doris Jiménez G.: De 24 años de edad se dedica a la compra de insumos para la venta de antojitos. 
Laura Rosario López Román: De 27 años de edad se dedica a la compra de ropa y perfumes para la venta.
Edilia C. Hernández: De 30 años de edad se dedica a la compra de pescado y marisco para la venta.
Flora O. Hernández: De 47 años de edad se dedica a la compra de zapatos y perfumes para la venta.
Iván C. Ramírez: De 21 años de edad se dedica a la compra de herramientas para la construcción.
José Enrique O. López: De 26 años de edad se dedica a la compra de herramientas para el trabajo de hojalatería.
texts.en:
The Santa Rosa Buena Vista group has Ofelia López A. as a representative. She is 49 and lives in a common law marriage with Mr. Enrique O. Soriano. She has 3 children, who are all married. Ofelia asked for the loan to buy more products for her store. She wants the loan to grow her business and make a little more income in order to have a better quality of life and have food to eat every day.  

Laura Rosario López Román is 27 years old. She is in a common law marriage with Mr.Panfilo Mozo Gutiérrez, who works in the field. She has 3 children, whose ages are 8, 5 and 2 years old. One of them is in second grade. Laura sells perfume and clothing. She makes her sales from house to house with her relatives, neighbors and friends. She has been doing this economic activity for 2 years out of need, since her daughter will start primary school and she will need more money, and what her husband makes is not enough. That is why she decided to sell these products. With the loan that she obtained, she bought more merchandise, such as: blouses, skirts and pants, as well as some bottles of perfume, in order to have more income and help with the family expenses.  

Laura's goal is for her children to study and have a profession so that they will have better opportunities tomorrow and not undergo the need that they are living through now.  

The people who make up this group are the following: 
Brenda M. V.: 23 years old, she buys and sells clothes. 
Juana V. Pérez: 35 years old, she buys ingredients and sells snacks.
Socorro Ramírez L.: 51 years old, she buys ingredients and sells snacks.
Martina C. F.: 33 years old, she buys and sells perfume.  
Ofelia López A.: 49 years old, she buys and sells groceries, produce and clothing.  
Anastacia C. Bacho: 69 years old, she buys and sells fish and seafood.  
Doris Jiménez G.: 24 years old, she buys ingredients and sells snacks.
Laura Rosario López Román: 27 years old, she buys and sells clothing and perfume.  
Edilia C. Hernández: 30 years old, she buys and sells fish and seafood. 
Flora O. Hernández: 47 years old, she buys and sells shoes and perfume. 
Iván C. Ramírez: 21 years old, he buys and sells construction tools.  
José Enrique O. López: 26 years old, he buys and sells bodywork tools.

loans.use: to buy groceries, produce and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mi Fortaleza En Cristo 5 Group

texts.en:
Mayra is the coordinator of her group 'Mi Fortaleza en Cristo 5' (My Strength in Christ), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in Santiago, a large city known for its tobacco and beef production, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their three children.
Mayra is excited to be taking out her first loan with Esperanza, after she was invited by other women in her community to be part of their group and receive a loan for her beauty salon. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying hair and beauty products. She will use the profits to invest in saving towards her goal of expanding her local business into a bigger one, and to buy more equipment. She dreams of having her own house and of giving her family a better life. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy hair and beauty products

loans.name: Peace Gardering Group

texts.en:
Baby B. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Baby was born in Kenema city about 32 years ago. She is married and has one child. Baby sells clothes and has been managing her business for five years now.
This is the first loan that Baby and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Baby will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business by buying a large quantity of 'bamako' clothes to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of 'bamako' clothes to add to her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 40 años es una luchadora madre soltera. Vive junto a sus 2 hijas: Salome y Noe, en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Carita. Hace más 20 años se dedica a la siembra de papa, habas y arveja, en sus 2 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas que se sitúan paralelo a su casa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son las horas de trabajo que requiere sacar el fruto maduro de la tierra, pues siente la alegría de poder vender sus cultivos después de tanto tiempo de trabajo. Según afirma en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de tarma le compran a muy buen precio sus cosechas. Su mayor dificultad son los gastos que realiza en los estudios universitarios de sus hijos. Ahora está planeando viajar a la capital del país a comercializar sus sembríos, pues ahí son más cotizados. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “progreso carita”, y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde se siente realizada, pues el poyo que recibe de parte de su asociación le permite progresar. María, tiene sembrado habas y arveja en sus terrenos agrícolas. Por ello con el crédito comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico, para que sus cultivos maduren grandes y nutritivos.
texts.en:
María, 40, is a tenacious single mother living with her two daughters, Salome and Noe, in her own house located in the hamlet of Carita.  She’s been farming potatoes, broad beans and peas for over 20 years on her two hectares of farmland located next to her house.  What she enjoys most about her work is the hours needed to extract ripe fruit from the soil because she feels happy seeing her crops bear fruit after so much time. According to what she tells us, her crops are bought for very good prices at Tarma’s wholesale market.  

Her greatest difficulty is the expense associated with her children’s university studies.  She is planning to travel to the nation’s capital to sell her crops because they are priced higher there.

She belongs to the “Progreso Carita” communal bank and this is the ninth loan with MFP where she feels fulfilled because the support she gets from her association allows her to progress.

Maria has broad beans and peas planted in her fields so will use the loan to buy several sacks of organic manure so that her crops grow big and nutritious.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Candida Rosa ha sido bien trabajadora y se esfuerza con brindar el mejor servicio. Su negocio es una librería, desde hace mas de 6 años que tiene este negocio, De esta manera ha logrado mejorar con el paso del tiempo la producción de sus negocios que llegan a comprar directamente a su negocio, considera que la actividad es muy beneficiosa para su familia ya que tiene disponible el alimento para su propio consumo aunque tiene deseos de incursionar en otro tipo de negocio. El crédito es para la compra de reglas, hojas en blanco, borradores, lapicero, regla, engrapadoras, folders.
texts.en:
Candida Rosa has been quite hard working and she strives to provide the best service.  Her business is a bookstore; she’s had it for over six hears.  She has managed to improve her business over time where customers come directly to buy; she feels this activity is very beneficial for her family because she has food for their own consumption available although she’d like to go into a different type of business.

The loan is to buy rulers, blank sheets of writing paper, mechanical pencils, staplers and folders.

loans.use: to buy rulers, blank sheets of writing paper, erasers, mechanical pencils, staplers and folders.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy napkins, corn, beans, thread, needles, embroidery hoops, beads, pins, etc.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa, de 58 años, es una mujer luchadora. Hace 2 años enviudó, y desde entonces se hace cargo de sus 2 menores hijos. Con los cuales vive en el caserío de Carita. Desde hace 35 años, comenzó a dedicarse a la agricultura, donde sembraba en compañía de su esposo. A pesar de estar sola, sigue trabajando con mucho ahínco.  Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, arveja y maíz; los cuales siembra en sus terrenos propios. En todo este tiempo pudo obtener buenos compradores, pues vende la semilla de papa que produce; a los grandes comerciantes mayoristas. Además de tener 3 vacas lecheras, donde hace queso, que vende en la feria los días domingos. Ahora ella se está preparando para la cosecha de papa y maíz, donde espera obtener buenas ganancias. Pues sus planes son mejorar sus cultivos, para tener mayores ganancias y así pagar los estudios de sus hijos, ya que es el único sustento de su familia. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “progreso carita”, y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecida por el apoyo que recibió en todo estos años. Elsa, muy pronto cosechará sus cultivos de papa y maíz. Por ello con el crédito comprará semillas de papa de la variedad “primeriza”, asimismo 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja.
texts.en: Elsa, 58, is a tenacious woman.  She was widowed 2 years ago, and ever since she has been the sole provider for her 2 minor children.  She lives with them in the rural Carita settlement.  She has been farming for 35 years; she started out farming with her husband.  Despite being alone, she continues to work with a lot of effort.  Her main crops are potatoes, peas and corn, and she cultivates these on her own land.  Over all of this time she was able to secure good buyers, as she sells the seeds of the potatoes that she produces to the big wholesale traders.  In addition, she has 3 dairy cows, and she makes cheese that she sells in the market on Sundays.  Now she is getting ready for the harvest of potatoes and corn, and she hopes to get good earnings.  She plans to improve her cultivations so she can have better earnings and this way pay for the education of her children, since she is the only person supporting the family.  She belongs to the communal bank "Progreso Carita," and this is their 7th loan cycle with MFP.  She is grateful for the support that she has received from MFP over the years.  Very soon, Elsa will harvest her potato and corn crops.  With this loan, she will buy potato seeds of the "Primeriza" variety, as well as 2 sacks of pea seeds.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and 2 sacks of pea seeds

loans.name: Alawally Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the Alawally group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan that these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living.
The leader of this group is Salamatu B.. Salamatu is aged 40. She was born in Kenema city where she lives with her husband and two children. Her husband is a businessman and her children attend school. Salamatu sells shoes and has been in this business for many years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy dozens of shoes to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy dozens of shoes for resale

loans.name: Amapolas De Puente Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Amapolas de puente" y se ubica en el estado de Morelos en México. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes  y es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito. Yesenia Bárcenas Rodríguez es integrante del grupo, tiene 25 años, estudio hasta el 3 año de  secundaria, es casada y tiene  2 hijos, una mujer y un varón, ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes negocio que inicio hace 2 años, solicita el préstamo  para  comprar más perfumes para que su negocio crezca, sus clientes se sienten a gusto con ella por la atención que les da y por que les entrega a tiempo sus pedidos, al momento de solicitar el crédito se siente a gusto porque podrá entregar todos sus pedidos que le  solicitaron y con las ganancias comprara material para empezar a construir los cimientos de su casa.
texts.en:
This group is called “Amapolas de Puente” (Puente Poppies) and is located in the Mexican state of Morelos.  It has 9 members and this is their second loan request.

Yesenia Bárcenas Rodríguez, 25, is a group member.  She finished 9th grade, is married and has two children, a boy and a girl.  She sells perfume, a business she started two years ago.  She’s asking for the loan to buy more perfume so that her business will grow and her customers will feel good about the attention she gives them and because she fills their orders on time.

She feels good about the loan because she’ll be able to deliver all her pending orders and will use profits to buy building materials and supplies to lay the foundation and start building her house.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise.

loans.name: Léonie

texts.fr: Madame Léonie a 40 ans et est mariée. Elle a à charge 4 enfants. Pour participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de ses enfants, elle vend à la devanture de sa maison les charbons de bois à Baguida. Elle achète les marchandises à Anié et cumule 9 ans d’activité. Elle sollicite un prêt pour acquérir 40 sacs de charbons de bois et ainsi  satisfaire plusieurs clients.
texts.en:
Mrs. Léonie is a 40-year-old married woman. She has four dependent children. 

In order to improve her children’s living conditions, she sells charcoal in front of her house in Baguida. She buys her stock in Anié. She has nine years of experience in this activity. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase 40 bags of charcoal and satisfy more customers.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for resale

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, de 46 años, es una valerosa madre soltera, que cuida de sus 2 menores hijas: Mabelia y Yelit, en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Huasahuasi. La hermosa sonrisa de Yolanda, es producto de la vida tranquila que lleva en el campo, pues ya tiene 20 años dedicándose a la agricultura. En todo este tiempo logró obtener buenos resultados, pues ya tiene sus propios terrenos agrícolas en el caserío de Huacas. Donde todos los días desde muy temprano sale a limpiar y fertilizar sus sembríos de papa y arveja, productos que son vendidos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Asimismo por las tardes se dedica a la venta de anticuchos a base de corazón de carnero, vendiendo un promedio de 50 unidades diarias. Su principal dificultad son los gastos que realiza en los estudios de enfermería de su hija, donde invierte mensualmente. Los planes que tiene es sembrar en mayores cantidades, para poder pagar los estudios superiores de sus hijas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “progreso carita”, y este es el quinto crédito que tiene con MFP, donde se siente muy contenta, pues le apoyan en el desarrollo de su trabajo. Yolanda, cosechará gran cantidad de arveja, por ello con el crédito comprará una bolsa de semilla de arveja que le falta para comenzar su sembrío.
texts.en: Yolanda, 46 years old, is a valiant single mother who cares for her two young daughters, Mabelia and Yelit, in her own home, which is located in Huasahuasi. Yolanda's beautiful smile is a product of the tranquil life she lives in the country. She has 20 years of experience in agriculture. All this time she has been getting good results. Now she has her own farm land in the small town of Huacas, where every day starting early in the morning, she gets up to water and fertilize her potato and pea crops. These products are sold in the main market in the city of Tarma. In the afternoon she sells kebabs made of ram's heart; she sells about 50 each day. Her main challenge right now is the expenses associated with her daughter's nursing school, which she is paying monthly. Her plan is to plant more crops so she will be able to pay for both her daughters' college. She belongs to the Progreso Carita Community Bank, and this is her fifth loan through Kiva partner MFP. She is very happy with the group because they have helped her develop her business. Yolanda will grow a large quantity of peas, so with this loan she will purchase the bag of pea seeds that she needs to start planting.

loans.use: to purchase a bag of pea seeds

loans.name: Edem  Ayoko

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Ayoko a 25 ans. Elle habite quartier Adakpamé à Lomé.  Elle est couturière de profession mais elle a associé la vente de pagnes et articles de mercerie. Elle a commencé en 2007 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Elle revend dans son atelier à Adakpamé à côté de la station Oando. Elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter 20 pagnes et un lot d’articles de mercerie. Mais présentement, elle n’a pas le stock de pagnes et d’articles de mercerie.
texts.en: Ayoko is 25 years old. She lives in Adakpamé, a neighborhood of Lomé. She is a trained seamstress and she has included the sale of fabrics and haberdashery in her business. She began her activity in 2007 and she purchases her products at the main market in Lomé. She works and sell her products in her workshop in Adakpamé, next to Oando Station. She is requesting a loan to buy twenty fabric pieces and some haberdashery, as she is running out of stock.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and haberdashery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, beans, flour, beef, coal, oil, fish, and coffee

loans.name: Blanca Berta

texts.es:
Doña Blanca, tiene 68 años D. edad, resiD. en San Miguel, es casada, vive con su esposo, tiene dos hijos pero ya no viven con ella, el negocio D. doña Blanca es la venta D. productos D. cerámica y recuerdos, inicio hace 20 años, trabaja D. lunes a sábado D. 8:00am a 5:00pm, la elaboración D. los recuerdos la aprendió en una academia, una D. sus ventajas es que es sociable y tiene muchas amistades.
Actualmente ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. materiales para elaborar arreglos florales, también adquirirá adornos y recuerdos D. cerámica, esta inversión le ayudara a fortalecer y continuar en el negocio, ya que D. él dependen los ingresos para cubrir los gastos D. ella y su esposo.
Su objetivo es tener trabajo por un buen tiempo, dar abasto a la demanda y estar solvente con todas las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
Blanca, 68, lives in San Miguel.  She’s married, lives with her husband, and has two children but they don’t live with her any longer.  Her business is ceramic items and keepsakes sales.  She started it 20 years ago and works from Monday through Saturday from 8am until 5pm.  She learned how to make the keepsakes at an academy.  One of her advantages is that she’s sociable and has lots of friends.

She is asking for the loan to buy supplies to make flower arrangements; she’ll also acquire decorations and ceramic keepsakes.  This investment will help her strengthen and stay in business because income to cover her and her husband’s expenses comes from it.

Her objective is to have work for a good long time, to meet demand and to be solvent to meet all household needs.

loans.use: to buy flower arrangements and ceramic items.

loans.name: Amunifa Group

texts.en:
Here we see the members of the Amunifa loan group. Each is a small-scale businesswomen who lives in the city of Kenema. This is the first time they have requested a loan from SMT/Kiva lenders, and they each hope to use their portion of the funds to expand their businesses, make more sales and earn larger profits. 

Massah M. leads this group. She was born in Kenema, is 41 years old, is married to a miner and has six children. For many years now, she has made a living selling pepper. She will use her portion of this loan to expand her business by buying more pepper to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To expand five small businesses

loans.name: Dora Elizabeth

texts.es:
Dora, tiene 35 años D. edad, vive en compañía D. su madre, un tío, y los hijos D. ella, quienes tienen 5 y 7 años D. edad, es empleada D. una comercial como encargada D. la administración, lleva 12 años D. laborar en este mismo lugar.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. un lote, ya que se le presenta la oportunidad D. comprar el terreno, su dificultad es no contar con el fondo total para adquirirlo, este préstamo será su gran apoyo para realizar los trámites, aumentado así el patrimonio.
En este terreno ella tiene como meta construir la casa, para llevarse ahí a sus hijos, viviendo en lo propio y más cómodos.
texts.en:
Dora, 35, lives with her mother, an uncle and her children who are 5 and 7 years of age.  She’s employed by a firm in the Administration department; she’s been working at the same place for 12 years.

She is asking for a loan to buy a lot because the opportunity to buy it has presented itself and her difficulty is not having the entire amount needed available.  This loan, then, will be a great help to carry out all the procedures to increase her estate.  Her goal is to build a house on this lot to go live there with her children to be more comfortable living in a place of their own.

loans.use: to buy a piece of property.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: María del Rosario T. C. se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace 2 años para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. El negocio solo lo ponen los fines de semana ya que son días buenos donde hay mayores ventas. La señora en este momento se ve en la necesidad de comprar ropa de temporada por que en esta ciudad las temperaturas en verano son muy altas por lo que la gente busca ropa ligera para no tener calor. Es por ello que María del Rosario quiere invertir en su negocio para que sea prosperado.
texts.en: María del Rosario T. C. has been selling used clothing for two years to help her husband with household expenses. She only runs her business on the weekends because those are the days with the best sales. She now wants to purchase more seasonal merchandise since in her city the summer temperatures are very hot, and so people seek out lighter clothing. This is why she wants to invest in her business to make it more prosperous.

loans.use: to buy clothing to resell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Help Sisters Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Help Sisters” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, earn more profits, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Sereh S.. Sereh is 30 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a teacher. Sereh sells foods, such as peppers, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, onions, etc. She has been selling these items for many years. With the help of this loan, she is going to buy peppers, margi, salt, onions, etc. in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: To purchase peppers, margi, salt, onions, etc.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: La señora Rosa H. González y como otras mujeres que salen adelante con sus hijos, es un ejemplo de muchas que a pesar de estar solas emprenden un negocio para el sostener de su familia para tener una vida digna y con las mejores comodidades. Rosa desde hace 10 años se dedica al mercado sobre ruedas, ubicado en las banquetas y en ocasiones en la plaza de la ciudad; ofreciendo variedad de producto para dama y caballero como lo que es maquillajes, bolsas, carteras, ligas, diademas, esto con el fin de ofrecer a sus 4 hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Para seguir teniendo mayores ventas quiere comprar mas mercancía en diferente estilos y novedades para cumplir cada gusto de su clientela y así sus ventas se incrementen.
texts.en: Rosa H. González, like other women who succeed with their children, is an example of many who, though they are single, learn a business to support their family and have a dignified life with the best comforts. Rosa has been a mobile vendor for 10 years, selling on the sidewalk and sometimes in the city center. She sells a variety of products for women and men such as makeup, purses, wallets, garters, and hairbands, all to give her four children the best quality of life. To continue stocking her business and being profitable she needs to buy more merchandise in different styles so that her sales will increase.

loans.use: to buy products for women and men such as makeup, purses, wallets, garters, and hairbands.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. Margarita vive en la zona de la Villa 1ro de Mayo, ella vive allí hace más de 5 años, ella se dedica a la venta de comida que entrega todos los días a los obreros de una construcción, ya que su esposo es Constructor Contratista. Así que ella esta haciendo compras cada dos o tres días y la mayoría de los trabajadores el cancelan de forma quincenal, por lo que ella necesita de capital de trabajo para realizar sus compras, como arroz y además de que está por comprar envases personales para cada almuerzo, ya que actualmente entrega en platos desechables para cada almuerzo con el dinero del crédito comprara todo esto.  Ella tiene 4 hijos a los cuales ayuda a mantener con su negocio, así están terminando de pagar su lote que compro a crédito. La Sra. Margarita se Caracteriza por ser una persona responsable y carismática, ella ya ha trabajado con grupos y ahora esta en crédito individual.
texts.en: Margarita lives in the zone of the First Villa of Mayo. She has lived there more than five years. She sells meals that she delivers every day to some construction workers, since her husband is a contractor. Since she makes purchases every two or three days, and the majority of the workers are paying their tabs every fifteen days, she needs working capital to make her purchases, such as rice and other items like individual beverages to go with each lunch. Now she is using disposable plates for the lunches, and she will use her loan money to purchase all these types of things. She has four children who help her run her business; they are just finishing paying for the things she bought on credit. Margarita characterizes herself as a responsible and charismatic person. She has worked with groups before, and this is her first individual loan.

loans.use: to purchase rice and other products wholesale

loans.name: Alba Elizabeth

texts.es:
Alba, reside en la ciudad de San Miguel, tiene 36 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, vive con sus padres, tiene una hija de 10 años de edad, ella inicia sus labores por la mañana preparando las tortillas, por las tardes habiendo terminado la preparación se dirige a ofrecer las tortillas por los alrededores de la colonia.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de una plancha y maíz, esto le ayudara mucho para su venta y dar un mejor servicio a los clientes, mejorando también sus ingresos.
Su aspiración es que su negocio mejore y le provea lo necesario para también mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Alba lives in San Miguel.  She’s 36 years old sells tortillas.  She lives with her parents and has a 10 year old daughter.  She starts working in the morning preparing the tortillas and in the afternoon, having finished making them, she goes out to sell them around the neighborhood.

She is asking for the loan to buy a tortilla press and corn.  This will help her sales quite a bit and to provide better customer service thus also improving income.

Her wish is that the business improves and that it provides what is necessary to also improve her and her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a tortilla press and corn.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: El Sr. Jaime G. es una persona muy trabajadora el esta casado con la Sra. Juanita G. los cuales  trabajan juntos para salir adelante, ellos son unas personas muy honestas y responsables ,  su principal meta en la  vida  es sobresalir y  salir  adelante  día  con  día, ellos  tienen una  estética  por lo cual en esta ocasión  solicitan  el crédito  para  la  compra  de  mercancía para  así poder  continuar  satisfaciendo a  sus  clientes  en  cada  uno de  los  trabajos  que  les  solicitan.
texts.en: Mr. Jaime G. is a very hardworking person.  He's married to Mrs. Juanita G., and they work together to get ahead.  They are very honest and responsible people.  His main goal in life is to stand  out and to move forward day after day.  They have a beauty salon, which is the reason they are now asking for this loan to buy merchandise, so that they can continue satisfying their customers in all of the services they ask for.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to supply the business

loans.name: Alba Judith

texts.es:
Alba de 30 años de edad, reside en Guatajiagua departamento de Morazán, vive con su esposo y tres hijos, Kevin de 11 años, Eduardo de 3 y Líbida de 13 años de edad, Alba trabaja en la elaboración de loza, aprendió este oficio desde pequeña ya que su madre se lo enseño, su horario es de 8:00am en adelante la jornada finaliza dependiendo de cuantos comales necesita entregar, su dificultad llega cuando tiene demanda y su materia prima es escaza.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materia prima: barro, nacazcol, leña, ya que sin estos materiales Alba no puede salir con sus pedidos, este préstamo le ayudara a mantener lo necesario para su producción.
Su proyección es hacer buen uso del préstamo, que sea provechoso para el negocio e ir creciendo, hacer de su producción un comercio competente, que le genere las ganancias necesarias para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Alba, 30, lives in Guatajiagua, Morazán Department, with her husband and three children: Kevin, 11, Eduardo, 3 and Líbida, 13.  Alba works making earthenware.  She learned this occupation while still a little girl from her mother.  Her work schedule is from 8am until whatever time she finishes depending on the number of griddles she has to deliver.  Her difficulty arises when she has demand but raw materials are scarce.

She is requesting the loan to buy raw materials like: clay, nacazcol (seeds that yield a black dye) and firewood because, without these materials, Alba can’t fill her orders.  The loan will help her have what she needs for production.

Her plan is to make good use of the loan, that it be profitable for the business and to continue growing; to make her production competitive that will generate the necessary profits to help her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina, de 24 años es una mujer joven, pero muy dedicada. Ella vive en concubinato con Williams con quien tiene 2 hijos: Jeferson y Yesenia, a las que cuidan en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Carita. Desde muy joven comenzó a trabajar la tierra, de eso aproximadamente 6 años. En todo este tiempo logró obtener un terreno agrícola que le proporciona 5 bolsas de producción. Sus principales cultivos constan de arveja, papa y habas, los cuales cuida, fertiliza y limpia la maleza constantemente, junto a su esposo. Su principal dificultad es poder costear los gastos de la educación de su hija, pues tiene que trasladarla constantemente a la ciudad. Por ello en el futuro desea comprar más terrenos agrícolas que le proporcionen más cantidad de productos,  también comprarse una casa en la ciudad para poder brindarles a sus hijos una buena educación. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “progreso carita”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde agradece por la confianza depositada. Karina, después de la cosecha está pensando sembrar papa. Por ello con el crédito comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico para comenzar con éxito su sembrío.
texts.en:
Karina, 24, is a young but very dedicated woman.  She lives unmarried with Williams with whom she has two children: Jeferson and Yesenia who they care for in their own home located in the hamlet of Carita.

She started working the land while still very young, around the age of 6.  All this time she managed to acquire farmland that yields five sacks of product.  Her main crops are peas, potatoes and broad beans that she cares for, fertilizes and weeds constantly together with her husband.  Her main difficulty is being able to cover her daughter’s education costs because she has to transport her constantly to the city.  Because of this she hopes in future to buy more farmland that will provide her with larger amounts of products.  She also wants to buy a house in the city to provide her children a good education.

She’s a member of the “Progreso Carita” communal bank and this is her second loan with MFP where she is grateful for the trust deposited in her.  

After the harvest Karina is planning to plant potatoes and needs a loan to buy several sacks of organic manure to start off the planting successfully.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Alvaro Carrillo Group

texts.es:
Álvaro Carrillo, es el nombre de este grupo. La representante de este grupo es la señora Catalina C. López de 35 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 10 años que estudia la primaria. Catalina tiene  una estética en el cual da el servicio de corte de cabello, peinados, manicure, pedicure, tintes, rayitos de colores entre otros, así como también vende ropa, artículos deportivos, artículos para el hogar. Ella solicito el préstamo para poder comprar más productos como son: ropa, colorantes, tintes, y algunos otros productos que necesita para su estética.
Ambrocia Eutiquia R. González es una de las integrantes de este grupo, tiene 67 años, es viuda desde hace 16 años, tuvo 6 hijos de los cuales 3 están vivos y 3 están muertos, además tiene a su manutención a 3 nietos los cuales estudian la secundaria, Ambrocia se dedica a la venta de refresco y agua, gracias a ello ah tenido para comer a pesar de los problemas que ah enfrentado siempre sabe como seguir adelante, otra solvencia económica que tiene es la pensión que recibe desde el fallecimiento de su esposo. Las situaciones más difíciles que ha enfrentado es que a su avanzada edad, ah tenido muchos problemas de salud, pero a pesar de ello siempre lucha por seguir adelante y sacar adelante a sus nietos.
Ambrocia solicito el préstamo para poder comprar y surtir su negocio y así poder vender mas productos y obtener un poco mas de ganancia, para que pueda seguir adelante y seguir dándole estudio a sus nietos, ya que ella quiere que se preparen para que así el día de mañana puedan tener un mejor futuro y nuevas oportunidades. Agradece a las personas de Kiva por su gran generosidad y apoyo.
Las personas que integran este grupo son Antonina(56 años-venta de perfumes), Epifania (57 años-venta de ropa), Feliza (66 años-venta de quesos), Criselda (28 años-venta de agua purificada) Alicia (27 años-venta de ropa), Paula Zacarías R. (51 años-muebles), Catalina C. (35 años -Estética), Minerva (56 años-comida mexicana), Juana Marisol (38 años-compra de cosméticos y material ferretero para la venta), Ambrocia (67 años-venta de refrescos y agua),  Cecilia (37 años-venta de antojitos) y Vicenta (51 años-venta de refrescos).
texts.en:
This group is called 'Álvaro Carrillo'.  The group's representative is 35 year-old Catalina C. López.  Catalina is a single mother who has a 10 year-old son in elementary school.  She owns a beauty salon where she provides customers with haircuts, hairdos, manicures, pedicures, hair dyes, highlights, etc.  She also sells clothes, sporting goods and household goods.  Catalina requested this loan to buy more products such as clothes, colorings, dyes and other products that she needs for her beauty salon.

Ambrocia Eutiquia R. González is another member of this group.  She is 67 years old and was widowed 16 years ago.  She gave birth to 6 children.  3 of her children are alive and 3 are dead.  Ambrocia also has 3 grandchildren in her care who are in high school.  Her business is selling soft drinks and water.  Thanks to her business, she has been able to provide her family with food in spite of the problems that she has faced.  She has always known how to get ahead in life.  An additional income that Ambrocia has is the pension that she has received since the death of her husband.  The most difficult situation that Ambrocia has faced is that, at her advanced age, she has suffered a lot of health problems.  However, in spite of this she has always fought hard to get herself and her grandchildren ahead in life.  Ambrocia requested this loan so that she could continue getting ahead and provide her grandchildren with an education.  She would like her grandchildren to prepare themselves for a better future and new opportunities.  Ambrocia is grateful to Kiva lenders for their great generosity and support.

The members of this group are: 56 year-old Antonia who sells perfumes, 57 year-old Epifania who sells clothes, 66 year-old Feliza who sells cheese, 28 year-old Criselda who sells purified water, 27 year-old Alicia who sells clothes, 51 year-old Paula Zacarías R. who sells furniture, 35 year-old Catalina C. who runs a beauty salon, 56 year-old Minerva who sells Mexican food, 38 year-old Juana Marisol who buys cosmetics and hardware to sell, 67 year-old Ambrocia who sells soft drinks and water, 37 year-old Cecliia who sells snacks and 51 year-old Vicenta who sells soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies, clothes and gifts

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Monsieur Kodjo  est marié avec 3 enfants à charge.  IL est âgé de 40 ans. Il a déjà reçu un crédit  qu’il a parfaitement remboursé.   Il fait la vente d’eau minérale et les boissons canettes. Il s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et à la brasserie du Bénin. Il a commencé en 2007 cette activité et revend à la devanture de sa maison. Il espère accroître sa marge bénéficiaire et sollicite un prêt.
texts.en:
Mr. Kodjo is married with three dependent children. He is 40 years old. 

He has previously received one loan, which he repaid in full. 

He sells mineral water and canned drinks. He buys his merchandise at the grand market of Lomé and from the Bénin Brewery. 

He started this business in 2007 and conducts his sales in front of his house. He is seeking a loan in hopes of increasing his profit margin.

loans.use: to purchase mineral water and canned drinks for resale

loans.name: Negue

texts.fr: Madame A. est mariée et âgée de 41 ans. Elle a 4 enfants à charge. Elle est née à Abobo et habite quartier Kagomé.  Elle fait le commerce de céréales et de boissons alcoolisés sodabi. Elle s’approvisionne dans les zones environnantes de Lomé et compte 4 ans d’expérience.  Ensuite elle revend à la devanture de sa maison. Elle demande un prêt pour acheter 3 sacs de maïs, 5 sacs d’haricot et 2 bidons de sodabi.
texts.en:
Mrs. A. is 41 years old, and married with 4 dependent children. She was born in Abobo and lives in the Kagomé neighborhood. 

She buys and sells cereals and "sodabi" alcohol drinks ("sodabi" is a local liquor made from palm wine). She buys her goods in the areas around  Lomé, and has 4 years of experience. Then she resells in front of her house.

She is asking for a loan to buy 3 sacks of corn, 5 sacks of haricot beans and 2 barrels of "sodabi."

loans.use: to buy cereals and  "sodabi"

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
Doña María, D. 58 años D. edad, resiD. en Concepción Batres, departamento D. Usulután, se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos y pupusería, ella vive con su esposo y dos hijos.
Los negocios los inicio hace 3 años, y actualmente quiere invertir en los cosméticos, comprando productos D. belleza y artículos para el uso personal, este será un gran impulso al negocio, fortalecerá y garantizara mejor sus ganancias.

Su objetivo es ampliar el negocio, proveer siempre lo necesario para sus hijos, velando por todas las necesidades basicas.
texts.en:
María, 58, lives in Concepción Batres, Usulután Department.  She sells cosmetics and has a pupusería (Salvadoran fast food); she lives with her husband and two children.

She started her businesses three years ago and she currently wants to invest in cosmetics buying beauty products for personal use.  This will be a big push for her business that will strengthen it and guarantee better profits.

Her goal is to expand the business, to always proviD. what is best for her children and to see to all their basic needs.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Abasolo San Juan Jicayan Group

texts.es:
El grupo Abasolo San Juan Jicayan, su población es de su totalidad indígena mixteco, la mayoría de los pobladores se dedican al trabajo artesanal y al campo, dentro de los trabajos artesanales se encuentran el tallado en jícara, la elaboración de textiles, como la naguas y los huipiles, que forman parte de la indumentaria tradicional, en esta población impera la pobreza y el abandono por parte de las autoridades, eso ha dado por consecuencia la emigración de sus pobladores a los estados unidos y otra parte lejos de sus comunidades, la ignorancia y la falta de educación son ingredientes que mezclan la desigualdad que se viven en la mayoría de los pueblos indígenas de esa región.
Edna B. M. es la representante de este grupo, solicito el préstamo para comprar maíz ya que ella se dedica  a la compra y venta de maíz, además de que en su casa vende algunos dulces que compro con las ganancias que ha venido obteniendo de sus ganancias. El sueño de Edna es que sus hijas tengan una profesión para que así tengan mejores oportunidades el día de mañana y no sufran las necesidades que viven ahora.
Otra de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Angelica Maria Hernández S. de 30años de edad, esta casada con el señor Felipe C. Merino, tiene 2 hijos que estudian la primaria. Angelica se dedica al bordado de servilletas y naguas, desde hace 7 años, también se dedica a la venta de antojitos en la primaria como son: tacos dorados, tacos de res, tostadas, tacos de chorizo, para así aportar recursos para los gastos de la familia. Angelica se integro al grupo para solicitar un crédito para poder comprar más insumos para la elaboración de sus antojitos, además de que también va a comprar algunos materiales para el bordado de servilletas como son: hilos de algodón e hilos de diferentes colores. El más grande anhelo de Angélica es tener un local para poder vender sus servilletas y naguas y que sus artesanías sean vendidas internacionalmente, además de que sus hijos estudien y tengan una profesión.
Las integrantes de este grupo están muy agradecidas con FRAC por los créditos otorgados y por la confianza que han depositado en ellas.
Las personas que integran este grupo son las siguientes:
Lucia Damián C.: De 51 años de edad se dedica a la venta de antojitos.
María Guadalupe Hernández Damián: De 34 años de edad se dedica a la venta comida.
Elvira S. C.: De 37 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración de servilletas. 
Edna B. M.: De 47 años de edad se dedica  a la compra y venta de maíz
Gabriela Gómez Hernández: De 53 años de edad se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras.
Hilaria D. Gómez: De 74 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración de servilletas.
Julia D. Hernández: De 34 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración de servilletas.
Lizbeth Hernández B.: De 23 años de edad se dedica a  la venta de productos por catalogo.
Alejandra Jiménez García: De 75 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración de naguas 
Angelica Maria Hernández S.: De 30 años de edad se dedica a la venta de antojitos.
Alicia Damián Damián: De 22 años de edad se dedica a la venta de antojitos.
texts.en:
The “Abasolo San Juan Jicayan” group is completely made up of indigenous Mixteca people.  Most of the residents are farmers and artisans.  Within the artisanal work is gourd carving and textile making (naguas and huipiles – skirts and blouses) that make up part of traditional costumes.  Poverty and abandonment by authority is rampant in this population which has led to residents emigrating to the United States or other areas far from their communities.  Ignorance and lack of education are ingredients that mix with inequality that’s characteristic of most indigenous populations in that region.

Edna B. M. is the group representative.  She requested the loan to buy corn because she is a corn merchant.  She also sells some sweets from home that she bought with the profits she’s been earning.  Edna’s dream is that her daughters have professions so that they will have better opportunities and in future not have the same shortcomings they currently endure.

Another group member is Mrs. Angelica Maria Hernández S., 30.  She is married to Mr. Felipe C. Merino and has two children who go to elementary school.  Angelica has been embroidering napkins and blouses for the last 7 years; she also sells snacks like crispy tacos, beef tacos, tostadas and chorizo tacos at the elementary school to provide family income.

Angelica joined the group to request a loan to be able to buy more ingredients to prepare her snacks.  She will also use it to buy some of the materials she needs for the napkin embroidery like cotton and silk thread in various colors.
