Angelica’s greatest wish is to have a locale in which to sell her napkins and blouses and that her crafts be sold internationally and in addition that her children study and have a profession.

The members of this group are very grateful to FRAC for the loans granted and for the trust that’s been placed in them.

Following are the group members:

Lucia Damián C., 51, sells snacks. 

María Guadalupe Hernández Damián, 34, sells food. 

Elvira S. C., 37, makes napkins. 

Edna B. M., 47, is a corn merchant.

Gabriela Gómez Hernández, 53,  is a fruit and vegetable merchant.

Hilaria D. Gómez, 74, makes napkins.

Julia D. Hernández, 34, makes napkins.

Lizbeth Hernández B., 23, sells catalogue products.

Alejandra Jiménez García, 75, makes skirts. 

Angelica Maria Hernández S., 30, sells snacks.

Alicia Damián Damián, 22, sells snacks.

loans.use: to buy cotton and silk thread and ingredients to make fast food snacks.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: La Sra. Carolina es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable   ella es divorciada, tiene una   tienda de  abarrotes  de  la  cual  obtiene sus ingresos para  sacar adelante a sus hijos ya  que  son lo mas importante  en  su  vida  y  desea   brindarles  una  excelente  calidad  de   vida , en esta  ocasión requiere    el crédito  para   comprar  mercancía  para  su  negocio y  de  esta  manera  obtener    ingresos  y  poder  brindar  una mayor   variedad  de  productos  para  sus  clientes.
texts.en: Carolina is a very hardworking and responsible person. She is divorced. She has a grocery store from which she makes her income to help her children have a better life. Seeing as they are the most important part of her life, and she wants to provide them with an excellent quality of life, she requests a loan at this time to buy merchandise for her business. This will help her to make money and be able to offer a better variety of products for her customers.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
This is 51 year-old Rugiatu.  She is married and has children aged 18, 16, 17, and 12. Apart from her children and husband, her elderly mother is also living with her. In 1980, Rugiatu established her clothing business.She began her business because she dropped out of school in the early stages of secondary education.  "I found business to be my only hope of survival,"  Rugiatu said.  She is glad she made that decision.  

Working 6 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,300,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Rugiatu requires a loan in order to buy more clothing for her business. In the future, Rugiatu plans to establish a shop mainly for wholesale purposes.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for her business.

loans.name: Israel Cirilo

texts.es:
Israel de 53 años, es un ahombre trabajador que tiene muchas aspiraciones para su familia por eso el comenzó con un negocio surtido entre tienda de víveres y papelería. 

Tiene un aproximado de 6 años con su tienda, ha podido surtirla y administrarla al punto que todo le ha ido bien. En la actualidad vende arroz, bebidas, cuadernos a un precio bajo. Trabaja en su negocio desde las 06h00am hasta las 23h00pm con ayuda de su esposa. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar trabajando con el préstamo comprar arroz, bebidas, papelería.
texts.en:
Israel, 53, is a hardworking man who has many aspirations for his family, so he began a business stocked with basic supplies and stationary.

He has run his store for about 6 years. He has been able to keep it stocked and manage it so that everything is going well for him. Today he sells rice, drinks, and notebooks at low prices. He works at his business from 6:00 am until 11:00 pm with his wife's help. He has many plans for his business and so he wants to continue working. With the loan he will buy rice, drinks, and stationary.

loans.use: To purchase rice, drinks and notebooks

loans.name: Claudia Lorena

texts.es:
Claudia de 32 años de edad, residen en San Miguel, se dedica a la venta de artesanía, vive con sus hijos de 4 y 6 años de edad, también su esposo le acompaña, ella está dedicada al comercio realizando ventas en los centros escolares de San Francisco Gotera y San Miguel.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para comprar mercadería y vender por las escuelas, ya que los jóvenes estudiantes demandan cada vez más artículos de moda, esta inversión le ayudara a mantener la clientela y a generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
Su mayor sueño es comprar vivienda para su familia e instalar el negocio en un lugar propio.
texts.en:
Claudia, 32, lives in San Miguel.  She sells crafts.  She lives with her children, who are 4 and 6 years of age, and her husband.  She is a merchant who sells her wares at schools in San Miguel Gotera and San Miguel.

She currently needs a loan to buy merchandise to sell at the schools because the young students demand more and more up-to-date items every day.  This investment will help her keep her clientele and generate higher family income.

Her great dream is to buy a house for her family and to set up a business in a space of its own.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell at schools.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is one of our associates from the Hato Mayor branch, a rural town whose economy depends on agriculture. She is a merchant, selling juices. She runs a stall in her house where people come to buy all kind of fruit juices: banana, papaya, orange, cherry, passion fruit and others. She is a married woman and mother of three. Maria tells us that for her, the most difficult part has been to get established economically, also to start building her house.

Maria is very excited to be receiving her first loan from Esperanza Internacional. She has been working at her business for about three years. She is very thankful to have received this loan from Esperanza because she will improve her business. She plans to save the profit and to build her house after God blesses her savings.

loans.use: to buy fruit, sugar, glasses, etc.

loans.name: Ayoko

texts.fr: Madame Ayoko est mariée et a un enfant. Elle a 34 ans. Elle habite quartier Baguida. Pour contribuer au foyer, elle fait la couture. Mais elle a associé la vente d’articles de mercerie. Elle a commencé cette activité en 1999 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé.  Elle satisfait les clients   dans un atelier à Baguida en face de l’EPP groupe D.  Elle sollicite un crédit pour se réapprovisionner.
texts.en: Ms. Ayoko, aged 34, is married, has one child, and lives in the Baguida district. To do her part at home, she sews. But she has included with this work the sale of sewing supplies. She started this business in 1999 and gets her supplies at the main market of Lomé, the capital of Togo. She meets the needs of her customers in a shop in Baguida opposite the EPP groupe D. She is requesting a loan to stock up again.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase ingredients and utensils for her bakery

loans.name: Plata Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo que presento se llama "Plata",se encuentra en la comunidad D. Cedro D. la Manzana, en esta comunidad hay muy pocos habitantes esta al paso D. carretera y es un cerro la comunidad, la gente D. ahi se dedica a criar animales y a engordarlos es la unica fuente D. ingresos que hay, este grupo D. "Plata" es D. ganaderia y comercio, la gente que se dedica al comercio tienen una tienda, son pequeñas tiendas las que hay y en las que venden galletas, pan, refrescos, algunos dulces entre otras cosas, por lo regular son productos que se consumen mucho en campo. los integrantes del grupo se llaman "Plata" porque es un metal muy abundante y no tan codiciado ademas D. que esta al alcanze D. todo mundo y es muy bonito, los nombres D. las 9 personas son los siguientes:
1.-Silvia M. G., tiene 26 años D. edad
2.-Maria D. la Luz A. S., tiene 33 años
3.-Marcelina Camila H., tiene 54 años D. edad
4.-Maria del Socorro C. H., tiene 43 años D. edad
5.-Jose Vicente S., tiene 78 años
6.-Ma Agustina G. C., tiene 68 años
7.-Gabriela R. D. Jesús, tiene 30 años
8.-Ana Lizbeth B. G., tiene 19 años
9.-Maria Guadalupe A. C., tiene 33 años.
los nueve integrantes son personas muy trabajadoras que la mitad del grupo quieren el prestamo para invertir en cria D. animales y otras mas para su tienda D. abarrotes que son tiendas pequeñas pero desean incrementar mercancia y tambien ingresos, doña Silvia es la encargada del grupo, ella tiene una pequeña tienda general en casa D. su abuelo, venD. refrescos, pan y dulces, y desea comprar mas producto para que le vaya mejor y su situación mejore con el tiempo, Doña Silvia es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos que estudian la primaria, y vive en casa D. su abuelo con su abuelo, con las ganancias D. su negocio quiere agranadr poco apoco el espacio del local como tambien sueña con tener su propia casa para vivir ahi con sus hijos, no piD. mucho solo unos dos cuartos para vivir mejor y tener bien su negocio, Doña Silvia  nos dice que el prestamo le va servir D. mucho para poder iniciar con la inversion D. esa manera levantarse poco a poco.
texts.en:
The following group is called "Plata" [Silver], and is located in the Cedro D. la Manzana community. There are very few people in this community, which is along the road. The people there raise animals and fatten them up to sell, which is about the only source of income there is. The Plata group raise animals and have businesses. The people with businesses have small stores that sell cookies, breads, sodas, some sweets and other items - usually products that are used a lot in the countrysiD..

The group members call themselves Plata because silver is a very abundant metal and not so coveted, besides which it is found all over the world and is very beautiful. The names of the 9 members are:
1.-Silvia M. G., 26 years old
2.-Maria D. la Luz A. S., 33
3.-Marcelina Camila H., 54 years old
4.-Maria del Socorro C. R., 43 
5.-Jose Vicente S., 78
6.-Ma Agustina G. C., 68 years old
7.-Gabriela R. D. Jesús, 30
8.-Ana Lizbeth B. G., 19
9.-Maria Guadalupe A. C., 33 years old

The nine members are very hardworking people, half of whom want the loan to invest in raising animals and the others for their grocery stores, which are small but which they want to expand, increasing merchandise and thereby income. 

Doña Silvia is in charge of the group. She has a small general store in her grandfather's house, selling sodas, bread and sweets. She wants to buy more products so that her store does better and her situation improves over time. Doña Silvia is a single mother of 2 children who are in primary school, and she lives with her grandfather in his house. With the earnings from her business she wants to little by little enlarge the space for her store. She also dreams of having her own house to live in with her children - she doesn't ask much, just two rooms or so to live better and have her business as well. Doña Silvia tells us that the loan will help her a great deal; with this investment she will be able to start improving her situation little by little.

loans.use: To invest in a grocery store and to pay suppliers (Bimbo, Coca-cola, Marinela, etc.)

loans.name: Avenida Lopez Avelar Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama Avenida López A., está integrado por las señoras Francisca, Martha, Eustolia y Martina Roció van a comprar con su crédito cosméticos por mayoreo para vender, la señora Ángela va a comprar perfumes por mayoreo para su venta, las señoras Tranquilina va a comprar zapatos por mayoreo para vender, la señora María D. los Ángeles va a comprar elotes para vender tamales D. elote, esquites y elotes preparados para su venta, las señoras Minerva y Alberta Eugenia va a comprar blusas, pantalones, camisas, faldas etc., para surtir su negocio y para su venta, la señora María D. Jesús va a comprar productos D. belleza y zapatos por catalogo para vender, las integrantes del grupo quieren decir a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les damos las gracias por la oportunidad que nos dan para seguir creciendo en nuestros negocios”. 
La señora Martina Roció es Integrante del grupo, ella tiene 32 años D. edad,  vive en unión libre con su esposo y tienen 2 niños José Moisés D. 6 años D. edad está en preescolar y Melanie tiene un mes D. nacida, ella venD. cosméticos y perfumes por catalogo y solicito su crédito para comprar las ofertas D. cosméticos y perfumes, ella inicio su negocio hace 4 años. Su negocio es importante porque le deja algo D. ganancias, ella está orgullosa D. su negocio porque conoce a más personas, sale y se distrae, gana premios , sus planes y esperanzas son tener un negocio más estable, darles estudio a sus hijos y que todos estén bien D. salud y que no falte lo necesario.
**La señora D. blusa rosa que tiene al niño D. playera verD., decidió no seguir con los préstamos D. FRAC, por tal motivo ya no forma parte D. grupo.
texts.en:
This group is called "Avenida López A.." It is maD. up of 11 women. Francisca, Martha, Eustolia and Martina Roció are going to buy wholesale cosmetics to sell. Angela is going to buy wholesale perfumes to sell. Tranquilina is going to buy wholesale shoes to sell. Maria D. los Angeles is going to by corn to sell corn tamales, popcorn and prepared corn. Minerva and Alberta Eugenia are going to buy blouses, pants, shirts, skirts and other similar items to sell to help their business succeed. Maria D. Jesus is going to buy beauty products and shoes through a catalogue to sell. 

The members of the group want to say to Kiva and to "Fundación Realidad" [Reality Foundation], "We thank you for the opportunity that you have given us to continue growing in our businesses."

Martina Roció is one member of the group and is 32 years old. She lives in a free union with her husband. They have 2 children, José Moisés, who is six years old and is in preschool, and Melanie who is only a month old. Martina sells cosmetics and perfumes from a catalog and is asking for a loan to buy these items on sale. She began her business four years ago. Her business is important because it leaves her with some earnings. She is proud of her business because it allows her to know a lot of people, to leave her home and have fun and possibly win awards (bestowed by the catalogue company). Her plans and hopes are to have a more stable business, to give her children the chance to study and to make sure they are healthy and that they are not lacking anything. 

**The woman in the pink blouse who is holding the child in the green shirt decided not to take out a loan with FRAC, and for this reason she is no longer part of the group.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and cosmetics from a catalogue to resell.

loans.name: Ghevond

texts.en: Ghevond H. lives with his wife and three children in Brnakot village, Syunik region. Ghevond keeps a cattle farm and cultivates his land. For Ghevond and his family it is very important to improve their farm conditions by renovating the cattle stable and purchasing seeds for this spring, as well as fuel and fertilizer. The loan will cover the renovation and purchasing costs. Ghevond and his family unite their efforts to earn their daily bread, and this loan will assist them greatly.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fuel and fertilizer.

loans.name: Daavi

texts.en:
Daavi A. is a food seller from Ntranoa, near Elmina. She has been preparing and selling banku and konkonte for the past 26 years. Banku is fermented corn/cassava dough mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth white paste, usually served with soup, stew or in a pepper sauce with fish. Konkonte is another type of staple made from powdered cassava.

Daavi is keen to expand her business. She plans to use the requested loan to purchase more ingredients so she can prepare a larger quantity of food for sale. She intends to reinvest additional profits back into her business for further growth. Daavi is married to an officer and they have five children. Her income helps to feed and educate their family.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to prepare a larger quantity of food for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy foodstuffs, soft drinks, and toiletries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Elizabeth Carina

texts.es: La Sra. Elizabeth y su esposo, han estado construyendo la barda del frente de su domicilio, ambos trabajan para sacar adelante su casa y su familia, pero se les presentaron algunos gastos y suspendieron la construcción de la barda que les protege el frente del domicilio,en esta  ocacion requieren  el  crédito para   concluir  con su proyecto  y  de  esta  manera  retirarse a  su  trabajo  confiados  en  que  su  hogar  se  encuentra  protegido.
texts.en: Elizabeth and her husband have been building the front wall of their house.  Both work to move their house and their family forward, but some expenses came up, and they suspended the construction of the wall that protects the front of their house.  At this time, they need the loan to complete their project and finish their work confident that their home is protected.

loans.use: to construct a wall

loans.name: Guasaule Group

texts.es:
el grupo Guasaule esta integrado por 3 mujeres que se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo y que son muy buenas amigas, trabajan juntas para sacar adelante sus familias, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividaded que ellas realizan:

doña Ingrid es una mujer joven emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, Ingrid cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
Ingrid es madre de 6 hijos los cuales estan en la escuela y colegio de su comunidad.
Ingrid en sus tiempos libres visita la iglesia
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria al por mayor para surtir mas su pulperia.

doña Lidia A. es una mujer dedicada a su negocio el cual es produccion y venta de tortillas, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, Lidia es madre de 4 hijos los cuales ya estan adultos, a pesar de su avanzada edad Lidia se levanta a las 5 de la mañana todos los dias para hacer sus ricas tortillas y  venderlas en su vecindario.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materia prima para la fabricacion de las tortillas.
 
la sra. Norma Z. es una mujer trabajadora y que se dedica a la venta de semillas en su casa de habitacion, tiene 4 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
Norma es madre de 2 niños los cuales que estan bien pequeños, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo que se dedica  al comercio en esta zona.
sus tiempos libres los dedica  a la crianza de gallinas.
texts.en:
The Guasaule group is composed of three members who have known each other for a long time and are very good friends.  They work together to support their families.  Following are details about each of their activities:

Ingrid is a young entrepreneur who sells daily use items.  She has a grocery store in her home.  Her husband helps her meet household expenses.  Ingrid is the mother of six children who go to the local school and high school.  During her free time, Ingrid goes to church.  She will use the loan to buy groceries to better stock her grocery store.

Lidia A. is a woman who is devoted to her business which is the production and sale of tortillas.  Her business is located in her home.  Lidia is the mother of four children who are all adults now.  Despite her advanced age, Lidia rises daily at 5am to make her delicious tortillas and sell them in her neighborhood.  She will use the loan to buy raw materials needed to make tortillas.

Norma Zuñiga is a hard working woman who sells seeds at home; she’s been in this line of work for four years.  She is the mother of two children who are still quite little.  Her husband, who is an area merchant, helps her.  She raises chickens in her spare time.

loans.use: to buy firewood, lime powder, corn, water, lard, oil, margarine, salt, soft drinks, rice, sugar, bread, coffee, cookies, soups, noodles, pasta, sauces, snacks and wheat and corn flour.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua J. sells polythene bags to traders and vendors in Ntranoa, which is near Elmina. With her loan, she’ll be able to purchase a greater variety of bags to meet the needs of her customers. She intends to reinvest any additional profits back into her business as her goal is to expand her business. 
She is married to a petty trader and her income is used to provide for her family’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of bags.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama Y. has been selling maize, konkonte (a staple made with powdered cassava) and drugs in Ntranoa, near Elmina. She is shown in the photo in her drug store. 

Ama is married to a cleaner and they have five children. Her income helps pay for their utility bills and their children's school fees. She plans to expand her business and needs the requested loan to buy more drugs to increase her sales. She intends to save the additional profits for her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine/drugs to increase her store's sales

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana Y. has worked as a fish vendor for 20 years. She is from Ntranoa, near Elmina. She is a widow and serves as the sole breadwinner for her seven children. 

To increase her income, she needs to grow her sales. The loan will help her purchase larger quantities of fish. The additional profits will be used to provide for her family and to pay for her children’s education fees.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of fish to offer for resale

loans.name: Altagracia

texts.en:
Altagracia is one of our associates from the Hato Mayor branch, a rural town whose economy depends on agriculture. She is selling clothes. She runs a clothing business in her house. She is a mother of two and she lives together with her children and her long-term partner, who is also her children's father. Altagracia tells us that the most difficult challenge is to build an extra room onto her house; she needs it because the main structure is small for her family and her business.

Altagracia is very excited to be receiving her first loan from Esperanza Internacional. She has had her business for around three years. She is very thankful to have received this loan from Esperanza because in this moment, her business needs to have more capital, and with this loan she will buy jeans, shirts, blouses, etc, to increase her business inventory. She plans to use her business profits to buy materials to start building the extra room her house needs. Thank you for supporting this loan!

loans.use: to buy jeans, shirts, blouses, etc, to increase her business inventory.

loans.name: Jonny

texts.es: Jonny, es natural de la ciudad de San Francisco, tiene 35 años de edad, es un joven muy alegre y trabajador, convive con Francisca de 30 años y fruto de su relación hoy tienen 03 hijos y  juntos viven en su propia casa, situados en la comunidad de Carmen Pampa, caserío del distrito de San Francisco. Jonny es el pilar de su familia, desde muy niño sus padres le inculcaron a remover la tierra y hoy es todo un conocedor del arduo labor en el agro; es campesino y cuenta con 03 hectáreas de terreno cultivados con plantas de café, cacao y plátano; plantas oriundas de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. Viene removiendo la tierra hace 12 años en su propia parcela, en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los peones quienes se encargan de cosechar y trasladar los frutos hasta los tendales. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos de las plantas; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde su comunidad hasta los centros de acopio ubicados en los distritos de Kimbiri y San Francisco; lugares donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus productos. Su dificultad radica en no poder contar con suficiente ingreso económico para solventar los pagos por adelantado a los jornaleros quienes le brindan el apoyo en las cosechas y sacar la maleza; es por ello que acude a los créditos que facilita la Institución MFP. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es sembrar más plantas de café ya que cuenta con 01 hectárea de terreno no cultivado. Este es su primer crédito de Jonny con MFP, esta dispuesto cumplir con sus respectivos pagos ya que desea acceder a otro crédito posteriormente. A la vez se siente muy agradecido con la institución por  concederle el crédito. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados, contratará jornaleros para que le brinden el apoyo en las cosechas y sacar la maleza.
texts.en:
Jonny is from the town of San Francisco.  He is 35 years old and a very happy and hard-working young man.  He lives with his partner, 30 year-old Francisca, and they have 3 children together.  They live in their own home which is located in Carmen Pampa, a small village in San Francisco district.

Jonny is the pillar of his family.  His parents taught him to grow crops from a very early age and today he is an expert in the hard slog that is farming.  Jonny is a farmer and he owns 3 hectares of land where he grows coffee, cacao and bananas.  These are all plants which are native to the rainforest area of the Apurimac Valley where he lives.  Jonny has been farming his own plot of land for 12 years.  At harvest times he is helped by laborers who harvest his crops and transport them to drying areas.

What Jonny most enjoys about his work is harvesting his crops since this is when he feels that all his hard work is being rewarded through the quality of his fruit.  He considers that the most difficult part of his work is transporting his products from his community to the warehouses in Kimbiri and San Francisco districts.  This is where they offer him the best prices for his products.  Jonny's problem is that he doesn't have enough money to pay his laborers, who support him in his harvests and in weeding his crops, in advance.  For this reason, he takes loans from MFP.  However, right now his priority is growing more coffee plants since he has 1 hectare of land that is not cultivated.

This is Jonny's first loan from MFP.  He is prepared to make his repayments on time since he would like to access further loans in the future.  He is very grateful to the institution for granting him this loan.  Jonny will use the 3,000 Peruvian soles that he has requested to hire laborers to support him in his harvests and in weeding his land.

loans.use: to hire laborers to support him in his harvests and in weeding his land

loans.name: Nyame

texts.en:
Nyame B. runs two businesses: she is a seamstress and she also sells palm oil in Ntranoa, near Elmina. She has been doing this for 11 years. She is married with two children and her income helps pay for her household expenses. 

This loan will help her purchase more fabric and lining to make more clothes, as well as more palm fruit to extract more oil for sale. She intends to reinvest the profits into her business for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, lining, and palm fruit

loans.name: Ayitévi

texts.fr: Monsieur Ayitévi a 34 ans. Il habite quartier Baguida. Il exerce comme activité la menuiserie aluminium. Il a commencé en 2008 et s’approvisionne au Ghana à Accra. Il satisfait les clients dans un atelier à la devanture de sa maison. Il a 10 apprentis qui travaillent avec lui.  Il demande un crédit pour acheter une machine de coupe.
texts.en: Mr. Ayitévi is 34 years old. He lives in the Baguida neighborhood. He works as a aluminum furniture maker. He began this activity in 2008, and he buys his supplies in Accra, Ghana. His customers come to a workshop at the front of his house. He has 10 apprentices who work with him. Mr. Ayitévi is requesting a loan to buy a cutting machine.

loans.use: to buy a cutting machine

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
For the past nine years, Adjoa B. has been selling provisions in Ntranoa, near Elmina. She sells items such as onions, spices, canned tomatoes, oil and rice. Married with three children, her income plays an important role in paying for her children’s education and some of the household expenses. Her husband is a mason. 

Her loan will allow her to purchase larger quantities and varieties of items to grow her customer base and sales. She plans to reinvest the profits back into her business.

loans.use: to buy food staples in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal and "gari" (cassava couscous) for resale.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El señor Mario vive en el barrio San Antonio desde hace 16 años, tiene cuatro hijos, su esposa se dedica también a la repostería, tiene un puesto fijo en la zona del Plan 3000. El sr. Mario Se dedica a la repostería y panadería desde hace 15 años al lado de su esposa y sus hijos. El crédito que están solicitando es para comprar insumos, azúcar, harina, manteca,  para la repostería y reparación de un horno ya que el cuenta con tres hornos de panadería luego comercializar  sus productos en carretillas. El Sr. Mario  es una persona trabajadora al igual que su esposa juntos están haciendo todos los esfuerzos para salir adelante y ofrecerles un futuro para sus hijos, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mario has lived in the San Antonio neighborhood for 16 years.  He has four children.  His wife is also in pastry making and has a fixed stand in the Plan 3000 zone.  

Mario has been a baker and pastry maker alongside his wife and children for the last 15 years.  He will use the requested loan to buy ingredients: sugar, flour and lard for the pastries and to repair an oven.  He has three bakery ovens and he sells his products in carts.

Mario is a hard working person just like his wife.  Together they make every effort to get ahead and offer their children a better future.  He is grateful to the institution for the support it’s given him.

loans.use: to buy baking ingredients.

loans.name: Juan Gabriel

texts.es: El Sr. L. y su esposa, con esfuerzos han estado construyendo poco  a poco  su casa, en donde ya tienen varios años viviendo es por  ello que cada vez que pueden le avanzan a la construcción y al mejoramiento de la misma , en esta ocasión le están instalando el vitropiso a toda la vivienda, ya que por algunos años  tenían el piso de tierra dentro y fuera de la casa, el Sr. L. pensando en todo el trabajo que tiene su esposa de barrer y limpiar tanta tierra todos los días en el interior de la casa, decidió empezar a instalar el vitropiso para ahórrale trabajo, además de que durara la limpieza por mas tiempo y la vivienda se vera mucho mas agradable a la vista de las visitas.
texts.en: With effort, Mr. L. and his wife have been building their house bit by bit.  They have already been living there for several years, so every time they can they move forward with construction and improvements.  This time they are installing tile in the entire house, since for years they have had a dirt floor inside and outside.  Mr. L., thinking of all the work his wife has to do sweeping and cleaning so much dirt inside the house every day, decided to start installing the tile to save her work, keep the house clean longer, and make it much more pleasant for guests.

loans.use: to install tile

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. makes a living by selling accessories and sundries in a village called Ntranoa, near the town of Elmina. She has been in this business for 10 years and she sells a collection of items, as shown in the photograph, such as hair clips, buttons and hair bands. 

To expand her business and income, she needs the loan to purchase more items for sale. At the moment, she carries her wares around to sell. With her increased profits, she plans to save up to build her own shop someday. 

Ama is married to a mason and they have one child. Her income helps pay for their child’s education and also some of the household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase more items for sale

loans.name: Angin

texts.en:
Angin H. lives with her husband and four children in Shgharshik village. Angin is a part-time nurse. Angin’s husband also works in the village. Nonetheless the local low salaries do not allow the family to meet their basic needs. Keeping a cattle farm and cultivating the land helps Angin and her husband not only cover their daily expenses but also invest in their children’s education. The parents did everything possible to earn money for one of their daughter’s higher education. She became a teacher and now works in the local school.

With the help of this loan, Angin will expand their herd of cattle which should also bring additional income to her family and cover the costs of her other children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Alice

texts.fr: Madame Alice est mariée et a un enfant.  Elle a 22 ans. Pour participer au foyer, elle fait comme activité la coiffure et a associé la vente de mèches et tissages. Elle a débuté en 2009 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Elle satisfait les clients dans un atelier à côté de la cité Baguida.  Elle a 3 apprentis qui l’aident dans ces activités. Elle sollicite un prêt pour acheter un séchoir et les produits pour les cheveux.
texts.en: Mrs Alice D. is 22 years old, and married with one child. She helps with her family's living expenses by working as a hairdresser, and sells hair pieces and weaves. She began working in this field in 2009 and welcomes her clients to a studio near the Baguida district. Her materials are sourced from the great market at Lomé. She has three apprentices who help her with her clients. Alice is seeking a loan in order to purchase a hairdryer and hair products.

loans.use: to purchase a hairdryer and hair products

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba T. is divorced and has three children, all of whom she supports on her own. To make a living, she sells a variety of times: maize, vegetables, bowls and containers. She doesn’t have a shop and carries her wares on her head (as shown in the photograph) to sell in different places. She has been doing this for 18 years. She needs to increase her income so that she can pay for her children’s education. She plans to use the loan to buy more containers to sell.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Abubakarr

texts.en: Abubakarr T. is 59 years old, married, and has six children. In 1999, he established his electrical and building materials business. He began his business as a means of livelihood for his family. His customers use his materials to repair their old buildings. Working seven days a week, 12 hours a day, Abubakarr earns about 950,000 SLL every month. He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 SLL, which he will use to buy more electrical and other building materials. In the future, Abubakarr plans to educate all his children to university level and purchase a piece of land where he will build a house. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase electrical and other building materials

loans.name: Kukuah

texts.en:
Kukuah K. is married to a mechanic, and they have three children. The family lives in Ntranoa, a village near the town of Elmina.

Kukuah sells bowls, containers and trays. She has been in this business for a decade. Her income helps pay for their children’s education and utility bills.

Kukuah plans to purchase larger quantities of containers and bowls to increase her sales and profits. She needs to expand her business and save more money if she is to attain her dream: to buy a piece of land upon which to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase larger quantities of containers and bowls

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba F. is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer, and she is a fishmonger from Ntranoa, a village near the fishing town of Elmina. In the photograph, she is smoking fish. She has been in this business for 35 years. Araba also sells oil for additional income. The income she earns contributes to her children’s education and some of the household expenses.

Araba wants to expand her business so that she can save up enough money to provide her four children with a meaningful education. Her loan will be used to purchase larger quantities of fish and oil to sell.

loans.use: To purchase larger quantities of fish and oil

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is married and has two children. She lives in San Pedro de Macoris in a simple home.  Nancy runs a Colmado (a small food store) where she sells goods for daily meals.  She is excited to be receiving her sixth loan from Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and increased her business. With this loan she will buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, canned meals, etc. to increase her business inventory. Nancy uses the profits to reinvest in her business. Her most difficult challenge has been to develop her business.

loans.use: To purchasae rice, beans, sugar, oil, canned meals, etc.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 51-year-old married man living with his wife in Baalback. Ali has owned a grocery store for six years. Most of his clients are his neighbors, friends and relatives. Ali is a hard worker. He introduces new products from time to time to keep his business improving.

Ali is requesting a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua in order to have the ability to buy more quickly more cigarettes to sell. It is the law to buy cigarettes with cash, not credit, and for a storeowner like Ali, turnover in cigarettes is very quick.

Ali is an honest person with a good reputation that is based on his clients’ good opinion of him. Ali hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To increase his ability to buy more cigarettes to stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food items for her business.

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.es: Enriqueta Sánchez Núñez desde hace 3 años cuenta con su negocio de Frutería denominada Enriqueta, donde ofrece variedad de Frutas y verduras, huevos, chicharrones de cerdo y abarrotes de buena calidad. Su esposo trabaja en una frutería conocida de la ciudad donde surten la mercancía; pero le están ofreciendo la oportunidad para traerla en el viaje donde sus jefes la compran y así conseguirla a un bajo precio. Para esto necesita capital para comprar la mercancía y así obtener mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Enriqueta Sánchez Núñez has had a fruit sales business, called Enriqueta, for the last three years where she sells a variety of fruit and vegetables, eggs, chicharrones (fried pork skin) and good quality groceries.

Her husband works at a fruit store in the city where they supply the merchandise but they are offering him the opportunity to bring her along on the trip where his bosses buy it so that she can get it at a lower price.  She needs capital to buy the merchandise and obtain better profits this way.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Hajaratu

texts.en:
This is 38 year old Hajaratu. She is married, and has 2 children aged 28 and 24 years. She has 3 additional dependents. In 2009, Hajaratu established her restaurant business. She began her business because she wants to generate enough to allow her family to live an average life in society. Working 6 days a week and 7 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,300,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 to buy more drinks and other food items. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks and other food items.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es: Felipe Juárez Guzmán y su esposa desean construir un mejor patrimonio para sus hijos, por tal motivo han tomado su tercer préstamo en esta institución ya que de esta manera han podido realizar su proyecto. En este momento Felipe desea colocar Vitro piso en la planta alta que esta terminando de construir para comenzar a cambiarse a la nueva habitación y así ofrecer a sus hijos mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Felipe Juárez Guzmán and his wife want to build a better estate for their children so have taken out their third loan in this institution to carry out their project.

On this occasion, Felipe wants to install ceramic tile flooring on the second story he’s finishing building in order to move into the new room thus offering more comfort to his children.

loans.use: to install ceramic tile flooring.

loans.name: Samantha Andrea

texts.es: La señorita Samantha es soltera  que lucha en la vida con apoyo de la institución de la misma manera mejorar  su educación, la actividad que tiene es la venta de ropa de forma ambulante de casa en casa y de oficina en oficina, es una actividad sacrificada pero rentable inicio su negocio hace mucho tiempo atrás de manera muy humilde obteniendo buenos resultados debido  a esta razón es que se animo a solicitar crédito para comprar mercadería siendo este un emprendimiento de una persona joven es bastante valorado por el esfuerzo que realiza durante todos los días a partir de las 08:00 am hasta las 16:00 pm, y esta es la rutina de todos los días de la semana, para que  ella misma puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Samantha is single and struggles in life with help from the institution to improve her education.  The activity she has is door-to-door and office-to-office clothing sales.  This is very demanding but profitable work.  She started out a long time ago in a very humble way but obtaining good results.  Because of this she was encouraged to ask for a loan to buy merchandise.  Because this is an enterprise of a very young person it’s quite valued because of the effort she puts into it every day from 8am until 4pm.  This is her routine every day of the week so that she can have a better quality of life.  She is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy articles of clothing by the dozen.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es: El señor Bernardo F. S. es un hombre muy emprendedor desde hace años lo pensionaron de su trabajo por motivos de salud, por lo que cuenta que no es suficiente el dinero que percibe por mes para sostener los gastos de la casa. Para esto el empezó su negocio de venta de ropa usada desde 5 años, donde le ha ido muy bien económicamente para cubrir sus gastos. Este crédito será su quinto crédito donde ha demostrado tener una muy buena cultura de pago. Como su negocio ha estado creciendo el necesita comprar mas mercancía de temporada.
texts.en:
Mr. Bernardo F. S. is an enterprising man who was retired from his job years ago due to health issues.  He comments that the monthly income he receives is insufficient to cover household expenses.  Because of this he started his own business selling used clothes five years ago where he’s done well economically to meet expenses.

This will be his 5th loan; he has demonstrated very good repayment habits.  Because the business has been growing he needs to buy more seasonal merchandise.

loans.use: to buy seasonal items to stock the business.

loans.name: Miguel Alejandro

texts.es: Miguel Alejandro A. M. con ahorros propios fue construyendo unos cuartos en la parte de atas de su vivienda, ya que esta es de interés social y son muy pequeñas; por tal motivo opto por empezar su construcción para ampliarla y ofrecer a su familia mayor comodidad. Miguel desea enjarrar los cuartos para ir avanzado con su proyecto para esto necesita comprar material de construcción y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en: Miguel Alejandro A. Martínez used his own savings to gradually build some rooms on the rear of his house because, since the house is publicly subsidized, the rooms are very small.  He opted to start construction to enlarge it and offer his family more comfort.  Miguel wants to plaster the rooms to continue advancing with the project and to do so needs to buy building materials and supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.use: to plaster two rooms.

loans.name: Guadalupe Antonio

texts.es: Guadalupe Antonio R. T. y su esposa son una joven pareja que empieza a formar su patrimonio, hace unos meses le ofrecieron un terreno a un precio moderado por lo que no quiso desaprovechar el momento. Guadalupe se vio en la necesidad de empezar a construir un cuarto y así poco a poco terminar lo que en un futuro será su casa para sus hijos.
texts.en: Guadalupe Antonio R. T. and his wife are a young couple who are starting to acquire assets.  Some months ago they were offered a plot of land at a reasonable price and they didn't want to let the chance slip by.  Guadalupe saw the need to start building a room and, little by little, he will finish building what, in the future, will be a home for his children.

loans.use: to start building a room

loans.name: Maria De Los Remedios

texts.es: María de los Remedios J. S. es madre soltera que con esfuerzos saco a su único hijo adelante ofreciéndole una carrera universitaria el cual su hijo esta agradecido por tal motivo la apoya económicamente y adquirió su  vivienda de interés social para proteger a su madre. La señora María de los Remedios cuenta con un negocio de la venta de ropa usada desde hace 9 años, al que en este momento desea comprar mas mercancía para tener mas ventas.
texts.en:
María de los Remedios J. S. is a single mother who managed to support her only son through her efforts providing him with a university career.  Her son is grateful to her for that so helps her economically; he acquired his publicly subsidized house to protect his mother.

María de los Remedios has had a used clothing sales business for 9 years.  At present she wants to buy more merchandise in order to increase sales.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: La señora Judith Z. V. desde hace 2 años cuenta con un negocio de abarrotes denominado “Miscelánea Pérez” que es una poyo para el sostén económico de la familia aparte del que recibe su esposo que trabaja en maquiladora. Judith desea invertir en su negocio para que sus ventas se incrementen y así ofrece a sus 2 hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Judith Z. Vázquez has had a grocery store, called “Miscelánea Pérez,” which is an economic support for her family apart from what her husband earns working at an assembly plant.

Judith wants to invest in the business so that her sales will increase and she will be able to offer her two children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Oscar Manuel

texts.es:
Oscar es un hombre trabajador que desea seguir trabajando en la elaboración y producción de puertas, cómodas, anaqueles de madera. Tiene un taller de fabricación de mueblería de madera. 

Comenzó su actividad laboral como obrero en un taller de ebanistería poco a poco fue aprendiendo la profesión y ahorrando para tener su propio negocio. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 18h00pm todos los días. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su taller por eso quiere continuar haciendo mueblería con madera. Para ello quiere el préstamo para comprar madera, pinturas y gomas.
texts.en:
Oscar is a hard working man who wants to continue working making and producing wood doors, chests and shelves.  He has a wood furniture making shop.

He started working as a laborer in a cabinet making shop and gradually learned the profession saving up to have his own business.  Currently he works from 7am until 6pm every day.  He has many hopes for his shop and this is why he wants to continue making wood furniture.  For that, he needs a loan to buy lumber, paint and adhesives.

loans.use: to buy lumber, paint and glue.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 63 old married father of one, living in Baalback. Ali has been selling used shoes at  wholesale since 1998. He is a hard worker who forces himself to work harder day after day in order to provide his family with a secure standard of living. Ali is a man with good reputation; he's very experienced in this field and all of his clients are business who sell used shoes at retail. His shop is in a very good place in his area, and many passing by visit him to have a look and most of the time they buy special pairs. Ali hopes to reach a time where he can rest and watch his business grow.

loans.use: to buy a big quantity of used shoes

loans.name: Narcisa Teodora

texts.es:
Narcisa  de 40 años, es una mujer trabajadora  que tiene su papelería desde hace ya 15 años junto a su esposo.

Su trabajo es diariamente trabaja sola en su papelería vendiendo cuadernos fomix y zapatos. Lo que más de afecta en su trabajo en la delincuencia.  Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere para su negocio que sea el más surtido del barrio.
texts.en:
Narcisa is 40 years old. She is a hardworking woman who, with her husband, has had her stationary store for 15 years. 

She works alone every day at her stationary store selling notebooks, fomix (craft foam) and shoes. What affects her work most is crime. With the help from this loan she will stock her store so that it will be the best stocked in the neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies.

loans.name: Fe Y Esperanza 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Olga is one of our partners in Hato Mayor and is a member of the group Faith and Hope 1 and 2. Hato Mayor is one the most rural cities in the country, whose economy is dependent on agriculture. Olga is an entrepreneur dedicated to selling jewelry and accessories. She is a young mother of two children who live with her and her long-term partner. She tells us that her most difficult challenge is to study. In her free time, she likes to study.

Olga is very excited to receive her 4th loan from Esperanza Internacional, after having satisfactorily paid her previous loans and, with each one, taking steps toward growing her business. For about 2 years, she has been negotiating, starting her her first loan in with us. She is planning to invest the latest loan in the purchase of varieties of jewelry and accessories. She plans to reinvest in her business and improve it in the short term, to have a sustainable future.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry and accessories

loans.name: Orfa Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira de 58 años, es una mujer trabajadora. Se inicio hace más de 15 años  en su taller de cerámica y confección.

Ella trabaja todo el día. su esposo trabaja como chofer. Con el préstamo ella desea comprar telas y cerámicas. En su futuro lo que quieres es poner un taller en la principal para así llegar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elvira is 68 years old and she is a hardworking woman. She started her ceramics and clothing shop over 15 years ago. 

She works all day. Her husband works as a driver. With this loan she hopes to buy fabrics and ceramics. In the future she wants to put her shop in the main street so that she can reach her customers.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, jewelry and shoes.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: El señor Humberto soltero cuya actividad es de el servicio de transporte urbano (taxi) cabe mencionar que es de nuestra entera satisfacción saber que lucha y pasa los obstáculos que la vida le pone en frente todo para darle una buena y mejor vida a su madre la actividad que el realiza tiene una competitividad grande en el mercado pero aun así el cliente lleva en su mente el crecimiento que puede tener gracias al crédito otorgado en la institución ya  que con este dinero realizara el mantenimiento de su vehículo y así poder brindar mejor servicio a sus clientes; de manera sacrificada pero rentable el inicio su trabajo como chofer ahora cuenta con un vehículo propio hace tiempo atrás de manera muy simple y  obteniendo buenos resultados el rendimiento es bastante valorado por el esfuerzo que realiza durante todos los días de la semana, para que el  en compañía de su madre puedan tener una mejor calidad y forma de vida.
texts.en: Humberto is a single man whose business is providing an urban transport service (taxi).  It is to our entire satisfaction to know that Humberto works hard and overcomes the obstacles that life puts in his path in order to provide a better life for his mother.  His business has a lot of competition but, even so, he carries in his mind the growth that he can make in his business thanks to the loan that the institution has awarded him.  He will use his loan money to have some maintenance work done on his vehicle so that he can provide his customers with a better service.  Humberto started out in his work as a driver with a lot of sacrifice but it is a profitable business.  He has now owned his own vehicle for some time.  Humberto obtains good results and his returns make up for the effort that he puts in every day of the week so that he and his mother can enjoy a better quality and way of life.

loans.use: to have maintenance work done on his vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials like sheeting, angles and electrodes.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 21 year-old single man from Baalback, who has been renting chairs and tables to weddings, funerals and any social activities since 2006. Ali also works as a DJ. Ali is an active man; he's young and it's his time to work hard on improving his business and putting all his effort on that. To do so, Ali requested a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to increase the the number of his chairs and tables to cover as many events as he can. Ali hopes to develop and improve his business to reach one day a professional wedding planner level.

loans.use: To increase the number of his chairs and tables

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Doña María Luisa, resiD. en San Miguel, vive con su esposo solamente porque sus hijos tienen sus respectivos hogares, ella tiene 64 años D. edad, viven en casa propia y junto a su pareja realizan las labores D. la ganadería, crían ganado vacuno para la venta D. leche y crías, además destazan reces para vender una vez por semana, también venD. ropa.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. ganado D. repasto, esta compra será oportuna porque los animales tienen dos años D. edad, lo que significa que su carne es suave para el destazo.
El objetivo D. doña María Luisa es mantenerse con estabilidad laboral y que con su familia hagan crecer el negocio y mejorar las ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa lives in a house that she owns in San Miguel with just her husband, as her children have their own homes. She is 64 years old and together with her husband, they work in cattle farming. They raise cattle to sell their milk and calves and they also butcher beef to sell once a week. She also sells clothing.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of beef cattle. This purchase is timely because the animals are two years old, which means that their meat is good for butchering. Maria Luisa’s goal is to have job stability and to work with her family so that the business grows and generates more income.

loans.use: to buy beef cattle.

loans.name: Johanna

texts.es:
Yohanna Chavarría es conocida por la mayoría de los habitantes de la comunidad de Mollejones de Pérez Zeledón.
Ella siempre ha estado interesada en la estética y desde hace poco abrí su  propio salón de belleza. Sin embargo ella necesita en préstamo de ₡594 000 (quinientos noventa y cuatro mil colones) para pagarse un curso de estética profesional. Esto con el fin de que su negocio mejore día a día   y darle un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Ella forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bancruce una de las  110 organizaciones socias de EDESA
texts.en:
Yohanna C. S. is known among most of the residents of the community of Mollejones in Pérez Zeledón. She has always had an interest in aesthetics and recently opened her own beauty salon. Now she needs a loan of 594,000 CRC in order to pay for a professional aesthetics course. This will help her improve her business and provide better service to her customers each day.

Yohanna is a member of the Communal Credit Enterprise of Bancruce, one of 110 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To pay for a professional aesthetics course.

loans.name: Joaquín

texts.es:
Joaquín de 37 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, vive con sus dos hijos de 8 y 16 años de edad, quienes están estudiando, Joaquín se dedica a la venta de confitería, juguetes, bebidas refrescantes, realiza las ventas en un vehículo pick up, desde hace 4 años, trabaja de 5:00am a 7:00pm de lunes a sábado.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar mercadería y surtir el negocio, con esta inversión espera tener un inventario fuerte, salir a comercializar los productos y tener mayores posibilidades de venta.
Crecer es su principal objetivo, trabajar con recursos propios e ir aumentando su potencial e ir también estabilizando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Joaquín is 37 years old and lives in San Miguel with his two children, 8 and 16, who are students. Joaquín has worked selling candy, toys and soft drinks from a pick-up truck for four years. He works from 5am to 7pm from Monday to Saturday.

He is currently requesting a loan to buy merchandise and stock his business. With this investment, he hopes to have a large inventory, to go out to sell the products, and to have better sales possibilities. His main goal is to grow, but he also wants to work with his own resources and continue to increase his potential, thereby stabilizing his income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and stock his business.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es: Lucio, de 40 años natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri, es un hombre muy trabajador, convive con Valentina de 45 años y fruto de su relación tienen 02 hijos, Ronald de 18 años y Roel de 16 años de edad;  juntos viven en su propia casa, distrito de Quimbiri. Lucio es  el sostén de su familia, desde muy niño sus padres le inculcaron a remover la tierra y hoy es todo un conocedor de la ardua labor en el agro; es campesino y cuenta con 04 hectáreas de terreno cultivado con café, cacao y hojas de coca. Viene removiendo la tierra hace 21 años en sus propias parcelas, en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y  peones quienes se encargan de cosechar y trasladar los frutos hasta los puntos de secado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos de las plantas; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde su comunidad Quimbiri Alto hasta los centros de acopio ubicados en los distritos de Quimbiri y San Francisco; lugares donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus productos. Con el crédito solicitado comprará maderas para renovar la fachada de su vivienda y así cambiar la madera desgastada por madera nueva. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es cultivar café por tener mayor demanda en los mercados extranjeros. Este es su primer crédito de Lucio con MFP, esta dispuesto cumplir con sus respectivos pagos ya que desea acceder a otro crédito posteriormente. A la vez se siente muy agradecido con la institución por  asignarle el préstamo. Con los 2,500 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará tablones para renovar la madera desgastada por nuevas y así mejorar la fachada de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Lucio, age 40, is a native of the city of Quimbiri. This hardworking gentleman is in a common law marriage with Valentina, age 45, and they have two children, Ronald (age 18) and Roel (age 16). They live in their own home in the District of Quimbiri. Lucio is the breadwinner of the family. As a young boy, his parents taught him how to plow the soil and now he knows about the hard work that is required for farming. He has four hectares of land on which he grows coffee, cacao, and coca leaves. Lucio has been cultivating his own land for 21 years and receives assistance from his children during harvest time. He also hires workers who are in charge of picking and drying the crops. What he enjoys most about his job is harvesting his crops because he feels that producing quality output is his reward for months of hard work. He considers the most difficult part to be transporting his products from the community of Quimbiri Alto to the collection centers in the Districts of Quimbiri and San Francisco. These places offer the best prices for his products. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy wood to remodel the façade of his house by replacing the planks that have deteriorated with new ones. Now his highest priority is to cultivate coffee since there is greater demand from foreign markets.

This is Lucio’s first loan with MFP and he is willing to complete his payments so that he can access subsequent loans. He is grateful that the institution has approved this loan. With the 2500 PEN he requested, Lucio will purchase wooden planks to replace the ones that have deteriorated and improve the façade of his house.

loans.use: To purchase wooden planks to remodel the façade of his house.

loans.name: Elvia Maribel

texts.es:
Elvia, de 36 años de edad, reside en El Divisadero, departamento de Morazán, vive con dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de refrescos y pan, este negocio lo atiende tres días a la semana, sale a vender los productos de forma ambulante por los lugares cercanos.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de harina, azúcar y manteca, para la elaboración del pan, estos materiales debe estar comprándolos seguido por que son la materia prima para hacer la venta de pan.
Las aspiraciones de Elvia es construir un horno en su casa, ayudar a sus hijos y ofrecer un futuro distinto con más solvencia económica.
texts.en:
Elvia is 36 years old and lives in El Divisadero in the Department of Morazán with her two children. She works selling soft drinks and bread three days a week on foot in the nearby areas.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of flour, sugar and butter for making bread. These materials must be bought often because they are the raw materials for selling bread.

Elvia’s dreams are to build a stove in her house, help her children, and have financial stability.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and butter.

loans.name: Gloris Grisela

texts.es:
La señora Gloris Grisela Z. tiene 32 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Alex Javier Murillo, Gloris se dedica al comercio tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion.
Gloris tiene tres hijos y con su familia viven en la colonia San Francisco desde hace 12 años.
en su negocio de pulperia vende todo tipo de Abarroteria, refrescos, carnes, embutidos, repuestos para bicicletas y mucho mas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria y una parte para la compra de cemento y arena para repellar una pared en donde tiene ubicado su negocio.
 
Doña gloris es una mujer trabajadora y dinamica que le gusta mucho el negocio; nos comentaba que su casa es construida a puras utilidades de su negocio.
Su meta es tener su propio carro.
las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Gloris Grisela Z. is 32 years old and in a common law relationship with Sr. Alex Javier Murillo. She works in the retail sector and has a store in her home. Gloris has three children and has lived with her family in the San Francisco neighborhood for twelve years. In her business, she sells all types of groceries, soft drinks, meats, canned goods, bicycle parts, and other items.

This loan will be used to buy groceries. Some of the money will be used to buy cement and sand to repair a wall in her business location.

Doña Gloris is a hardworking and dynamic woman who enjoys managing her business. She says that her house was built using the profits from her business. Her goal is to have her own car. The income she earns is needed so that her family can get ahead.

loans.use: To acquire merchandise and purchase cement and sand to repair a wall in her store.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is one of our associates from Hato Mayor branch, the most rural and agricultural city in Dominican Republic. She is excited to be taking her 4th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and increased her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying goods for her Colmado (this is a small food store).

Petronila will use the profits to save and build her house. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying being at her family's house. Petronila tells us that the most difficult challenge has been to build her house.

She is very thankful to have received this loan from Esperanza to invest in her business, and with this loan she will buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, canned meals, and others, to increase her business inventory.

She is a single mom with 8 children, and 2 of them live together in a simple structure home.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
María de 25 años de edad, reside en San Carlos departamento de Morazán, vive con sus tres hijos y su esposo, se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo y primera necesidad, también vende pupusas.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos como maíz, arroz, azúcar y frijoles, esta inversión le permitirá tener una mejor variedad en la tienda y ofrecer a los clientes un mejor servicio y atención.
Los propósitos de María es ayudar a sus hijos para que se superen y mejorar también su casa.
texts.en:
María is 25 years old and lives in San Carlos in the Department of Morazán with her husband and three children. She works selling consumer goods and basic necessities, such as pupusas (a traditional Salvadoran dish).

She is currently requesting a loan for the purchase of products like corn, rice, sugar and beans. This investment will allow to have a greater variety of products in her store and to provide better service to her customers.

María’s goals are to help her children to get ahead in life and to make housing improvements.

loans.use: to buy products like corn, rice, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Rosa Magdalena

texts.es:
Doña Rosa, reside en San Miguel, tiene 44 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de tamales y costura, vive con su hijo de siete años; de este negocio depende ella y sus hijos.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, esta compra es de productos necesarios para hacer los tamales (maíz, pollo, condimentos), con la que pretende aumentar el inventario y también la producción.  
Doña Rosa, tiene como objetivo instalar su propio negocio y estar libre de los financiamientos.
texts.en:
Rosa, 44, lives in San Miguel.  She sells tamales and is a Seamstress.  She lives with her seven year old son.  She and her children depend on this business.

She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise needed to make tamales (corn, chicken, condiments) to increase inventory and production.

Rosa’s objective is to set up her own business and to be free of financing.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make tamales.

loans.name: Jose Eliseo

texts.es:
Don José, tiene 56 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos de 15 años de edad, son gemelas, él se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado y al cultivo agrícola, este ultimo lo realiza hace 30 años y la comercialización de ganado la está realizando hace 5 años, trabaja todos los días desde las 5:00am hasta las 6:00pm, es muy conocido en la zona y eso le permite tener clientela.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para el pago del alquiler de terreno y también en la preparación de la tierra,  pues luego iniciara la temporada del cultivo de maíz, este préstamo le ayudara a tener el terreno seguro donde sembrar y con anticipación ir preparándolo, este trabajo es el que le da a don José el sustento para su familia, aunque siempre se corren riesgos por algunos desastres naturales.
Su objetivo es mantener a su familia a través de los ingresos que le genera su trabajo, también dispone de energías para trabajar la tierra ya que es un trabajo de mucho agrado para él.
texts.en:
José, 56, lives in El Transito, San Miguel Department, with his wife and two children who are 15 year old twin girls.  He is a farmer and cattleman.  He has been a farmer for 30 years and has been a livestock merchant for the last five years.  He works every day from 5am until 6pm.  He is very well known in the area and that allows for a good clientele.

He is asking for a loan to pay to lease farmland and also for the preparation of the soil to start a new season of corn farming.  This loan will make it possible for him to have an assured piece of land ahead of time to prepare.  This work is what produces what José needs in order to support his family although unforeseen risks are always possible due to natural disasters.

His goal is to support his family through income generated by his work.  He also has the energy necessary to work the land since this is very enjoyable work for him.

loans.use: to lease a field and to prepare the soil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy popsicles, sorbets, cookies and snacks.

loans.name: B. En Desarrollo 1 Group

texts.en:
Guillermina began with a small investment when she received her first loan from Esperanza. She will use the ninth loan to buy apparel. She will use her earnings to buy other necessities for her home, like a computer that her children need as well as for her business. Now, she will also save to build a future place for her business, as she wants to have a successful business. Her main goal is to have an improved business and give her family a more stable life. She loves to read the word. 

Guillermina is one of the members of Group B developing 1, made up of 5 micro businesswomen selling clothing, miscellaneous products, shoes, handicrafts, etc. She works in Samana, an up and coming tourist city on the Atlantic coast that is rich in natural resources. She is associated with Esperanza International, and she began about 6 years ago and currently is very excited about receiving the 11th loan after having satisfactorily paid back the previous ones. Guillermina is the mother of 3 children, and they live together with her long-term partner.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Doña Domitila, es una señora de 64 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, posee un negocio al que nombra “Tienda Tila”, ella vive con su hermana, en su negocio ofrece artículos de primera necesidad y consumo, también hacen tortillas para vender.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercadería para el negocio, para abastecer el inventario y ofrecer a los clientes diversidad de productos necesarios para el hogar como aceite, arroz, embutidos, bebidas y pan.
Esta ayuda mejorara sus ventas y por consiguiente sus ingresos, estabilizando su condición económica y continuando con su comercio.
texts.en:
Domitila, 64, is a woman living in San Miguel.  She has a business called “Tienda Tila.” She lives with her sister.  Her store stocks basic need and consumption items; they also make tortillas to sell.

She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise for the store to stock inventory and offer customers a variety of products that are needed in the home, such as oil, rice, sausage, drinks and bread .

This help will improve sales and thus income stabilizing her economic situation and keeping her in business.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, drinks, sausage and bread.

loans.name: Doris Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doña Doris, es comerciante, posee un negocio D. fruta y verdura, tiene 45 años D. edad, vive con su familia, tiene dos hijos D. 15 y 16 años D. edad, residen en San Miguel,  el negocio lo tiene instalado en el mercado D. la Cruz hace ya 13 años, ella tiene experiencia en el negocio.
Actualmente doña Doris está solicitando un préstamo, el cual necesita para comprar mercadería (frutas y verduras), ella pretenD. aumentar su inventario y ofrecer a la clientela diversidad D. productos frescos, agradándolos y teniendo mejores oportunidades D. venta.
Su objetivo es trabajar siempre, ayudar a su familia y potenciar cada día el negocio para mejorarlo y ampliarlo.
texts.en:
Doris runs a business selling fruits and vegetables. She is 45 years old and lives with her family. She has two sons who are 15 and 16 years old, and they live in San Miguel. Doris has had a stand in the Cruz market for 13 years, so she has business experience. 

Doris is now asking for a loan to buy merchandise (fruits and vegetables). She would like to increase her inventory and offer her clients a wider variety of fresh products in order to increase sales. 

Her goal is to continue working, to help her family, and to make her business stronger by improving and expanding it.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (fruits and vegetables).

loans.name: Raimundo

texts.es:
Raimundo, tiene un negocio donde vende maquinaria y equipo de oficina, reside en Usulután, donde vive con su familia, su esposa y dos hijos, Raimundo tiene 39 años e inicio como comerciante por iniciativa propia ya que curso un técnico en programación analista, este estudio lo impulso para instalar su propio negocio, tiene un horario de 8:00am a 5:00pm, pero actualmente necesita financiamiento para comprar maquinaria y equipo de oficina.
Este préstamo le ayudara a realizar la inversión y contara con mejor maquinaria y equipo para fortalecer el negocio. Su objetivo es ampliar el negocio, contar con una línea de productos para ofrecer a los clientes y en su familia pues velar por su tranquilidad.
texts.en: Raimundo runs an office supplies business.  He lives in Usulután with his family; his wife and two kids.  Raimundo is 39 years old and got started in business on his own initiative after studying to be a program analyst.  His studies are what drove him to open his own business, which maintains hours from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm.  Raimundo is currently in need of a loan in order to invest in better office supplies, which will strengthen his business.  His goals are to broaden his business, acquire a line of products that he can offer to his clients and take care of his family’s well-being.

loans.use: To purchase office supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to be able to buy basic needs food products

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro Antonio H. vive en la ciudad de Medellín y hace 28 años trabaja como vendedor ambulante por las calles del centro de esta ciudad. Pedro aprendió empíricamente de este oficio y le ha dedicado su vida al comercio informal de dulces, cigarrillos y chicles trabajando largas jornadas sin descansos desde las 8 am hasta las 7pm. Con este trabajo ha sostenido a su familia y gracias a su negocio en la calle fue que conoció a su esposa con la que tiene 4 hijos y quien también es vendedora ambulante.
 
Como Pedro quiere crecer su negocio y poder tener más surtido de productos, ha decidido acceder a un préstamo con el fin de capitalizarse. Las ganancias que obtenga le servirán para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y arreglar su casa la cual se encuentra en muy mal estado actualmente.
texts.en:
Pedro Antonio H. lives in the city of Medellín where for 28 years he has been a peddlar throughout the streets in the city center.  Pedro learned his trade very well and has dedicated his life to selling sweets, cigarettes and chewing gum.  He works tirelessly from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.  With his earnings he is able to support his family and thanks to his job in the street he was able to meet his wife, who is also a peddlar, with whom he has four children.

Since Pedro wants to expand his business to offer a wider variety of products he decided to ask for a loan to buy assorted sweets.  He plans to use his earnings to improve his lifestyle and carry out some household repairs his home is in need of.

loans.use: To buy assorted sweets

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es: Evangelina, de 44 años, es una mujer cautelosa y muy emprendedora. Vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su esposo Melitón que es cobrador de buses, de 47 años y sus 2 hijos de los 4 que tiene en total. Hace más de 5 años, vende sus productos de belleza tras haberse dedicado antes al bordado de chompas,  actividad que aún lo realiza. Ella disfruta mucho de su trabajo ya que le gusta la interrelación con la gente y asesorar que tipo de cosmético deben comprar. Por ello siempre carga en su bolso algún catalogo, para sugerir a la gente que conocer o a los clientes que tiene y que son las madres de los amigos de su hijo. De esta manera no emplea tiempo adicional en ello, y más bien capta nuevos compradores, haciendo que su negocio le resulte rentable. Solo que a veces, corre el riesgo que no le pagan a tiempo los recientes clientes, siendo así una perdida de tiempo los cobros. Pero, a pesar de ello, no se amilana en este negocio, por ello ahora su mayor urgencia es de abastecerse de más mercadería, y con el tiempo desea comprarse una maquina de coser e instalar su taller de confecciones en su casa. Es su 22avo crédito que tiene con MFP, y dice “que confíen en ella y estén seguros que pagará todas sus cuotas puntualmente como lo hacia ”, ya que le gustaría contar con posteriores ayudas. De obtener el crédito que solicita, comprará más productos de belleza, para abastecer sus pedidos pendientes que tiene.
texts.en:
Evangelina is 44 years old and is a very prudent entrepreneur.  She lives in her own home with her husband, Melitón, a bus conductor who is 42, and two of their four children.  For more than five years she has been selling beauty products.  Before that she embroidered sweaters, which she still does.

She enjoys her work and interacting and counseling people on what type of cosmetics they should buy.  She always carries with her catalogues so she can make suggestions to her customers, who usually are the mothers of her son's friends.  She doesn't have to spend a lot of time at her job and is always meeting new customers so business is profitable.  Sometimes she runs the risk of not being paid punctually by new customers, so she must take time to go around making collections.

But despite the obstacles she does not shy away from her business.  One of her most pressing issues is to buy more merchandise so that at some point in the future she can buy a sewing machine and set up a dress shop in her home.  This is her 22nd loan through MFP and she says: "they trust her and are sure whe will pay it back on time as she always has done", since she would like to count on future loans.  She plans to use the loan to buy more beauty products so she can supply the pending orders she has.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products

loans.name: Diana Lizeth

texts.es: Diana es una persona que trabaja como maestra y directora en un Jardín de niños   ella y su esposo tienen una pequeña hija  y donde viven  actualmente les esta haciendo falta el portón del frente del domicilio ellos han decidido instalar este portón por la seguridad de su pequeña hija ya que en ocasiones se sale de la casa y como es muy pequeña, ellos temen que en algún momento pase algún auto a alta velocidad y pueda  ocasionar  un accidente  donde   su  hija se   encuentre  perjudicada.
texts.en: Diana works as a teacher and director of a kindergarten and she and her husband have a young daughter.  Their house has no gate out front so they have decided to install one for their daughter's safety.  She is still very small and sometimes leaves the house and they are afraid a speeding car could pass by and cause an accident involving their daughter.
