This has generated greater demand for his services so he has decided to invest in his small business to be able to help more customers.  For this reason he is asking for a loan to buy tools such as keys, oil, pliers, and others.  In this way he can meet his customers' demands and, at the same time, earn more money and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: To buy tools such as keys, oil, pliers, and others.

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es: Karla Vanesa tiene 35 años, ella tiene un negocio que es la venta de ropa, el cual está ubicado de manera ambulante. Hace más de 2 años que trabaja por cuenta propia, sin embargo tiene gran competencia, pero ella ha manejado muy bien su negocio, ya que la mayoría de sus clientes son jóvenes y siempre está buscando la amanera de complacerlos con lo que le solicitan. El financiamiento es para la compra de camisas, trajes de baño, shorts, faldas, vestidos, trajes entre otros productos. Su sueño siempre ha sido agrandar más su negocio para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Karla Vanesa is 35 years old and has a business as a traveling clothing saleswoman.  She has been working for herself for more than two years.  However, there is a lot of competition, but she has run her business very well.  The majority of her customers are young and she is always looking to satisfy them with the products they request from her.  The loan will be used to buy shirts, swimsuits, shorts, skirts, dresses, suits, and other products.  Her dream has always been to enlarge her business to provide a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: buy shirts, swimsuits, shorts, skirts, dresses, suits, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: in his business selling fruits: apples, pears, bananas, grapes, pineapple, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her tortilla stand in downtown San Salvador

loans.name: Cristela Del Socorro

texts.es: Cristela Del Socorro, desde hace mas de 6 años que se dedica a la crianza y destace de cerdo, por lo que inicio como su principal fuente de ingresos ya que así elabora los diferentes productos como frito, pepena entre otros derivados del cerdo, pues es por medio de su familia que ella decide incursionar en este negocio. El financiamiento que solicita actualmente es para la compra de 4 cerdos por lo que tiene que recorrer grandes distancias en ciertas comunidades para obtener precios favorables. El sueño de ella es mantener este negocio activo que es su principal fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Cristela Del Socorro has been raising and butchering pigs for over six years.  She started doing this as her primary source of income because she makes different pork products like fried pork and “pepena” (pork intestine).  She decided to get into this business through her family.

The loan she is now requesting is to buy four pigs.  She needs to travel far to get to certain communities in order to get good prices.

Her dream is to keep her business active; it is her main source of income.

loans.use: to buy four pigs

loans.name: Alicia Noemy

texts.es: Alicia Noemy D. L., habita en casa propia junto con su hijo y nuera. Como toda mujer emprendedora tiene su propio negocio D. costura en el Municipio D. Santa Tecla del Departamento D. La Libertad que con muchos esfuerzos ha logrado establecer. Tiene 5 años D. experiencia en la costura y diseña cualquier tipo D. prenda D. vestir que los clientes soliciten tales como faldas, vestidos, pantalones etc. Este negocio ha sido para Alicia su principal fuente D. ingreso y sigue confiando que así seguirá siendo. En este negocio lo  más importante es dejar satisfecho al cliente D. esta manera Doña Alicia se ha ganado la confianza D. los habitantes D. la zona que cada día la prefieren mas. Esta señora llena D. sueños solicita este crédito para poder invertir en material para costura: hilo, tela, elástico, botones, etc. Que le permitan ofrecer mayor cantidad y variedad D. sus estilos D. ropa. Y aspirar a mejores ventas e ingresos para poder cubrir sus necesidades y vivir mas tranquila.
texts.en:
Alicia Noemy D. L. lives in her own house with her son and daughter-in-law.  Like all enterprising women, she has her own business.  Her seamstress business is in the Santa Tecla municipality in the La Libertad department.  It took great effort to manage to establish the business.  

She has five years of experience in dressmaking.  She designs all types of clothing like skirts, dresses, and pants, etc.  This business has been Alicia’s main source of income, and she trusts that it will continue this way.  Satisfying the customer is the most important thing in this business.  Alicia has won the trust of the inhabitants of the area.  Every day they prefer her more and more.

This woman, who is full of dreams, is requesting this loan to be able to buy sewing materials like thread, fabric, elastic, and buttons, etc.  This will allow her to offer a greater quantity and variety of clothing styles.  She aspires to have greater sales and income in order to be able to cover her expenses and have greater peace of mind.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials like thread, fabric, elastic, and buttons, etc. to make skirts, dresses, and pants, etc.

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica, de 38 años, es una mujer vanidosa y muy amable. Es separada, vive en casa de su madre en compañía de ella y de sus  hijos de 15 y 8 años por quienes se esfuerza por salir adelante. Desde hace 8 años, apoya en la atención de la bodega de su madre, por lo que es anciana. En todo este tiempo ella también fue invirtiendo, en la adquisición y el incremento de cervezas, y las gaseosas y galletas, son productos y negocio de su madre. Además, de esta actividad, 3 veces a la semana trabaja por las noches, en un taller de serigrafía, en busca de más ingresos a su hogar. Pero el sábado y domingo, a tiempo completo se dedica a su negocio, por ser días de mucha venta desde 15 a 20 cajas de cerveza, resultándole así muy rentable. De esta manera con su madre, ambas se apoyan y tratan de salir adelante. Pero, para está temporada, a sus amigas le han ofrecido vender el paquete completo de útiles escolares, del colegio de sus hijos, y para ello requiere de dinero, y está muy segura, que captará buena rentas, y para el futuro piensa instalar un restaurante, en el mismo local de su tienda. Es el noveno crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, ya que quiere cumplir con todas las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permite continuar trabajando. De obtener el crédito que solicita, comprará cuadernos y todos los útiles escolares, para distribuir a sus amigas y le paguen en partes.
texts.en:
Mónica, 38 years old, is a very friendly women and takes pride in her appearance. She is separated and lives in her mother's house with her mom and her children ages 15 and 8 for whom she works so they can get ahead. 

For 8 years she has helped with her mother's store because she is very old. Throughout this time she also began investing in the acquisition and the increase in beer, soft drinks and biscuits, products of her mother's business. In addition to this job, she works 3 nights a week in a printing workshop in search of more revenue for the home. On Saturday and Sunday she is dedicated full time to her business by having days of heavy selling from 15-20 cases of beer, which is very profitable.

In this manner with her mother, both are supportive of each other and try to get ahead. For this season, she is offering to sell to her friends the complete package of school supplies for their children. This requires money and she is sure that she will get a good income and the future plan is to install a restaurant on the premises of her shop.
 
This is her 9th loan with MFP and she promises to pay her dues punctually, since she wants to honor all of the people who made it possible for her to continue working. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy folders and other school supplies to distribute to her friends and they will pay her in parts.

loans.use: To buy folders and school supplies for her respective sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve the tortilla stand in her home

loans.name: Morena Idalia

texts.es: Morena Idalia A.  D. O., D. 57 años D. edad. Habita en su casa con su esposo e hija que ya es mayor D. edad. Como toda mujer trabajadora y luchadora Doña Morena ha logrado a través D. muchos esfuerzos establecer una tiendita en Ciudad Delgado del Departamento D. San Salvador. Ella trabaja D. lleno en su tienda para poder atender a sus clientes cuando necesiten D. sus productos los cuales son: golosinas, pan dulce, azúcar, macarrones, juguetes, productos D. belleza etc. DepenD. mucho D. su negocio y tiene muchas aspiraciones con las ventas que realiza. Por lo que ha decidido solicitar este crédito para invertirlo en su tienda y poder comprar mayor variedad D. productos e innovar su negocio ya que es una mujer emprendedora sabe que debe estar al día con las demandas del mercado para así poder seguir manteniéndolo activo. Con esto espera poder obtener los recursos necesarios para vivir en mejores condiciones junto con su familia.
texts.en:
57-year old Morena Idalia A. D. O. lives with her husband and adult daughter. Like all hardworking strong women, Doña Morena has managed to overcome problems and open her own store in Ciudad Delgado in the department of San Salvador. She works tirelessly in the store to serve her customers with all their needs such as candy, pan dulce (traditional bread), sugar, macaroni, toys, beauty products etc.

She depends greatly on income from the store and has many plans for the money she earns. For that reason, Morena decided to seek a loan to buy a greater variety of products and breathe new life into the store. As she is an enterprising woman she knows that she has to keep on top of what her customers are looking for. Morena hopes that her revitalized store will enable her to afford a better standard of living for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy candy, pan dulce, sugar, macaroni, toys, beauty products etc

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” VILCANOTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba,  perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maruja; la socia tiene 44 años de edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de frazadas para las camas ella vende de plaza y media y de dos plazas, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le trae muchas satisfacciones ya que mediante este trabajo ella saca a su familia adelante, la socia trabaja a pedido ella compra su mercadería para luego venderlo a sus clientes que son sus amistades, familiares y vecinos ,la socia es una persona bien alegre y responsable.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar de mas mercadería de frazadas para así poder tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "VILCANOTA" communal bank which is located in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

Mrs. Maruja is 44 years old, married and has two children.  She alternates her daily activity with the purchase and sale of blankets.  She sells twin and double bed sizes.  She has been involved in this business for several years and enjoys what she does while making a living to support her family.

She works on an order basis, buying the merchandise which she later sells to customers who are mainly friends, family and neighbors.  She is a cheerful, responsible person.

She is requesting a loan to buy more blankets to offer a wider variety to customers.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy more blankets and offer a wider variety to customers

loans.name: Susana Filomena

texts.es: Susana Filomena tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000. Por lo que ha sido una persona muy responsable. Ella se dedica a la venta de refrescos, gaseosas y jugos. Tiene más de 12 años de poseer este negocio, en donde la mayoría de sus clientes conocen el buen carisma de Susana.  En lo particular doña Susana es una persona seria y responsable, tiene en su casa lo necesario y su mayor deseo es seguir creciendo con su negocio. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de jugos, gaseosas, refrescos naturales, entre otros.
texts.en: Susana Filomena has worked with Kiva partner Fundación León 2000 for a long time as she has been a very responsible client. She has earned her living selling soft drinks, pop, and juice for more than 12 years. The majority of her customers know that she is a charismatic person, and at the same time she is serious and responsible. Her home contains all the basics; her greatest wish is to continue expanding her business. The loan she is seeking will be used to buy fruit juices, soft drinks, natural drinks etc.

loans.use: to buy fruit juices, soft drinks, natural drinks etc

loans.name: Víctor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor Manuel D. P., vive con su esposa y tres hijos. Ha trabajado durante toda su vida para poder darle a su familia un mejor bienestar económico. Logro que sus hijos pudieran estudiar hasta el bachillerato y ahora trabajan junto a él  ya que no le es posible pagarles una Universidad para que sigan estudiando. Don Víctor tiene un puesto de cereales y verduras en el mercado Municipal  de Sonsonate. Este lugar es estratégico ya que es muy transitado por los habitantes y sobre todo el puesto de Don Víctor ya que siempre trata de mantener variedad de productos al mejor precio y calidad. Es un vendedor amigable y atento con los clientes esto lo ha hecho muy popular y muchas personas lo buscan para comprar sus productos tales como: azúcar sal, macarrones, ajos, tomates, cebollas, etc. Este señor sueña con mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia y sabe que este negocio es la única fuente de ingresos por lo que ha decidido solicitar este préstamo para comprar una mayor cantidad de productos y mantener abastecido su negocio con los cereales y verduras más demandadas en el mercado.
texts.en:
Victor lives with his wife and 3 children.  He has worked all his life to be able to give his family a better standard of living.  He made it possible for his children to study through high school and now they work with him, since it is not possible to pay for them to attend university and continue studying.

Victor has a cereal and vegetable stall in the Municipal Market of Sonsonate.  His place is strategically located and is very much transited by the inhabitants and, above all, Victor's stall always tries to maintain a variety of products of the best price and quality.

He is a friendly and attentive vendor with his customers; this has made him very popular and many people look for him when buying products like sugar, salt, pasta, garlic, tomatoes, onions, etc.

Victor dreams of improving his condition of life and that of his family, and knows that this business is the only source of income.  For that reason, he has decided to request a loan to buy a larger quantity of products and keep his business well supplied with the cereals and vegetables most in demand in the marketplace.

loans.use: TO BUY CEREALS, VEGETABLES, SUGAR, SALT, PASTA, GARLIC, TOMATOES, ONIONS, ETC., TO SELL

loans.name: Neri

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” VILCANOTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba,  perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Neri; la socia tiene 44 años de edad, separada y tiene 4 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende lo que son productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche también vende otro tipo de productos como golosinas,gaseosas,aceite,fideos entre otros, la socia lleva ya un buen tiempo en este negocio el cual trabaja conjuntamente con su cuñada, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante por sus hijos que son lo más importante que ella tiene.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar de más mercadería para la tienda de abarrotes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "VILCANOTA" communal bank which is located in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

Mrs. Neri is 44 years old, separated and has four children.  She alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business.  She sells staple goods such as rice, sugar and milk and other items such as sweets, sodas, oil, pasta etc.  She has been in this business for some time now, together with her sister-in-law.  She is a cheerful person and determined to get ahead because her children are what matter most to her.

She is requesting a loan to buy more goods for her grocery store.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy grocery store goods

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos H. G. de 40 años de edad, vive con su  hijo de tan solo 14 años de vida, en una pequeña casita que alquila ya que no cuenta con casa propia. Santos es una mujer luchadora que con su trabajo ha sacado adelante a su hijo el cual se encuentra estudiando. Esta mujer sueña con ver a su hijo realizado profesionalmente y pide a Dios que le de la fuerzas necesarias para poder seguir ayudándole en lo que pueda. Una gran mujer valiente y emprendedora se dedica  a la venta de verduras en el centro de San Salvador, tiene un puesto en el que ofrece todo tipo de verduras como: zanahorias, papas, repollos, chile verde, entre otros. Sus productos son muy demandados ya que siempre trata la manera de mantener productos frescos y sobre todo atender a sus clientes de la mejor manera. Es por esta razón que solicita a INTEGRAL este crédito para poder abastecer su pequeño negocio y así poder ofrecer mayor variedad de verduras y lograr obtener mayores ventas que le permitan sostenerse económicamente y seguir ayudando a su hijo a superarse.
texts.en:
Santos H. G. is 40 years old.  She lives with her son, who is only 14, in a small house that they rent since they don't own their own home.  Santos is a real fighter who, through her work, has managed to get her son ahead in life.  He is currently studying.

This woman dreams of seeing her son become a professional and she asks God for the strength she needs to continue helping him as best she can.  Santos is a courageous and enterprising woman who sells vegetables in the center of San Salvador.  She has a stall where she offers all types of vegetables such as carrots, potatoes, cabbages, green chilis, etc.  Her products are very much in demand since she always keeps her products fresh and provides good customer service. 

Santos is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL so that she can stock her small business and thereby offer a larger variety of vegetables for sale.  In this way she will make more sales which will allow her to support herself financially and continue helping her son to improve himself.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as carrots, potatoes, cabbages, green chilis, etc.

loans.name: Rebeca Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” VILCANOTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Urubamba,  perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rebeca Yolanda; la socia tiene 67 años D. edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. manualidades ella elabora lo que son manteles, bordados, pisos D. alfombra entre otros más, la socia trabaja desD. su casa y venD. sus trabajos D. forma independiente y trabaja a pedido vendiendo sus trabajos a sus amistades, la socia es profesora cesante y se dedico a este negocio que D. paso le sirve D. distracción la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas D. seguir adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar D. material para su negocio como hilos, telas, entre otros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "VILCANOTA" communal bank which is located in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

Mrs. Rebeca Yolanda is 67 years old, married and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with her embroidery business in which she makes tablecloths, embroidered linens, rug accessories, etc.  She works from home and sells her products on an order basis to friends.  Since this member is a retired teacher her job keeps her occupied.  She is a cheerful person and determined to get ahead.

The loan she is requesting is to buy thread, fabric and other supplies.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy thread, fabric and other supplies

loans.name: Entrada A Chunazaca (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Entrada a Chunazana esta formado por 11 mujeres y un hombre, viven en la comunidad de Chunazana que es de clima frió, su gente es muy amable y hospitalaria, se dedican a la cría de animales, a la agricultura y muchos salen a la ciudad a laborar en diferentes actividades, nuestras socias son personas muy trabajadoras que se sacrifican por el bienestar de sus familias.

La Señora. Martha M. vive por el sector  Entrada a Chunazana, es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue su hermanan quien la  invito a formar parte de este grupo.
 
Ella tiene 25 años, es casada  en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 9, 6, 4 y 1 año de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en una escuelita del sector. Su esposo labora como jornalero y con el trabajo en conjunto han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Martha se dedica a la cría de  cuyes, pollos, gallinas, borregos y ganado a los mismos que los vende en su comunidad.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más pollos y más animales.
 
Su meta es tener luz eléctrica en su casa.

En esta ocasión nos acompañan en la fotografía los esposos de dos socias, los cuales estan vestidos el uno con camiseta verde y el otro con una chompa azul con verde. Nuestro socio se encuentra vestido con una chaqueta negra.
texts.en:
The 'Entrada a Chunazana' community bank is made up of eleven women and one man.  They live in Chunazana community which is a cold climate area.  The local people are very kind and hospitable.  They raise animals, farm and many go to the city to work in different businesses.  The members of this group are very hard-working people who make sacrifices for the well-being of their famlies.

Martha M. lives in Chunazana sector.  This is the first loan that she has accessed through her community bank.  She was invited to join the group by her sister.  Martha is 25 years old, married, and has 4 children aged 9, 6, 4 and 1.  Her eldest two children are attending a local elementary school.  Her husband works as a laborer and, through their joint efforts, the couple have managed to build their own home.  Martha's business is raising guinea pigs, chickens, hens, lambs and other livestock which she sells in her community  She will invest her loan money in buying more chickens and more animals.  Her goal is to have electric lighting in her home.

On this occasion, two ladies' husbands are accompanying them in the photograph, one is wearing a green t-shirt and the other is wearing a blue sweater with some green.  Martha is wearing a black jacket.

loans.use: to buy chickens and other animals

loans.name: Nay Ruth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” VILCANOTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba,  perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.Nay Ruth; la socia tiene 30 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; la socia trabaja en el sector educación en el área administrativa ella trabaja de lunes a viernes por las mañanas y tardes, la socia lleva ya un buen tiempo en este trabajo que le ayuda con el sustento a su familia , a la vez la socia tiene un negocio de compra de venta de computadoras, venta de accesorios y reparación de computadoras esto lo realiza su pareja mientras que la socia lo administra ,ella es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para compra de mercadería para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "VILCANOTA" communal bank which is located in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

Mrs. Nay Ruth is 30 years old and has a common-law husband and a son.  She works Monday through Friday, mornings and afternoons, in an administrative job in the education field.  She has had the job for several years which has allowed her to help support her family.  She also has a business buying and selling computers and accessories, and repairing computers, which her partner takes care of while she is working.  She is very cheerful and determined to get ahead.

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her business.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Hugo Javier

texts.es: Hugo Javier A. de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus cuatro hijos, en Mejicanos departamento de San Salvador. El posee un puesto de refrescos en una zona peatonal muy concurrida de Mejicanos y eso le ayuda a tener mucha clientela, además el se caracteriza por ser muy servicial y la gente lo busca porque prepara los mejores refrescos del lugar, con el mejor sabor y a un buen precio; debido a esto Hugo ha tenido mucha demanda y necesita comprar más ingredientes para sus refrescos como agua, azúcar, maní,  cocos y otras frutas además utensilios como botes, bolsas, cucharas entre otros; es así como le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita obtener todo este material de trabajo. Hugo espera así lograr mantener activa su fuente de trabajo y  seguir solventando las necesidades de su hogar para dar a su familia la calidad de vida que merecen.
texts.en:
Hugo Javier A. is 44 years old.  He lives with his life companion and his four children in Mejicanos, in San Salvador department.  Hugo owns a soft drinks stall in a very busy pedestrian precinct in Mejicanos.  This means he has a lot of customers.  In addition, Hugo is very obliging and people seek him out because he prepares the best drinks in town, with the best flavor, and at a good price.  As a result, Hugo has a lot of demand and he needs to buy more ingredients for his drinks such as water, sugar, peanuts, coconut and fruit.  He also needs to buy utensils such as jars, bags, spoons, etc. 

Hugo is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow him to obtain all the supplies that he needs for his work.  He hopes that, in this way, he will manage to keep his source of work active and continue being able to cover his household needs, so that he can provide his family with the quality of life that they deserve.

loans.use: to buy water, sugar, peanuts, coconut, fruit, jars, bags and spoons

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es: María de los Ángeles M. C. de treinta y tres años de edad vive con su compañero de vida en casa propia en el departamento de San Salvador. Ella posee en su vivienda una tienda que tiene excelente ubicación por lo cual obtiene una clientela abundante durante el día, las personas la prefieren porque es una mujer muy servicial y siempre los recibe con una sonrisa, además de que tiene los mejores precios de la zona; es por eso  que María le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita abarcar la demanda y comprar más productos para surtir su tienda tales como bebidas, panes, granos básicos, embutidos, lácteos, aceite, confitería entre otros. María de los Ángeles es una mujer con sueños que se esfuerza por tener un futuro mejor y espera que este sea el medio  que solvente sus necesidades y las de su hogar permitiéndoles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María de los Ángeles M. C. is 33 years old.  She lives with her life partner in her own home, in San Salvador department.  María has a store in her home.  It is in an excellent location which means that she gets a lot of customers during the day.  People like to buy from her because she is a very obliging woman and she always greets her customers with a smile.  In addition, she offers the best prices in the area.

María is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to meet demand and buy more products with which to stock her store such as drinks, baked goods, basic grains, sausages, dairy products, oil, confectionery, etc.  María de los Ángeles is a woman with dreams who works hard for a better future.  She hopes that this is the way to cover her needs and those of her household, providing them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy drinks, baked goods, basic grains, sausages, dairy products, oil and confectionery

loans.name: Ely

texts.en:
Ely L. is from the village of Bangko, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. He is 31 years old and single. To make a living, Ely owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating tricycle transport services. Ely has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Ely joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ely is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ely from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Yolanda Elizabeth

texts.es: Yolanda Elizabeth L. D. A. D. cuarenta y tres años D. edad vive en casa propia en el departamento D. San Salvador. Ella posee como fuente D. trabajo una tienda que se encuentra ubicada en su vivienda. Yolanda siempre ha estado a disposición D. los clientes les da la mejor atención, para ella la felicidad del cliente es su lema, al tener los mejores productos con buen precio la gente prefiere comprar en su negocio y eso le ha creado más demanda es por esta razón que Yolanda se decidió a solicitar el crédito a INTEGRAL para abastecer su tienda con mas productos como cereales, medicinas, golosinas, bebidas, gas propano, entre otros. Es así como ella quiere salir adelante satisfacer sus necesidades y llevar seguridad económica a su hogar.
texts.en: Yolanda Elizabeth L. D. A. is 43 years old.  She lives in her own home in San Salvador department.  Yolanda has a store in her home where she has always been ready to help her customers with anything they need.  She offers them the best customer service because making her customers happy is her motto.  Yolanda offers the best products at the best prices so people like to shop with her.  This has created a lot of demand.  For this reason, Yolanda is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL so that she can stock her store with more products such as cereals, medicines, candies, drinks, propane gas, etc.  This is how she would like to get ahead in life, cover her needs and bring financial security to her household.

loans.use: to buy cereal, medicines, candies, drinks and propane gas

loans.name: Fernalin

texts.en:
Fernalin M. is from the village of Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old, and is married with 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Fernalin owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Fernalin has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Fernalin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fernalin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,500 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. Fernalin is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seedlings and fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Fernalin from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seedlings and fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Yanira Ana

texts.es: Yanira Ana M. R. de cuarenta y uno años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas, en el departamento de San Salvador. Ella posee una sala de belleza en su vivienda la cual es una de las principales fuentes de ingreso para su hogar; la zona es muy concurrida y como realiza un excelente trabajo a la hora de dar sus servicios tiene mucha demanda por parte de la gente, además ella para seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes también trabaja a domicilio. Yanira necesita comprar productos de belleza como cremas, espuma, vitaminas para el cabello, esmaltes, shampoo, acondicionadores  y otros importantes que pueda vender a sus clientes y al mismo tiempo le permiten mejorar la calidad de su trabajo. Yanira es mujer, madre y trabajadora entusiasta que espera que su trabajo le permita sacar adelante a sus hijas y así mantener la calidad de vida de su hogar.
texts.en:
Yanira Ana M. R. is 41 years old.  She lives with her husband and two daughters in San Salvador department.  Yanira has a beauty salon in her home which is one of the main sources of income for her household.  Her area is very busy and, as she does excellent work, there is a lot of demand for her services.  In order to continue meeting the needs of her customers, she also works in people's homes. 

Yanira needs to buy beauty products such as creams, foam, hair vitamins, nail polish, shampoo, conditioners and other important products that she sells to her customers and which also allow her to improve the quality of her work.  Yanira is a hard-working and enthusiastic woman and mother who hopes that her work will enable her to get her daughters ahead in life and also help support her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy creams, foam, hair vitamins, nail polish, shampoo and conditioners

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma P. is from the village of Matugas Alto,Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Norma is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Norma raises cows for sale. Norma has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Norma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Norma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy lipsticks, clothes and accessories such as bracelets and badges

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine I. is from the village of Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 48 years old. Josephine is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, junk foods, breads, candies, shampoo, soap and beverages in the local community. She also buys and sells rice per kilogram, generic drugs, and multivitamins. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase an additional sack of rice and a variety of junk foods for her store. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Josephine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional sack of rice and a variety of junk foods

location.town: Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin C. is from the village of Casinglot, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 44 years old. Jasmin is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Jasmin owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling ready to wear clothing and beauty products from "Personal Care" and "Natasha" in the local community. Jasmin has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Jasmin joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jasmin is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like blouses and t-shirts. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Jasmin from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like blouses & t-shirts

loans.name: Kharine

texts.en:
Kharine C. is from the village of Casinglot, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 18 years old. Kharine is single and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Kharine owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling specialty food products like homemade sausages and dried fish in the local community. Kharine has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Kharine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Kharine is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed like spices and pork. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Kharine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed like spices & pork

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, drinks, sausages, seafood and flour

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon C. is from the village of San Antonio, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 53 years old. Corazon is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Corazon owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing hairdressing and beauty services in her beauty parlor to local community members. Corazon has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Corazon joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service, like hair solutions. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Corazon from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase hair solutions needed to provide service

loans.name: René

texts.es: René H. de cincuenta y cinco años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos los cuales asisten a la escuela. Él junto a su esposa quieren hacer crecer el pequeño negocio que poseen en su vivienda ubicada en San Salvador, una tienda que les está ayudando a solventar sus necesidades. René tiene grandes aspiraciones y con su actitud quiere dar a sus hijos un ejemplo a seguir, que les ayude a salir adelante en la vida. Es así como se decidió a solicitar a INTEGRAL un crédito con el que podrá comprar más productos como granos básicos, confitería, cereales, embutidos, bebidas entre otros para así mantener a sus clientes y atraer a nuevos. René con el apoyo de su compañera de vida tienen la confianza que así podrán dar a sus hijos una vida plena.
texts.en:
René H., 55, lives with his life companion and three children who go to school.  Together with his wife he wants to help his small, home-based business located in San Salvador grow; it’s a small store that is helping them meet their needs.  René has large expectations and with his attitude wants to be a good example for his children to follow; that will help them get ahead in life.

This is why he decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL that he will use to buy more products like: basic grains, sweets, cereals, cured meats and beverages, among others, in order to keep his current customers and attract new ones.

With his life companion’s support René is confident that they will be able to provide a fulfilled life for their children.

loans.use: to buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie B. is from the village of Hinigdaan, El Salvador City, Misamis Oriental. She is 35 years old. Rosie is married and has 3 infant children. To make a living, Rosie owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling tobacco in the local community. In the picture is Rosie and her husband providing motorela or habal-habal services. Rosie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Rosie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosie is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional tobacco. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

loans.name: Elmer Dagoberto

texts.es: Elmer Dagoberto G. con cuarenta y seis años de edad vive junto a su esposa, su hija y su cuñada en casa propia,  ubicada en San Martin departamento de San Salvador; Él es un vendedor de billetes de Lotería y todos los días sale de su casa muy temprano hacia la zona de San Salvador a ganarse el pan de cada día ofreciendo dichos billetes; últimamente su situación económica ha sido más difícil y no le ha permitido solventar todas sus necesidades; es por eso que se decidió a solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL con el cual comprara más billetes de lotería que podrá ofrecerle a sus clientes. El confía que así lograra salir adelante económicamente y dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elmer Dagoberto G., 46, lives with his wife, daughter and a sister-in-law in his own house located in San Martin, San Salvador Department.  He sells lottery tickets.  He leaves home very early every day and heads toward San Salvador to earn his daily bread selling said tickets.

His economic situation has been more difficult lately and he hasn’t been able to meet all his needs.  This is why he decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to buy more lottery tickets to offer his customers.  He trusts that he will be able to get ahead economically this way and provide his family with improved quality of life.

loans.use: to buy lottery tickets.

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
Mira B. is 40 years old, married, and has two children ages 18 and 12.  In 2005, she established her grocery store business.  Working seven days a week, eight hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy groceries.  In the future, Mira hopes to improve the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margain.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 square feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates at BPW Partner Page. Join our lending team, BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for her shop

loans.name: Sanu

texts.en:
This is 45 year-old Sanu T..  She is married and has two children aged 23 and 21.  In 2000, she established her vegetable farming business.  Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid a loan from Kiva partner Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farming.  In the future, Sanu plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.   

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence farming and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional material or sewing machines which will increase production and profitability.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna E. is from the village of New Compostela, Damulog, Bukidnon. She is 39 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for sale. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Myrna joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Song

texts.en: Song C. is married and lives with her husband in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorean temples. C. is a weaver, earning an income of USD $2.5 per day. Her husband is employed at a construction material factory, earning an income of USD $2.5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD $20 on food and USD $50 on other necessary expenses. C. is requesting a loan of USD $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for family use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita E. is from the village of San Ramon. She is 20 years old, married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Emelita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector preparing and selling barbecue pork and chicken. Emelita has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2011, Emelita joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Chy

texts.en:
Chy T., 32, is a married woman blessed with four single children. All of them are students in the local public school. Her husband's name is Nhoern. He is 37, and he is a firewood seller in and around his village in Kompong Tom province. 

Chy T. has built a pigpen behind her house, where she raises many pigs to earn a living. Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for Chy T. and her family, Chy T. has requested a loan in order to buy additional piglets to raise for sale.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise for sale

loans.name: Shamshad's Group

texts.en:
Shamshad is a widow who started sewing clothes after the death of her husband to fulfill the basic needs of her family. She works for members of her community and fulfills their orders to earn profits. She is a very hardworking lady. Along with her sewing business, she also manages her household duties very well. 

She has given birth to two sons. Her eldest son sells refrigerators, new and used, on installments, so those persons who can’t afford to pay the full amount buy from him on installments. Her youngest son has a cosmetics-sales business. Shamshad couldn’t provide her children an education due to poor financial conditions. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her eldest son’s business. With the loan, he will buy fridges to sell through his shop. He has solid experience in his business and handles a good clientele base. Shamshad hopes that an investment will bring better profits to him and will expand his business. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah, and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she proved herself as a responsible client who always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.
 
She lives in Borewala, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there, in the small colony named Habib colony, in a two-room brick house with her family for the past 10 years.

loans.use: to buy fridges for selling on installments

loans.name: Analiza's Group

texts.en:
Analiza B. is from the village of San Francisco, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 33 years old. Analiza is the group leader of an 11-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Analiza is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Analiza owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from making "puto" (rice cakes) and other delicacies for sale. Analiza has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Analiza joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analiza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional ingredients to make more products for sale. Analiza is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Analiza from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.
